5258 
5259 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_dawsn_loops[4]
5260 cdef void *ufunc_dawsn_ptr[8]
5261 cdef void *ufunc_dawsn_data[4]
5262 cdef char ufunc_dawsn_types[8]
5263 cdef char *ufunc_dawsn_doc = (
5264     "dawsn(x, out=None)\n"
5265     "\n"
5266     "Dawson's integral.\n"
5267     "\n"
5268     "Computes::\n"
5269     "\n"
5270     "    exp(-x**2) * integral(exp(t**2), t=0..x).\n"
5271     "\n"
5272     "Parameters\n"
5273     "----------\n"
5274     "x : array_like\n"
5275     "    Function parameter.\n"
5276     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
5277     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
5278     "\n"
5279     "Returns\n"
5280     "-------\n"
5281     "y : scalar or ndarray\n"
5282     "    Value of the integral.\n"
5283     "\n"
5284     "See Also\n"
5285     "--------\n"
5286     "wofz, erf, erfc, erfcx, erfi\n"
5287     "\n"
5288     "References\n"
5289     "----------\n"
5290     ".. [1] Steven G. Johnson, Faddeeva W function implementation.\n"
5291     "   http://ab-initio.mit.edu/Faddeeva\n"
5292     "\n"
5293     "Examples\n"
5294     "--------\n"
5295     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
5296     ">>> from scipy import special\n"
5297     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
5298     ">>> x = np.linspace(-15, 15, num=1000)\n"
5299     ">>> plt.plot(x, special.dawsn(x))\n"
5300     ">>> plt.xlabel('$x$')\n"
5301     ">>> plt.ylabel('$dawsn(x)$')\n"
5302     ">>> plt.show()")
5303 ufunc_dawsn_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
5304 ufunc_dawsn_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
5305 ufunc_dawsn_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_F_F
5306 ufunc_dawsn_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_D_D
5307 ufunc_dawsn_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5308 ufunc_dawsn_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5309 ufunc_dawsn_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5310 ufunc_dawsn_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5311 ufunc_dawsn_types[4] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5312 ufunc_dawsn_types[5] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5313 ufunc_dawsn_types[6] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5314 ufunc_dawsn_types[7] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5315 ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_dawsn
5316 ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"dawsn")
5317 ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_dawsn
5318 ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"dawsn")
5319 ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_dawsn_complex
5320 ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"dawsn")
5321 ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_dawsn_complex
5322 ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"dawsn")
5323 ufunc_dawsn_data[0] = &ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*0]
5324 ufunc_dawsn_data[1] = &ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*1]
5325 ufunc_dawsn_data[2] = &ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*2]
5326 ufunc_dawsn_data[3] = &ufunc_dawsn_ptr[2*3]
5327 dawsn = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_dawsn_loops, ufunc_dawsn_data, ufunc_dawsn_types, 4, 1, 1, 0, "dawsn", ufunc_dawsn_doc, 0)
5328 
5329 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_elliprc_loops[4]
5330 cdef void *ufunc_elliprc_ptr[8]
5331 cdef void *ufunc_elliprc_data[4]
5332 cdef char ufunc_elliprc_types[12]
5333 cdef char *ufunc_elliprc_doc = (
5334     "elliprc(x, y, out=None)\n"
5335     "\n"
5336     "Degenerate symmetric elliptic integral.\n"
5337     "\n"
5338     "The function RC is defined as [1]_\n"
5339     "\n"
5340     ".. math::\n"
5341     "\n"
5342     "    R_{\\mathrm{C}}(x, y) =\n"
5343     "       \\frac{1}{2} \\int_0^{+\\infty} (t + x)^{-1/2} (t + y)^{-1} dt\n"
5344     "       = R_{\\mathrm{F}}(x, y, y)\n"
5345     "\n"
5346     "Parameters\n"
5347     "----------\n"
5348     "x, y : array_like\n"
5349     "    Real or complex input parameters. `x` can be any number in the\n"
5350     "    complex plane cut along the negative real axis. `y` must be non-zero.\n"
5351     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
5352     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
5353     "\n"
5354     "Returns\n"
5355     "-------\n"
5356     "R : scalar or ndarray\n"
5357     "    Value of the integral. If `y` is real and negative, the Cauchy\n"
5358     "    principal value is returned. If both of `x` and `y` are real, the\n"
5359     "    return value is real. Otherwise, the return value is complex.\n"
5360     "\n"
5361     "See Also\n"
5362     "--------\n"
5363     "elliprf : Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the first kind.\n"
5364     "elliprd : Symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5365     "elliprg : Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5366     "elliprj : Symmetric elliptic integral of the third kind.\n"
5367     "\n"
5368     "Notes\n"
5369     "-----\n"
5370     "RC is a degenerate case of the symmetric integral RF: ``elliprc(x, y) ==\n"
5371     "elliprf(x, y, y)``. It is an elementary function rather than an elliptic\n"
5372     "integral.\n"
5373     "\n"
5374     "The code implements Carlson's algorithm based on the duplication theorems\n"
5375     "and series expansion up to the 7th order. [2]_\n"
5376     "\n"
5377     ".. versionadded:: 1.8.0\n"
5378     "\n"
5379     "References\n"
5380     "----------\n"
5381     ".. [1] B. C. Carlson, ed., Chapter 19 in \"Digital Library of Mathematical\n"
5382     "       Functions,\" NIST, US Dept. of Commerce.\n"
5383     "       https://dlmf.nist.gov/19.16.E6\n"
5384     ".. [2] B. C. Carlson, \"Numerical computation of real or complex elliptic\n"
5385     "       integrals,\" Numer. Algorithm, vol. 10, no. 1, pp. 13-26, 1995.\n"
5386     "       https://arxiv.org/abs/math/9409227\n"
5387     "       https://doi.org/10.1007/BF02198293\n"
5388     "\n"
5389     "Examples\n"
5390     "--------\n"
5391     "Basic homogeneity property:\n"
5392     "\n"
5393     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
5394     ">>> from scipy.special import elliprc\n"
5395     "\n"
5396     ">>> x = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5397     ">>> y = 5.\n"
5398     ">>> scale = 0.3 + 0.4j\n"
5399     ">>> elliprc(scale*x, scale*y)\n"
5400     "(0.5484493976710874-0.4169557678995833j)\n"
5401     "\n"
5402     ">>> elliprc(x, y)/np.sqrt(scale)\n"
5403     "(0.5484493976710874-0.41695576789958333j)\n"
5404     "\n"
5405     "When the two arguments coincide, the integral is particularly\n"
5406     "simple:\n"
5407     "\n"
5408     ">>> x = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5409     ">>> elliprc(x, x)\n"
5410     "(0.4299173120614631-0.3041729818745595j)\n"
5411     "\n"
5412     ">>> 1/np.sqrt(x)\n"
5413     "(0.4299173120614631-0.30417298187455954j)\n"
5414     "\n"
5415     "Another simple case: the first argument vanishes:\n"
5416     "\n"
5417     ">>> y = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5418     ">>> elliprc(0, y)\n"
5419     "(0.6753125346116815-0.47779380263880866j)\n"
5420     "\n"
5421     ">>> np.pi/2/np.sqrt(y)\n"
5422     "(0.6753125346116815-0.4777938026388088j)\n"
5423     "\n"
5424     "When `x` and `y` are both positive, we can express\n"
5425     ":math:`R_C(x,y)` in terms of more elementary functions.  For the\n"
5426     "case :math:`0 \\le x < y`,\n"
5427     "\n"
5428     ">>> x = 3.2\n"
5429     ">>> y = 6.\n"
5430     ">>> elliprc(x, y)\n"
5431     "0.44942991498453444\n"
5432     "\n"
5433     ">>> np.arctan(np.sqrt((y-x)/x))/np.sqrt(y-x)\n"
5434     "0.44942991498453433\n"
5435     "\n"
5436     "And for the case :math:`0 \\le y < x`,\n"
5437     "\n"
5438     ">>> x = 6.\n"
5439     ">>> y = 3.2\n"
5440     ">>> elliprc(x,y)\n"
5441     "0.4989837501576147\n"
5442     "\n"
5443     ">>> np.log((np.sqrt(x)+np.sqrt(x-y))/np.sqrt(y))/np.sqrt(x-y)\n"
5444     "0.49898375015761476")
5445 ufunc_elliprc_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
5446 ufunc_elliprc_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
5447 ufunc_elliprc_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DD__As_FF_F
5448 ufunc_elliprc_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DD__As_DD_D
5449 ufunc_elliprc_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5450 ufunc_elliprc_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5451 ufunc_elliprc_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5452 ufunc_elliprc_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5453 ufunc_elliprc_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5454 ufunc_elliprc_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5455 ufunc_elliprc_types[6] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5456 ufunc_elliprc_types[7] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5457 ufunc_elliprc_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5458 ufunc_elliprc_types[9] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5459 ufunc_elliprc_types[10] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5460 ufunc_elliprc_types[11] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5461 ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RC
5462 ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprc")
5463 ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RC
5464 ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprc")
5465 ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RC
5466 ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprc")
5467 ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RC
5468 ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprc")
5469 ufunc_elliprc_data[0] = &ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*0]
5470 ufunc_elliprc_data[1] = &ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*1]
5471 ufunc_elliprc_data[2] = &ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*2]
5472 ufunc_elliprc_data[3] = &ufunc_elliprc_ptr[2*3]
5473 elliprc = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_elliprc_loops, ufunc_elliprc_data, ufunc_elliprc_types, 4, 2, 1, 0, "elliprc", ufunc_elliprc_doc, 0)
5474 
5475 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_elliprd_loops[4]
5476 cdef void *ufunc_elliprd_ptr[8]
5477 cdef void *ufunc_elliprd_data[4]
5478 cdef char ufunc_elliprd_types[16]
5479 cdef char *ufunc_elliprd_doc = (
5480     "elliprd(x, y, z, out=None)\n"
5481     "\n"
5482     "Symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5483     "\n"
5484     "The function RD is defined as [1]_\n"
5485     "\n"
5486     ".. math::\n"
5487     "\n"
5488     "    R_{\\mathrm{D}}(x, y, z) =\n"
5489     "       \\frac{3}{2} \\int_0^{+\\infty} [(t + x) (t + y)]^{-1/2} (t + z)^{-3/2}\n"
5490     "       dt\n"
5491     "\n"
5492     "Parameters\n"
5493     "----------\n"
5494     "x, y, z : array_like\n"
5495     "    Real or complex input parameters. `x` or `y` can be any number in the\n"
5496     "    complex plane cut along the negative real axis, but at most one of them\n"
5497     "    can be zero, while `z` must be non-zero.\n"
5498     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
5499     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
5500     "\n"
5501     "Returns\n"
5502     "-------\n"
5503     "R : scalar or ndarray\n"
5504     "    Value of the integral. If all of `x`, `y`, and `z` are real, the\n"
5505     "    return value is real. Otherwise, the return value is complex.\n"
5506     "\n"
5507     "See Also\n"
5508     "--------\n"
5509     "elliprc : Degenerate symmetric elliptic integral.\n"
5510     "elliprf : Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the first kind.\n"
5511     "elliprg : Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5512     "elliprj : Symmetric elliptic integral of the third kind.\n"
5513     "\n"
5514     "Notes\n"
5515     "-----\n"
5516     "RD is a degenerate case of the elliptic integral RJ: ``elliprd(x, y, z) ==\n"
5517     "elliprj(x, y, z, z)``.\n"
5518     "\n"
5519     "The code implements Carlson's algorithm based on the duplication theorems\n"
5520     "and series expansion up to the 7th order. [2]_\n"
5521     "\n"
5522     ".. versionadded:: 1.8.0\n"
5523     "\n"
5524     "References\n"
5525     "----------\n"
5526     ".. [1] B. C. Carlson, ed., Chapter 19 in \"Digital Library of Mathematical\n"
5527     "       Functions,\" NIST, US Dept. of Commerce.\n"
5528     "       https://dlmf.nist.gov/19.16.E5\n"
5529     ".. [2] B. C. Carlson, \"Numerical computation of real or complex elliptic\n"
5530     "       integrals,\" Numer. Algorithm, vol. 10, no. 1, pp. 13-26, 1995.\n"
5531     "       https://arxiv.org/abs/math/9409227\n"
5532     "       https://doi.org/10.1007/BF02198293\n"
5533     "\n"
5534     "Examples\n"
5535     "--------\n"
5536     "Basic homogeneity property:\n"
5537     "\n"
5538     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
5539     ">>> from scipy.special import elliprd\n"
5540     "\n"
5541     ">>> x = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5542     ">>> y = 5.\n"
5543     ">>> z = 6.\n"
5544     ">>> scale = 0.3 + 0.4j\n"
5545     ">>> elliprd(scale*x, scale*y, scale*z)\n"
5546     "(-0.03703043835680379-0.24500934665683802j)\n"
5547     "\n"
5548     ">>> elliprd(x, y, z)*np.power(scale, -1.5)\n"
5549     "(-0.0370304383568038-0.24500934665683805j)\n"
5550     "\n"
5551     "All three arguments coincide:\n"
5552     "\n"
5553     ">>> x = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5554     ">>> elliprd(x, x, x)\n"
5555     "(-0.03986825876151896-0.14051741840449586j)\n"
5556     "\n"
5557     ">>> np.power(x, -1.5)\n"
5558     "(-0.03986825876151894-0.14051741840449583j)\n"
5559     "\n"
5560     "The so-called \"second lemniscate constant\":\n"
5561     "\n"
5562     ">>> elliprd(0, 2, 1)/3\n"
5563     "0.5990701173677961\n"
5564     "\n"
5565     ">>> from scipy.special import gamma\n"
5566     ">>> gamma(0.75)**2/np.sqrt(2*np.pi)\n"
5567     "0.5990701173677959")
5568 ufunc_elliprd_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
5569 ufunc_elliprd_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
5570 ufunc_elliprd_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DDD__As_FFF_F
5571 ufunc_elliprd_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DDD__As_DDD_D
5572 ufunc_elliprd_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5573 ufunc_elliprd_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5574 ufunc_elliprd_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5575 ufunc_elliprd_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5576 ufunc_elliprd_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5577 ufunc_elliprd_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5578 ufunc_elliprd_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5579 ufunc_elliprd_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5580 ufunc_elliprd_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5581 ufunc_elliprd_types[9] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5582 ufunc_elliprd_types[10] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5583 ufunc_elliprd_types[11] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5584 ufunc_elliprd_types[12] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5585 ufunc_elliprd_types[13] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5586 ufunc_elliprd_types[14] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5587 ufunc_elliprd_types[15] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5588 ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RD
5589 ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprd")
5590 ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RD
5591 ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprd")
5592 ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RD
5593 ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprd")
5594 ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RD
5595 ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprd")
5596 ufunc_elliprd_data[0] = &ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*0]
5597 ufunc_elliprd_data[1] = &ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*1]
5598 ufunc_elliprd_data[2] = &ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*2]
5599 ufunc_elliprd_data[3] = &ufunc_elliprd_ptr[2*3]
5600 elliprd = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_elliprd_loops, ufunc_elliprd_data, ufunc_elliprd_types, 4, 3, 1, 0, "elliprd", ufunc_elliprd_doc, 0)
5601 
5602 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_elliprf_loops[4]
5603 cdef void *ufunc_elliprf_ptr[8]
5604 cdef void *ufunc_elliprf_data[4]
5605 cdef char ufunc_elliprf_types[16]
5606 cdef char *ufunc_elliprf_doc = (
5607     "elliprf(x, y, z, out=None)\n"
5608     "\n"
5609     "Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the first kind.\n"
5610     "\n"
5611     "The function RF is defined as [1]_\n"
5612     "\n"
5613     ".. math::\n"
5614     "\n"
5615     "    R_{\\mathrm{F}}(x, y, z) =\n"
5616     "       \\frac{1}{2} \\int_0^{+\\infty} [(t + x) (t + y) (t + z)]^{-1/2} dt\n"
5617     "\n"
5618     "Parameters\n"
5619     "----------\n"
5620     "x, y, z : array_like\n"
5621     "    Real or complex input parameters. `x`, `y`, or `z` can be any number in\n"
5622     "    the complex plane cut along the negative real axis, but at most one of\n"
5623     "    them can be zero.\n"
5624     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
5625     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
5626     "\n"
5627     "Returns\n"
5628     "-------\n"
5629     "R : scalar or ndarray\n"
5630     "    Value of the integral. If all of `x`, `y`, and `z` are real, the return\n"
5631     "    value is real. Otherwise, the return value is complex.\n"
5632     "\n"
5633     "See Also\n"
5634     "--------\n"
5635     "elliprc : Degenerate symmetric integral.\n"
5636     "elliprd : Symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5637     "elliprg : Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5638     "elliprj : Symmetric elliptic integral of the third kind.\n"
5639     "\n"
5640     "Notes\n"
5641     "-----\n"
5642     "The code implements Carlson's algorithm based on the duplication theorems\n"
5643     "and series expansion up to the 7th order (cf.:\n"
5644     "https://dlmf.nist.gov/19.36.i) and the AGM algorithm for the complete\n"
5645     "integral. [2]_\n"
5646     "\n"
5647     ".. versionadded:: 1.8.0\n"
5648     "\n"
5649     "References\n"
5650     "----------\n"
5651     ".. [1] B. C. Carlson, ed., Chapter 19 in \"Digital Library of Mathematical\n"
5652     "       Functions,\" NIST, US Dept. of Commerce.\n"
5653     "       https://dlmf.nist.gov/19.16.E1\n"
5654     ".. [2] B. C. Carlson, \"Numerical computation of real or complex elliptic\n"
5655     "       integrals,\" Numer. Algorithm, vol. 10, no. 1, pp. 13-26, 1995.\n"
5656     "       https://arxiv.org/abs/math/9409227\n"
5657     "       https://doi.org/10.1007/BF02198293\n"
5658     "\n"
5659     "Examples\n"
5660     "--------\n"
5661     "Basic homogeneity property:\n"
5662     "\n"
5663     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
5664     ">>> from scipy.special import elliprf\n"
5665     "\n"
5666     ">>> x = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5667     ">>> y = 5.\n"
5668     ">>> z = 6.\n"
5669     ">>> scale = 0.3 + 0.4j\n"
5670     ">>> elliprf(scale*x, scale*y, scale*z)\n"
5671     "(0.5328051227278146-0.4008623567957094j)\n"
5672     "\n"
5673     ">>> elliprf(x, y, z)/np.sqrt(scale)\n"
5674     "(0.5328051227278147-0.4008623567957095j)\n"
5675     "\n"
5676     "All three arguments coincide:\n"
5677     "\n"
5678     ">>> x = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5679     ">>> elliprf(x, x, x)\n"
5680     "(0.42991731206146316-0.30417298187455954j)\n"
5681     "\n"
5682     ">>> 1/np.sqrt(x)\n"
5683     "(0.4299173120614631-0.30417298187455954j)\n"
5684     "\n"
5685     "The so-called \"first lemniscate constant\":\n"
5686     "\n"
5687     ">>> elliprf(0, 1, 2)\n"
5688     "1.3110287771460598\n"
5689     "\n"
5690     ">>> from scipy.special import gamma\n"
5691     ">>> gamma(0.25)**2/(4*np.sqrt(2*np.pi))\n"
5692     "1.3110287771460598")
5693 ufunc_elliprf_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
5694 ufunc_elliprf_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
5695 ufunc_elliprf_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DDD__As_FFF_F
5696 ufunc_elliprf_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DDD__As_DDD_D
5697 ufunc_elliprf_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5698 ufunc_elliprf_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5699 ufunc_elliprf_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5700 ufunc_elliprf_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5701 ufunc_elliprf_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5702 ufunc_elliprf_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5703 ufunc_elliprf_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5704 ufunc_elliprf_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5705 ufunc_elliprf_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5706 ufunc_elliprf_types[9] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5707 ufunc_elliprf_types[10] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5708 ufunc_elliprf_types[11] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5709 ufunc_elliprf_types[12] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5710 ufunc_elliprf_types[13] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5711 ufunc_elliprf_types[14] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5712 ufunc_elliprf_types[15] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5713 ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RF
5714 ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprf")
5715 ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RF
5716 ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprf")
5717 ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RF
5718 ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprf")
5719 ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RF
5720 ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprf")
5721 ufunc_elliprf_data[0] = &ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*0]
5722 ufunc_elliprf_data[1] = &ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*1]
5723 ufunc_elliprf_data[2] = &ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*2]
5724 ufunc_elliprf_data[3] = &ufunc_elliprf_ptr[2*3]
5725 elliprf = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_elliprf_loops, ufunc_elliprf_data, ufunc_elliprf_types, 4, 3, 1, 0, "elliprf", ufunc_elliprf_doc, 0)
5726 
5727 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_elliprg_loops[4]
5728 cdef void *ufunc_elliprg_ptr[8]
5729 cdef void *ufunc_elliprg_data[4]
5730 cdef char ufunc_elliprg_types[16]
5731 cdef char *ufunc_elliprg_doc = (
5732     "elliprg(x, y, z, out=None)\n"
5733     "\n"
5734     "Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5735     "\n"
5736     "The function RG is defined as [1]_\n"
5737     "\n"
5738     ".. math::\n"
5739     "\n"
5740     "    R_{\\mathrm{G}}(x, y, z) =\n"
5741     "       \\frac{1}{4} \\int_0^{+\\infty} [(t + x) (t + y) (t + z)]^{-1/2}\n"
5742     "       \\left(\\frac{x}{t + x} + \\frac{y}{t + y} + \\frac{z}{t + z}\\right) t\n"
5743     "       dt\n"
5744     "\n"
5745     "Parameters\n"
5746     "----------\n"
5747     "x, y, z : array_like\n"
5748     "    Real or complex input parameters. `x`, `y`, or `z` can be any number in\n"
5749     "    the complex plane cut along the negative real axis.\n"
5750     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
5751     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
5752     "\n"
5753     "Returns\n"
5754     "-------\n"
5755     "R : scalar or ndarray\n"
5756     "    Value of the integral. If all of `x`, `y`, and `z` are real, the return\n"
5757     "    value is real. Otherwise, the return value is complex.\n"
5758     "\n"
5759     "See Also\n"
5760     "--------\n"
5761     "elliprc : Degenerate symmetric integral.\n"
5762     "elliprd : Symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5763     "elliprf : Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the first kind.\n"
5764     "elliprj : Symmetric elliptic integral of the third kind.\n"
5765     "\n"
5766     "Notes\n"
5767     "-----\n"
5768     "The implementation uses the relation [1]_\n"
5769     "\n"
5770     ".. math::\n"
5771     "\n"
5772     "    2 R_{\\mathrm{G}}(x, y, z) =\n"
5773     "       z R_{\\mathrm{F}}(x, y, z) -\n"
5774     "       \\frac{1}{3} (x - z) (y - z) R_{\\mathrm{D}}(x, y, z) +\n"
5775     "       \\sqrt{\\frac{x y}{z}}\n"
5776     "\n"
5777     "and the symmetry of `x`, `y`, `z` when at least one non-zero parameter can\n"
5778     "be chosen as the pivot. When one of the arguments is close to zero, the AGM\n"
5779     "method is applied instead. Other special cases are computed following Ref.\n"
5780     "[2]_\n"
5781     "\n"
5782     ".. versionadded:: 1.8.0\n"
5783     "\n"
5784     "References\n"
5785     "----------\n"
5786     ".. [1] B. C. Carlson, \"Numerical computation of real or complex elliptic\n"
5787     "       integrals,\" Numer. Algorithm, vol. 10, no. 1, pp. 13-26, 1995.\n"
5788     "       https://arxiv.org/abs/math/9409227\n"
5789     "       https://doi.org/10.1007/BF02198293\n"
5790     ".. [2] B. C. Carlson, ed., Chapter 19 in \"Digital Library of Mathematical\n"
5791     "       Functions,\" NIST, US Dept. of Commerce.\n"
5792     "       https://dlmf.nist.gov/19.16.E1\n"
5793     "       https://dlmf.nist.gov/19.20.ii\n"
5794     "\n"
5795     "Examples\n"
5796     "--------\n"
5797     "Basic homogeneity property:\n"
5798     "\n"
5799     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
5800     ">>> from scipy.special import elliprg\n"
5801     "\n"
5802     ">>> x = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5803     ">>> y = 5.\n"
5804     ">>> z = 6.\n"
5805     ">>> scale = 0.3 + 0.4j\n"
5806     ">>> elliprg(scale*x, scale*y, scale*z)\n"
5807     "(1.195936862005246+0.8470988320464167j)\n"
5808     "\n"
5809     ">>> elliprg(x, y, z)*np.sqrt(scale)\n"
5810     "(1.195936862005246+0.8470988320464165j)\n"
5811     "\n"
5812     "Simplifications:\n"
5813     "\n"
5814     ">>> elliprg(0, y, y)\n"
5815     "1.756203682760182\n"
5816     "\n"
5817     ">>> 0.25*np.pi*np.sqrt(y)\n"
5818     "1.7562036827601817\n"
5819     "\n"
5820     ">>> elliprg(0, 0, z)\n"
5821     "1.224744871391589\n"
5822     "\n"
5823     ">>> 0.5*np.sqrt(z)\n"
5824     "1.224744871391589\n"
5825     "\n"
5826     "The surface area of a triaxial ellipsoid with semiaxes ``a``, ``b``, and\n"
5827     "``c`` is given by\n"
5828     "\n"
5829     ".. math::\n"
5830     "\n"
5831     "    S = 4 \\pi a b c R_{\\mathrm{G}}(1 / a^2, 1 / b^2, 1 / c^2).\n"
5832     "\n"
5833     ">>> def ellipsoid_area(a, b, c):\n"
5834     "...     r = 4.0 * np.pi * a * b * c\n"
5835     "...     return r * elliprg(1.0 / (a * a), 1.0 / (b * b), 1.0 / (c * c))\n"
5836     ">>> print(ellipsoid_area(1, 3, 5))\n"
5837     "108.62688289491807")
5838 ufunc_elliprg_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
5839 ufunc_elliprg_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
5840 ufunc_elliprg_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DDD__As_FFF_F
5841 ufunc_elliprg_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DDD__As_DDD_D
5842 ufunc_elliprg_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5843 ufunc_elliprg_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5844 ufunc_elliprg_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5845 ufunc_elliprg_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
5846 ufunc_elliprg_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5847 ufunc_elliprg_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5848 ufunc_elliprg_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5849 ufunc_elliprg_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
5850 ufunc_elliprg_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5851 ufunc_elliprg_types[9] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5852 ufunc_elliprg_types[10] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5853 ufunc_elliprg_types[11] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
5854 ufunc_elliprg_types[12] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5855 ufunc_elliprg_types[13] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5856 ufunc_elliprg_types[14] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5857 ufunc_elliprg_types[15] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
5858 ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RG
5859 ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprg")
5860 ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RG
5861 ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprg")
5862 ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RG
5863 ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprg")
5864 ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RG
5865 ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprg")
5866 ufunc_elliprg_data[0] = &ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*0]
5867 ufunc_elliprg_data[1] = &ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*1]
5868 ufunc_elliprg_data[2] = &ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*2]
5869 ufunc_elliprg_data[3] = &ufunc_elliprg_ptr[2*3]
5870 elliprg = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_elliprg_loops, ufunc_elliprg_data, ufunc_elliprg_types, 4, 3, 1, 0, "elliprg", ufunc_elliprg_doc, 0)
5871 
5872 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_elliprj_loops[4]
5873 cdef void *ufunc_elliprj_ptr[8]
5874 cdef void *ufunc_elliprj_data[4]
5875 cdef char ufunc_elliprj_types[20]
5876 cdef char *ufunc_elliprj_doc = (
5877     "elliprj(x, y, z, p, out=None)\n"
5878     "\n"
5879     "Symmetric elliptic integral of the third kind.\n"
5880     "\n"
5881     "The function RJ is defined as [1]_\n"
5882     "\n"
5883     ".. math::\n"
5884     "\n"
5885     "    R_{\\mathrm{J}}(x, y, z, p) =\n"
5886     "       \\frac{3}{2} \\int_0^{+\\infty} [(t + x) (t + y) (t + z)]^{-1/2}\n"
5887     "       (t + p)^{-1} dt\n"
5888     "\n"
5889     ".. warning::\n"
5890     "    This function should be considered experimental when the inputs are\n"
5891     "    unbalanced.  Check correctness with another independent implementation.\n"
5892     "\n"
5893     "Parameters\n"
5894     "----------\n"
5895     "x, y, z, p : array_like\n"
5896     "    Real or complex input parameters. `x`, `y`, or `z` are numbers in\n"
5897     "    the complex plane cut along the negative real axis (subject to further\n"
5898     "    constraints, see Notes), and at most one of them can be zero. `p` must\n"
5899     "    be non-zero.\n"
5900     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
5901     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
5902     "\n"
5903     "Returns\n"
5904     "-------\n"
5905     "R : scalar or ndarray\n"
5906     "    Value of the integral. If all of `x`, `y`, `z`, and `p` are real, the\n"
5907     "    return value is real. Otherwise, the return value is complex.\n"
5908     "\n"
5909     "    If `p` is real and negative, while `x`, `y`, and `z` are real,\n"
5910     "    non-negative, and at most one of them is zero, the Cauchy principal\n"
5911     "    value is returned. [1]_ [2]_\n"
5912     "\n"
5913     "See Also\n"
5914     "--------\n"
5915     "elliprc : Degenerate symmetric integral.\n"
5916     "elliprd : Symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5917     "elliprf : Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the first kind.\n"
5918     "elliprg : Completely-symmetric elliptic integral of the second kind.\n"
5919     "\n"
5920     "Notes\n"
5921     "-----\n"
5922     "The code implements Carlson's algorithm based on the duplication theorems\n"
5923     "and series expansion up to the 7th order. [3]_ The algorithm is slightly\n"
5924     "different from its earlier incarnation as it appears in [1]_, in that the\n"
5925     "call to `elliprc` (or ``atan``/``atanh``, see [4]_) is no longer needed in\n"
5926     "the inner loop. Asymptotic approximations are used where arguments differ\n"
5927     "widely in the order of magnitude. [5]_\n"
5928     "\n"
5929     "The input values are subject to certain sufficient but not necessary\n"
5930     "constraints when input arguments are complex. Notably, ``x``, ``y``, and\n"
5931     "``z`` must have non-negative real parts, unless two of them are\n"
5932     "non-negative and complex-conjugates to each other while the other is a real\n"
5933     "non-negative number. [1]_ If the inputs do not satisfy the sufficient\n"
5934     "condition described in Ref. [1]_ they are rejected outright with the output\n"
5935     "set to NaN.\n"
5936     "\n"
5937     "In the case where one of ``x``, ``y``, and ``z`` is equal to ``p``, the\n"
5938     "function ``elliprd`` should be preferred because of its less restrictive\n"
5939     "domain.\n"
5940     "\n"
5941     ".. versionadded:: 1.8.0\n"
5942     "\n"
5943     "References\n"
5944     "----------\n"
5945     ".. [1] B. C. Carlson, \"Numerical computation of real or complex elliptic\n"
5946     "       integrals,\" Numer. Algorithm, vol. 10, no. 1, pp. 13-26, 1995.\n"
5947     "       https://arxiv.org/abs/math/9409227\n"
5948     "       https://doi.org/10.1007/BF02198293\n"
5949     ".. [2] B. C. Carlson, ed., Chapter 19 in \"Digital Library of Mathematical\n"
5950     "       Functions,\" NIST, US Dept. of Commerce.\n"
5951     "       https://dlmf.nist.gov/19.20.iii\n"
5952     ".. [3] B. C. Carlson, J. FitzSimmons, \"Reduction Theorems for Elliptic\n"
5953     "       Integrands with the Square Root of Two Quadratic Factors,\" J.\n"
5954     "       Comput. Appl. Math., vol. 118, nos. 1-2, pp. 71-85, 2000.\n"
5955     "       https://doi.org/10.1016/S0377-0427(00)00282-X\n"
5956     ".. [4] F. Johansson, \"Numerical Evaluation of Elliptic Functions, Elliptic\n"
5957     "       Integrals and Modular Forms,\" in J. Blumlein, C. Schneider, P.\n"
5958     "       Paule, eds., \"Elliptic Integrals, Elliptic Functions and Modular\n"
5959     "       Forms in Quantum Field Theory,\" pp. 269-293, 2019 (Cham,\n"
5960     "       Switzerland: Springer Nature Switzerland)\n"
5961     "       https://arxiv.org/abs/1806.06725\n"
5962     "       https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-030-04480-0\n"
5963     ".. [5] B. C. Carlson, J. L. Gustafson, \"Asymptotic Approximations for\n"
5964     "       Symmetric Elliptic Integrals,\" SIAM J. Math. Anls., vol. 25, no. 2,\n"
5965     "       pp. 288-303, 1994.\n"
5966     "       https://arxiv.org/abs/math/9310223\n"
5967     "       https://doi.org/10.1137/S0036141092228477\n"
5968     "\n"
5969     "Examples\n"
5970     "--------\n"
5971     "Basic homogeneity property:\n"
5972     "\n"
5973     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
5974     ">>> from scipy.special import elliprj\n"
5975     "\n"
5976     ">>> x = 1.2 + 3.4j\n"
5977     ">>> y = 5.\n"
5978     ">>> z = 6.\n"
5979     ">>> p = 7.\n"
5980     ">>> scale = 0.3 - 0.4j\n"
5981     ">>> elliprj(scale*x, scale*y, scale*z, scale*p)\n"
5982     "(0.10834905565679157+0.19694950747103812j)\n"
5983     "\n"
5984     ">>> elliprj(x, y, z, p)*np.power(scale, -1.5)\n"
5985     "(0.10834905565679556+0.19694950747103854j)\n"
5986     "\n"
5987     "Reduction to simpler elliptic integral:\n"
5988     "\n"
5989     ">>> elliprj(x, y, z, z)\n"
5990     "(0.08288462362195129-0.028376809745123258j)\n"
5991     "\n"
5992     ">>> from scipy.special import elliprd\n"
5993     ">>> elliprd(x, y, z)\n"
5994     "(0.08288462362195136-0.028376809745123296j)\n"
5995     "\n"
5996     "All arguments coincide:\n"
5997     "\n"
5998     ">>> elliprj(x, x, x, x)\n"
5999     "(-0.03986825876151896-0.14051741840449586j)\n"
6000     "\n"
6001     ">>> np.power(x, -1.5)\n"
6002     "(-0.03986825876151894-0.14051741840449583j)")
6003 ufunc_elliprj_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_ffff_f
6004 ufunc_elliprj_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_dddd_d
6005 ufunc_elliprj_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DDDD__As_FFFF_F
6006 ufunc_elliprj_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_DDDD__As_DDDD_D
6007 ufunc_elliprj_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6008 ufunc_elliprj_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6009 ufunc_elliprj_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6010 ufunc_elliprj_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6011 ufunc_elliprj_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6012 ufunc_elliprj_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6013 ufunc_elliprj_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6014 ufunc_elliprj_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6015 ufunc_elliprj_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6016 ufunc_elliprj_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6017 ufunc_elliprj_types[10] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6018 ufunc_elliprj_types[11] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6019 ufunc_elliprj_types[12] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6020 ufunc_elliprj_types[13] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6021 ufunc_elliprj_types[14] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6022 ufunc_elliprj_types[15] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6023 ufunc_elliprj_types[16] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6024 ufunc_elliprj_types[17] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6025 ufunc_elliprj_types[18] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6026 ufunc_elliprj_types[19] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6027 ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RJ
6028 ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprj")
6029 ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_fellint_RJ
6030 ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprj")
6031 ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RJ
6032 ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprj")
6033 ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_cellint_RJ
6034 ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"elliprj")
6035 ufunc_elliprj_data[0] = &ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*0]
6036 ufunc_elliprj_data[1] = &ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*1]
6037 ufunc_elliprj_data[2] = &ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*2]
6038 ufunc_elliprj_data[3] = &ufunc_elliprj_ptr[2*3]
6039 elliprj = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_elliprj_loops, ufunc_elliprj_data, ufunc_elliprj_types, 4, 4, 1, 0, "elliprj", ufunc_elliprj_doc, 0)
6040 
6041 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_entr_loops[2]
6042 cdef void *ufunc_entr_ptr[4]
6043 cdef void *ufunc_entr_data[2]
6044 cdef char ufunc_entr_types[4]
6045 cdef char *ufunc_entr_doc = (
6046     "entr(x, out=None)\n"
6047     "\n"
6048     "Elementwise function for computing entropy.\n"
6049     "\n"
6050     ".. math:: \\text{entr}(x) = \\begin{cases} - x \\log(x) & x > 0  \\\\ 0 & x = 0\n"
6051     "          \\\\ -\\infty & \\text{otherwise} \\end{cases}\n"
6052     "\n"
6053     "Parameters\n"
6054     "----------\n"
6055     "x : ndarray\n"
6056     "    Input array.\n"
6057     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6058     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6059     "\n"
6060     "Returns\n"
6061     "-------\n"
6062     "res : scalar or ndarray\n"
6063     "    The value of the elementwise entropy function at the given points `x`.\n"
6064     "\n"
6065     "See Also\n"
6066     "--------\n"
6067     "kl_div, rel_entr, scipy.stats.entropy\n"
6068     "\n"
6069     "Notes\n"
6070     "-----\n"
6071     ".. versionadded:: 0.15.0\n"
6072     "\n"
6073     "This function is concave.\n"
6074     "\n"
6075     "The origin of this function is in convex programming; see [1]_.\n"
6076     "Given a probability distribution :math:`p_1, \\ldots, p_n`,\n"
6077     "the definition of entropy in the context of *information theory* is\n"
6078     "\n"
6079     ".. math::\n"
6080     "\n"
6081     "    \\sum_{i = 1}^n \\mathrm{entr}(p_i).\n"
6082     "\n"
6083     "To compute the latter quantity, use `scipy.stats.entropy`.\n"
6084     "\n"
6085     "References\n"
6086     "----------\n"
6087     ".. [1] Boyd, Stephen and Lieven Vandenberghe. *Convex optimization*.\n"
6088     "       Cambridge University Press, 2004.\n"
6089     "       :doi:`https://doi.org/10.1017/CBO9780511804441`")
6090 ufunc_entr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
6091 ufunc_entr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
6092 ufunc_entr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6093 ufunc_entr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6094 ufunc_entr_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6095 ufunc_entr_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6096 ufunc_entr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_entr
6097 ufunc_entr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"entr")
6098 ufunc_entr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_entr
6099 ufunc_entr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"entr")
6100 ufunc_entr_data[0] = &ufunc_entr_ptr[2*0]
6101 ufunc_entr_data[1] = &ufunc_entr_ptr[2*1]

6103 
6104 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_erf_loops[4]
6105 cdef void *ufunc_erf_ptr[8]
6106 cdef void *ufunc_erf_data[4]
6107 cdef char ufunc_erf_types[8]
6108 cdef char *ufunc_erf_doc = (
6109     "erf(z, out=None)\n"
6110     "\n"
6111     "Returns the error function of complex argument.\n"
6112     "\n"
6113     "It is defined as ``2/sqrt(pi)*integral(exp(-t**2), t=0..z)``.\n"
6114     "\n"
6115     "Parameters\n"
6116     "----------\n"
6117     "x : ndarray\n"
6118     "    Input array.\n"
6119     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6120     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6121     "\n"
6122     "Returns\n"
6123     "-------\n"
6124     "res : scalar or ndarray\n"
6125     "    The values of the error function at the given points `x`.\n"
6126     "\n"
6127     "See Also\n"
6128     "--------\n"
6129     "erfc, erfinv, erfcinv, wofz, erfcx, erfi\n"
6130     "\n"
6131     "Notes\n"
6132     "-----\n"
6133     "The cumulative of the unit normal distribution is given by\n"
6134     "``Phi(z) = 1/2[1 + erf(z/sqrt(2))]``.\n"
6135     "\n"
6136     "References\n"
6137     "----------\n"
6138     ".. [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Error_function\n"
6139     ".. [2] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
6140     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
6141     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover,\n"
6142     "    1972. http://www.math.sfu.ca/~cbm/aands/page_297.htm\n"
6143     ".. [3] Steven G. Johnson, Faddeeva W function implementation.\n"
6144     "   http://ab-initio.mit.edu/Faddeeva\n"
6145     "\n"
6146     "Examples\n"
6147     "--------\n"
6148     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
6149     ">>> from scipy import special\n"
6150     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
6151     ">>> x = np.linspace(-3, 3)\n"
6152     ">>> plt.plot(x, special.erf(x))\n"
6153     ">>> plt.xlabel('$x$')\n"
6154     ">>> plt.ylabel('$erf(x)$')\n"
6155     ">>> plt.show()")
6156 ufunc_erf_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
6157 ufunc_erf_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
6158 ufunc_erf_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_F_F
6159 ufunc_erf_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_D_D
6160 ufunc_erf_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6161 ufunc_erf_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6162 ufunc_erf_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6163 ufunc_erf_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6164 ufunc_erf_types[4] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6165 ufunc_erf_types[5] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6166 ufunc_erf_types[6] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6167 ufunc_erf_types[7] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6168 ufunc_erf_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_erf
6169 ufunc_erf_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"erf")
6170 ufunc_erf_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_cephes_erf
6171 ufunc_erf_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"erf")
6172 ufunc_erf_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_erf
6173 ufunc_erf_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"erf")
6174 ufunc_erf_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_erf
6175 ufunc_erf_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"erf")
6176 ufunc_erf_data[0] = &ufunc_erf_ptr[2*0]
6177 ufunc_erf_data[1] = &ufunc_erf_ptr[2*1]

6187     "erfc(x, out=None)\n"

6190     "\n"
6191     "Parameters\n"
6192     "----------\n"
6193     "x : array_like\n"
6194     "    Real or complex valued argument\n"
6195     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6196     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
6197     "\n"
6198     "Returns\n"

6247 
6248 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_erfcinv_loops[2]
6249 cdef void *ufunc_erfcinv_ptr[4]
6250 cdef void *ufunc_erfcinv_data[2]
6251 cdef char ufunc_erfcinv_types[4]
6252 cdef char *ufunc_erfcinv_doc = (
6253     "erfcinv(y, out=None)\n"
6254     "\n"
6255     "Inverse of the complementary error function.\n"
6256     "\n"
6257     "Computes the inverse of the complementary error function.\n"
6258     "\n"
6259     "In the complex domain, there is no unique complex number w satisfying\n"
6260     "erfc(w)=z. This indicates a true inverse function would be multivalued.\n"
6261     "When the domain restricts to the real, 0 < x < 2, there is a unique real\n"
6262     "number satisfying erfc(erfcinv(x)) = erfcinv(erfc(x)).\n"
6263     "\n"
6264     "It is related to inverse of the error function by erfcinv(1-x) = erfinv(x)\n"
6265     "\n"
6266     "Parameters\n"
6267     "----------\n"
6268     "y : ndarray\n"
6269     "    Argument at which to evaluate. Domain: [0, 2]\n"
6270     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6271     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6272     "\n"
6273     "Returns\n"
6274     "-------\n"
6275     "erfcinv : scalar or ndarray\n"
6276     "    The inverse of erfc of y, element-wise\n"
6277     "\n"
6278     "See Also\n"
6279     "--------\n"
6280     "erf : Error function of a complex argument\n"
6281     "erfc : Complementary error function, ``1 - erf(x)``\n"
6282     "erfinv : Inverse of the error function\n"
6283     "\n"
6284     "Examples\n"
6285     "--------\n"
6286     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
6287     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
6288     ">>> from scipy.special import erfcinv\n"
6289     "\n"
6290     ">>> erfcinv(0.5)\n"
6291     "0.4769362762044699\n"
6292     "\n"
6293     ">>> y = np.linspace(0.0, 2.0, num=11)\n"
6294     ">>> erfcinv(y)\n"
6295     "array([        inf,  0.9061938 ,  0.59511608,  0.37080716,  0.17914345,\n"
6296     "       -0.        , -0.17914345, -0.37080716, -0.59511608, -0.9061938 ,\n"
6297     "              -inf])\n"
6298     "\n"
6299     "Plot the function:\n"
6300     "\n"
6301     ">>> y = np.linspace(0, 2, 200)\n"
6302     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
6303     ">>> ax.plot(y, erfcinv(y))\n"
6304     ">>> ax.grid(True)\n"
6305     ">>> ax.set_xlabel('y')\n"
6306     ">>> ax.set_title('erfcinv(y)')\n"
6307     ">>> plt.show()")
6308 ufunc_erfcinv_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
6309 ufunc_erfcinv_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
6310 ufunc_erfcinv_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6311 ufunc_erfcinv_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6312 ufunc_erfcinv_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6313 ufunc_erfcinv_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6314 ufunc_erfcinv_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_erfcinv
6315 ufunc_erfcinv_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"erfcinv")
6316 ufunc_erfcinv_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_cephes_erfcinv
6317 ufunc_erfcinv_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"erfcinv")
6318 ufunc_erfcinv_data[0] = &ufunc_erfcinv_ptr[2*0]
6319 ufunc_erfcinv_data[1] = &ufunc_erfcinv_ptr[2*1]
6320 erfcinv = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_erfcinv_loops, ufunc_erfcinv_data, ufunc_erfcinv_types, 2, 1, 1, 0, "erfcinv", ufunc_erfcinv_doc, 0)

6464 
6465 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_erfinv_loops[2]
6466 cdef void *ufunc_erfinv_ptr[4]
6467 cdef void *ufunc_erfinv_data[2]
6468 cdef char ufunc_erfinv_types[4]
6469 cdef char *ufunc_erfinv_doc = (
6470     "erfinv(y, out=None)\n"
6471     "\n"
6472     "Inverse of the error function.\n"
6473     "\n"
6474     "Computes the inverse of the error function.\n"
6475     "\n"
6476     "In the complex domain, there is no unique complex number w satisfying\n"
6477     "erf(w)=z. This indicates a true inverse function would be multivalued.\n"
6478     "When the domain restricts to the real, -1 < x < 1, there is a unique real\n"
6479     "number satisfying erf(erfinv(x)) = x.\n"
6480     "\n"
6481     "Parameters\n"
6482     "----------\n"
6483     "y : ndarray\n"
6484     "    Argument at which to evaluate. Domain: [-1, 1]\n"
6485     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6486     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6487     "\n"
6488     "Returns\n"
6489     "-------\n"
6490     "erfinv : scalar or ndarray\n"
6491     "    The inverse of erf of y, element-wise\n"
6492     "\n"
6493     "See Also\n"
6494     "--------\n"
6495     "erf : Error function of a complex argument\n"
6496     "erfc : Complementary error function, ``1 - erf(x)``\n"
6497     "erfcinv : Inverse of the complementary error function\n"
6498     "\n"
6499     "Notes\n"
6500     "-----\n"
6501     "This function wraps the ``erf_inv`` routine from the\n"
6502     "Boost Math C++ library [1]_.\n"
6503     "\n"
6504     "References\n"
6505     "----------\n"
6506     ".. [1] The Boost Developers. \"Boost C++ Libraries\". https://www.boost.org/.\n"
6507     "\n"
6508     "Examples\n"
6509     "--------\n"
6510     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
6511     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
6512     ">>> from scipy.special import erfinv, erf\n"
6513     "\n"
6514     ">>> erfinv(0.5)\n"
6515     "0.4769362762044699\n"
6516     "\n"
6517     ">>> y = np.linspace(-1.0, 1.0, num=9)\n"
6518     ">>> x = erfinv(y)\n"
6519     ">>> x\n"
6520     "array([       -inf, -0.81341985, -0.47693628, -0.22531206,  0.        ,\n"
6521     "        0.22531206,  0.47693628,  0.81341985,         inf])\n"
6522     "\n"
6523     "Verify that ``erf(erfinv(y))`` is ``y``.\n"
6524     "\n"
6525     ">>> erf(x)\n"
6526     "array([-1.  , -0.75, -0.5 , -0.25,  0.  ,  0.25,  0.5 ,  0.75,  1.  ])\n"
6527     "\n"
6528     "Plot the function:\n"
6529     "\n"
6530     ">>> y = np.linspace(-1, 1, 200)\n"
6531     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
6532     ">>> ax.plot(y, erfinv(y))\n"
6533     ">>> ax.grid(True)\n"
6534     ">>> ax.set_xlabel('y')\n"
6535     ">>> ax.set_title('erfinv(y)')\n"
6536     ">>> plt.show()")
6537 ufunc_erfinv_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_f_f__As_f_f
6538 ufunc_erfinv_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
6539 ufunc_erfinv_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6540 ufunc_erfinv_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6541 ufunc_erfinv_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6542 ufunc_erfinv_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6543 ufunc_erfinv_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_erfinv_float
6544 ufunc_erfinv_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"erfinv")
6545 ufunc_erfinv_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_erfinv_double
6546 ufunc_erfinv_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"erfinv")
6547 ufunc_erfinv_data[0] = &ufunc_erfinv_ptr[2*0]
6548 ufunc_erfinv_data[1] = &ufunc_erfinv_ptr[2*1]
6549 erfinv = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_erfinv_loops, ufunc_erfinv_data, ufunc_erfinv_types, 2, 1, 1, 0, "erfinv", ufunc_erfinv_doc, 0)
6550 
6551 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_chebyc_loops[5]
6552 cdef void *ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[10]
6553 cdef void *ufunc_eval_chebyc_data[5]
6554 cdef char ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[15]
6555 cdef char *ufunc_eval_chebyc_doc = (
6556     "eval_chebyc(n, x, out=None)\n"
6557     "\n"
6558     "Evaluate Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind on [-2, 2] at a\n"
6559     "point.\n"
6560     "\n"
6561     "These polynomials are defined as\n"
6562     "\n"
6563     ".. math::\n"
6564     "\n"
6565     "    C_n(x) = 2 T_n(x/2)\n"
6566     "\n"
6567     "where :math:`T_n` is a Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind. See\n"
6568     "22.5.11 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
6569     "\n"
6570     "Parameters\n"
6571     "----------\n"
6572     "n : array_like\n"
6573     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
6574     "    determined via the relation to `eval_chebyt`.\n"
6575     "x : array_like\n"
6576     "    Points at which to evaluate the Chebyshev polynomial\n"
6577     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6578     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6579     "\n"
6580     "Returns\n"
6581     "-------\n"
6582     "C : scalar or ndarray\n"
6583     "    Values of the Chebyshev polynomial\n"
6584     "\n"
6585     "See Also\n"
6586     "--------\n"
6587     "roots_chebyc : roots and quadrature weights of Chebyshev\n"
6588     "               polynomials of the first kind on [-2, 2]\n"
6589     "chebyc : Chebyshev polynomial object\n"
6590     "numpy.polynomial.chebyshev.Chebyshev : Chebyshev series\n"
6591     "eval_chebyt : evaluate Chebycshev polynomials of the first kind\n"
6592     "\n"
6593     "References\n"
6594     "----------\n"
6595     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
6596     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
6597     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.\n"
6598     "\n"
6599     "Examples\n"
6600     "--------\n"
6601     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
6602     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
6603     "\n"
6604     "They are a scaled version of the Chebyshev polynomials of the\n"
6605     "first kind.\n"
6606     "\n"
6607     ">>> x = np.linspace(-2, 2, 6)\n"
6608     ">>> sc.eval_chebyc(3, x)\n"
6609     "array([-2.   ,  1.872,  1.136, -1.136, -1.872,  2.   ])\n"
6610     ">>> 2 * sc.eval_chebyt(3, x / 2)\n"
6611     "array([-2.   ,  1.872,  1.136, -1.136, -1.872,  2.   ])")
6612 ufunc_eval_chebyc_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
6613 ufunc_eval_chebyc_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
6614 ufunc_eval_chebyc_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_fF_F
6615 ufunc_eval_chebyc_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
6616 ufunc_eval_chebyc_loops[4] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_dD_D
6617 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
6618 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6619 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6620 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6621 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6622 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6623 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6624 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[7] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6625 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6626 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6627 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[10] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6628 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[11] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6629 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[12] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6630 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[13] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6631 ufunc_eval_chebyc_types[14] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6632 ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyc_l
6633 ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyc")
6634 ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyc[double]
6635 ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyc")
6636 ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyc[double_complex]
6637 ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyc")

6640 ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*4] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyc[double_complex]
6641 ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*4+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyc")
6642 ufunc_eval_chebyc_data[0] = &ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*0]
6643 ufunc_eval_chebyc_data[1] = &ufunc_eval_chebyc_ptr[2*1]

6649 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_chebys_loops[5]
6650 cdef void *ufunc_eval_chebys_ptr[10]
6651 cdef void *ufunc_eval_chebys_data[5]
6652 cdef char ufunc_eval_chebys_types[15]
6653 cdef char *ufunc_eval_chebys_doc = (
6654     "eval_chebys(n, x, out=None)\n"
6655     "\n"
6656     "Evaluate Chebyshev polynomial of the second kind on [-2, 2] at a\n"
6657     "point.\n"
6658     "\n"
6659     "These polynomials are defined as\n"
6660     "\n"
6661     ".. math::\n"
6662     "\n"
6663     "    S_n(x) = U_n(x/2)\n"
6664     "\n"
6665     "where :math:`U_n` is a Chebyshev polynomial of the second\n"
6666     "kind. See 22.5.13 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
6667     "\n"
6668     "Parameters\n"
6669     "----------\n"
6670     "n : array_like\n"
6671     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
6672     "    determined via the relation to `eval_chebyu`.\n"
6673     "x : array_like\n"
6674     "    Points at which to evaluate the Chebyshev polynomial\n"
6675     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6676     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6677     "\n"
6678     "Returns\n"
6679     "-------\n"
6680     "S : scalar or ndarray\n"
6681     "    Values of the Chebyshev polynomial\n"
6682     "\n"
6683     "See Also\n"
6684     "--------\n"
6685     "roots_chebys : roots and quadrature weights of Chebyshev\n"
6686     "               polynomials of the second kind on [-2, 2]\n"
6687     "chebys : Chebyshev polynomial object\n"
6688     "eval_chebyu : evaluate Chebyshev polynomials of the second kind\n"
6689     "\n"
6690     "References\n"
6691     "----------\n"
6692     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
6693     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
6694     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.\n"
6695     "\n"
6696     "Examples\n"
6697     "--------\n"
6698     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
6699     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
6700     "\n"
6701     "They are a scaled version of the Chebyshev polynomials of the\n"
6702     "second kind.\n"
6703     "\n"
6704     ">>> x = np.linspace(-2, 2, 6)\n"
6705     ">>> sc.eval_chebys(3, x)\n"
6706     "array([-4.   ,  0.672,  0.736, -0.736, -0.672,  4.   ])\n"
6707     ">>> sc.eval_chebyu(3, x / 2)\n"
6708     "array([-4.   ,  0.672,  0.736, -0.736, -0.672,  4.   ])")
6709 ufunc_eval_chebys_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
6710 ufunc_eval_chebys_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
6711 ufunc_eval_chebys_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_fF_F
6712 ufunc_eval_chebys_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
6713 ufunc_eval_chebys_loops[4] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_dD_D
6714 ufunc_eval_chebys_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP

6745 
6746 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_chebyt_loops[5]
6747 cdef void *ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[10]
6748 cdef void *ufunc_eval_chebyt_data[5]
6749 cdef char ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[15]
6750 cdef char *ufunc_eval_chebyt_doc = (
6751     "eval_chebyt(n, x, out=None)\n"
6752     "\n"
6753     "Evaluate Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind at a point.\n"
6754     "\n"
6755     "The Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind can be defined via the\n"
6756     "Gauss hypergeometric function :math:`{}_2F_1` as\n"
6757     "\n"
6758     ".. math::\n"
6759     "\n"
6760     "    T_n(x) = {}_2F_1(n, -n; 1/2; (1 - x)/2).\n"
6761     "\n"
6762     "When :math:`n` is an integer the result is a polynomial of degree\n"
6763     ":math:`n`. See 22.5.47 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
6764     "\n"
6765     "Parameters\n"
6766     "----------\n"
6767     "n : array_like\n"
6768     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
6769     "    determined via the relation to the Gauss hypergeometric\n"
6770     "    function.\n"
6771     "x : array_like\n"
6772     "    Points at which to evaluate the Chebyshev polynomial\n"
6773     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6774     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6775     "\n"
6776     "Returns\n"
6777     "-------\n"
6778     "T : scalar or ndarray\n"
6779     "    Values of the Chebyshev polynomial\n"
6780     "\n"
6781     "See Also\n"
6782     "--------\n"
6783     "roots_chebyt : roots and quadrature weights of Chebyshev\n"
6784     "               polynomials of the first kind\n"
6785     "chebyu : Chebychev polynomial object\n"
6786     "eval_chebyu : evaluate Chebyshev polynomials of the second kind\n"
6787     "hyp2f1 : Gauss hypergeometric function\n"
6788     "numpy.polynomial.chebyshev.Chebyshev : Chebyshev series\n"
6789     "\n"
6790     "Notes\n"
6791     "-----\n"
6792     "This routine is numerically stable for `x` in ``[-1, 1]`` at least\n"
6793     "up to order ``10000``.\n"
6794     "\n"
6795     "References\n"
6796     "----------\n"
6797     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
6798     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
6799     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
6800 ufunc_eval_chebyt_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
6801 ufunc_eval_chebyt_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
6802 ufunc_eval_chebyt_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_fF_F
6803 ufunc_eval_chebyt_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
6804 ufunc_eval_chebyt_loops[4] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_dD_D
6805 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
6806 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6807 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6808 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6809 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6810 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6811 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
6812 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[7] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6813 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
6814 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6815 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[10] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6816 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[11] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6817 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[12] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
6818 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[13] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6819 ufunc_eval_chebyt_types[14] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
6820 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyt_l
6821 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyt")
6822 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyt[double]
6823 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyt")
6824 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyt[double_complex]
6825 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyt")
6826 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*3] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyt[double]
6827 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyt")
6828 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*4] = <void*>_func_eval_chebyt[double_complex]
6829 ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*4+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_chebyt")
6830 ufunc_eval_chebyt_data[0] = &ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*0]
6831 ufunc_eval_chebyt_data[1] = &ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*1]
6832 ufunc_eval_chebyt_data[2] = &ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*2]
6833 ufunc_eval_chebyt_data[3] = &ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*3]
6834 ufunc_eval_chebyt_data[4] = &ufunc_eval_chebyt_ptr[2*4]
6835 eval_chebyt = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_eval_chebyt_loops, ufunc_eval_chebyt_data, ufunc_eval_chebyt_types, 5, 2, 1, 0, "eval_chebyt", ufunc_eval_chebyt_doc, 0)
6836 
6837 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_chebyu_loops[5]
6838 cdef void *ufunc_eval_chebyu_ptr[10]
6839 cdef void *ufunc_eval_chebyu_data[5]
6840 cdef char ufunc_eval_chebyu_types[15]
6841 cdef char *ufunc_eval_chebyu_doc = (
6842     "eval_chebyu(n, x, out=None)\n"
6843     "\n"
6844     "Evaluate Chebyshev polynomial of the second kind at a point.\n"
6845     "\n"
6846     "The Chebyshev polynomials of the second kind can be defined via\n"
6847     "the Gauss hypergeometric function :math:`{}_2F_1` as\n"
6848     "\n"
6849     ".. math::\n"
6850     "\n"
6851     "    U_n(x) = (n + 1) {}_2F_1(-n, n + 2; 3/2; (1 - x)/2).\n"
6852     "\n"
6853     "When :math:`n` is an integer the result is a polynomial of degree\n"
6854     ":math:`n`. See 22.5.48 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
6855     "\n"
6856     "Parameters\n"
6857     "----------\n"
6858     "n : array_like\n"
6859     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
6860     "    determined via the relation to the Gauss hypergeometric\n"
6861     "    function.\n"
6862     "x : array_like\n"
6863     "    Points at which to evaluate the Chebyshev polynomial\n"
6864     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6865     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6866     "\n"
6867     "Returns\n"
6868     "-------\n"
6869     "U : scalar or ndarray\n"
6870     "    Values of the Chebyshev polynomial\n"
6871     "\n"
6872     "See Also\n"
6873     "--------\n"
6874     "roots_chebyu : roots and quadrature weights of Chebyshev\n"
6875     "               polynomials of the second kind\n"
6876     "chebyu : Chebyshev polynomial object\n"
6877     "eval_chebyt : evaluate Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind\n"
6878     "hyp2f1 : Gauss hypergeometric function\n"
6879     "\n"
6880     "References\n"
6881     "----------\n"
6882     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
6883     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
6884     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
6885 ufunc_eval_chebyu_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d

6922 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_gegenbauer_loops[5]
6923 cdef void *ufunc_eval_gegenbauer_ptr[10]
6924 cdef void *ufunc_eval_gegenbauer_data[5]
6925 cdef char ufunc_eval_gegenbauer_types[20]
6926 cdef char *ufunc_eval_gegenbauer_doc = (
6927     "eval_gegenbauer(n, alpha, x, out=None)\n"
6928     "\n"
6929     "Evaluate Gegenbauer polynomial at a point.\n"
6930     "\n"
6931     "The Gegenbauer polynomials can be defined via the Gauss\n"
6932     "hypergeometric function :math:`{}_2F_1` as\n"
6933     "\n"
6934     ".. math::\n"
6935     "\n"
6936     "    C_n^{(\\alpha)} = \\frac{(2\\alpha)_n}{\\Gamma(n + 1)}\n"
6937     "      {}_2F_1(-n, 2\\alpha + n; \\alpha + 1/2; (1 - z)/2).\n"
6938     "\n"
6939     "When :math:`n` is an integer the result is a polynomial of degree\n"
6940     ":math:`n`. See 22.5.46 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
6941     "\n"
6942     "Parameters\n"
6943     "----------\n"
6944     "n : array_like\n"
6945     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
6946     "    determined via the relation to the Gauss hypergeometric\n"
6947     "    function.\n"
6948     "alpha : array_like\n"
6949     "    Parameter\n"
6950     "x : array_like\n"
6951     "    Points at which to evaluate the Gegenbauer polynomial\n"
6952     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
6953     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
6954     "\n"
6955     "Returns\n"
6956     "-------\n"
6957     "C : scalar or ndarray\n"
6958     "    Values of the Gegenbauer polynomial\n"
6959     "\n"
6960     "See Also\n"
6961     "--------\n"
6962     "roots_gegenbauer : roots and quadrature weights of Gegenbauer\n"
6963     "                   polynomials\n"
6964     "gegenbauer : Gegenbauer polynomial object\n"
6965     "hyp2f1 : Gauss hypergeometric function\n"
6966     "\n"
6967     "References\n"
6968     "----------\n"
6969     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
6970     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
6971     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
6972 ufunc_eval_gegenbauer_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pdd__As_pdd_d
6973 ufunc_eval_gegenbauer_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f

6976 ufunc_eval_gegenbauer_loops[4] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_ddD__As_ddD_D

7013 
7014 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_loops[5]
7015 cdef void *ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_ptr[10]
7016 cdef void *ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_data[5]
7017 cdef char ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_types[20]
7018 cdef char *ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_doc = (
7019     "eval_genlaguerre(n, alpha, x, out=None)\n"
7020     "\n"
7021     "Evaluate generalized Laguerre polynomial at a point.\n"
7022     "\n"
7023     "The generalized Laguerre polynomials can be defined via the\n"
7024     "confluent hypergeometric function :math:`{}_1F_1` as\n"
7025     "\n"
7026     ".. math::\n"
7027     "\n"
7028     "    L_n^{(\\alpha)}(x) = \\binom{n + \\alpha}{n}\n"
7029     "      {}_1F_1(-n, \\alpha + 1, x).\n"
7030     "\n"
7031     "When :math:`n` is an integer the result is a polynomial of degree\n"
7032     ":math:`n`. See 22.5.54 in [AS]_ for details. The Laguerre\n"
7033     "polynomials are the special case where :math:`\\alpha = 0`.\n"
7034     "\n"
7035     "Parameters\n"
7036     "----------\n"
7037     "n : array_like\n"
7038     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
7039     "    determined via the relation to the confluent hypergeometric\n"
7040     "    function.\n"
7041     "alpha : array_like\n"
7042     "    Parameter; must have ``alpha > -1``\n"
7043     "x : array_like\n"
7044     "    Points at which to evaluate the generalized Laguerre\n"
7045     "    polynomial\n"
7046     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7047     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7048     "\n"
7049     "Returns\n"
7050     "-------\n"
7051     "L : scalar or ndarray\n"
7052     "    Values of the generalized Laguerre polynomial\n"
7053     "\n"
7054     "See Also\n"
7055     "--------\n"
7056     "roots_genlaguerre : roots and quadrature weights of generalized\n"
7057     "                    Laguerre polynomials\n"
7058     "genlaguerre : generalized Laguerre polynomial object\n"
7059     "hyp1f1 : confluent hypergeometric function\n"
7060     "eval_laguerre : evaluate Laguerre polynomials\n"
7061     "\n"
7062     "References\n"
7063     "----------\n"
7064     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7065     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7066     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
7067 ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pdd__As_pdd_d

7072 ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
7073 ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7074 ufunc_eval_genlaguerre_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE

7109 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_hermite_loops[1]
7110 cdef void *ufunc_eval_hermite_ptr[2]
7111 cdef void *ufunc_eval_hermite_data[1]
7112 cdef char ufunc_eval_hermite_types[3]
7113 cdef char *ufunc_eval_hermite_doc = (
7114     "eval_hermite(n, x, out=None)\n"
7115     "\n"
7116     "Evaluate physicist's Hermite polynomial at a point.\n"
7117     "\n"
7118     "Defined by\n"
7119     "\n"
7120     ".. math::\n"
7121     "\n"
7122     "    H_n(x) = (-1)^n e^{x^2} \\frac{d^n}{dx^n} e^{-x^2};\n"
7123     "\n"
7124     ":math:`H_n` is a polynomial of degree :math:`n`. See 22.11.7 in\n"
7125     "[AS]_ for details.\n"
7126     "\n"
7127     "Parameters\n"
7128     "----------\n"
7129     "n : array_like\n"
7130     "    Degree of the polynomial\n"
7131     "x : array_like\n"
7132     "    Points at which to evaluate the Hermite polynomial\n"
7133     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7134     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7135     "\n"
7136     "Returns\n"
7137     "-------\n"
7138     "H : scalar or ndarray\n"
7139     "    Values of the Hermite polynomial\n"
7140     "\n"
7141     "See Also\n"
7142     "--------\n"
7143     "roots_hermite : roots and quadrature weights of physicist's\n"
7144     "                Hermite polynomials\n"
7145     "hermite : physicist's Hermite polynomial object\n"
7146     "numpy.polynomial.hermite.Hermite : Physicist's Hermite series\n"
7147     "eval_hermitenorm : evaluate Probabilist's Hermite polynomials\n"
7148     "\n"
7149     "References\n"
7150     "----------\n"
7151     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7152     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7153     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
7154 ufunc_eval_hermite_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
7155 ufunc_eval_hermite_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
7156 ufunc_eval_hermite_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7157 ufunc_eval_hermite_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7158 ufunc_eval_hermite_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_eval_hermite
7159 ufunc_eval_hermite_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_hermite")
7160 ufunc_eval_hermite_data[0] = &ufunc_eval_hermite_ptr[2*0]
7161 eval_hermite = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_eval_hermite_loops, ufunc_eval_hermite_data, ufunc_eval_hermite_types, 1, 2, 1, 0, "eval_hermite", ufunc_eval_hermite_doc, 0)

7163 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_loops[1]
7164 cdef void *ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_ptr[2]
7165 cdef void *ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_data[1]
7166 cdef char ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_types[3]
7167 cdef char *ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_doc = (
7168     "eval_hermitenorm(n, x, out=None)\n"
7169     "\n"
7170     "Evaluate probabilist's (normalized) Hermite polynomial at a\n"
7171     "point.\n"
7172     "\n"
7173     "Defined by\n"
7174     "\n"
7175     ".. math::\n"
7176     "\n"
7177     "    He_n(x) = (-1)^n e^{x^2/2} \\frac{d^n}{dx^n} e^{-x^2/2};\n"
7178     "\n"
7179     ":math:`He_n` is a polynomial of degree :math:`n`. See 22.11.8 in\n"
7180     "[AS]_ for details.\n"
7181     "\n"
7182     "Parameters\n"
7183     "----------\n"
7184     "n : array_like\n"
7185     "    Degree of the polynomial\n"
7186     "x : array_like\n"
7187     "    Points at which to evaluate the Hermite polynomial\n"
7188     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7189     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7190     "\n"
7191     "Returns\n"
7192     "-------\n"
7193     "He : scalar or ndarray\n"
7194     "    Values of the Hermite polynomial\n"
7195     "\n"
7196     "See Also\n"
7197     "--------\n"
7198     "roots_hermitenorm : roots and quadrature weights of probabilist's\n"
7199     "                    Hermite polynomials\n"
7200     "hermitenorm : probabilist's Hermite polynomial object\n"
7201     "numpy.polynomial.hermite_e.HermiteE : Probabilist's Hermite series\n"
7202     "eval_hermite : evaluate physicist's Hermite polynomials\n"
7203     "\n"
7204     "References\n"
7205     "----------\n"
7206     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7207     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7208     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
7209 ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
7210 ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
7211 ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7212 ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE

7214 ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_hermitenorm")
7215 ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_data[0] = &ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_ptr[2*0]
7216 eval_hermitenorm = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_loops, ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_data, ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_types, 1, 2, 1, 0, "eval_hermitenorm", ufunc_eval_hermitenorm_doc, 0)
7217 
7218 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_jacobi_loops[5]
7219 cdef void *ufunc_eval_jacobi_ptr[10]
7220 cdef void *ufunc_eval_jacobi_data[5]
7221 cdef char ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[25]
7222 cdef char *ufunc_eval_jacobi_doc = (
7223     "eval_jacobi(n, alpha, beta, x, out=None)\n"
7224     "\n"
7225     "Evaluate Jacobi polynomial at a point.\n"
7226     "\n"
7227     "The Jacobi polynomials can be defined via the Gauss hypergeometric\n"
7228     "function :math:`{}_2F_1` as\n"
7229     "\n"
7230     ".. math::\n"
7231     "\n"
7232     "    P_n^{(\\alpha, \\beta)}(x) = \\frac{(\\alpha + 1)_n}{\\Gamma(n + 1)}\n"
7233     "      {}_2F_1(-n, 1 + \\alpha + \\beta + n; \\alpha + 1; (1 - z)/2)\n"
7234     "\n"
7235     "where :math:`(\\cdot)_n` is the Pochhammer symbol; see `poch`. When\n"
7236     ":math:`n` is an integer the result is a polynomial of degree\n"
7237     ":math:`n`. See 22.5.42 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
7238     "\n"
7239     "Parameters\n"
7240     "----------\n"
7241     "n : array_like\n"
7242     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer the result is\n"
7243     "    determined via the relation to the Gauss hypergeometric\n"
7244     "    function.\n"
7245     "alpha : array_like\n"
7246     "    Parameter\n"
7247     "beta : array_like\n"
7248     "    Parameter\n"
7249     "x : array_like\n"
7250     "    Points at which to evaluate the polynomial\n"
7251     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7252     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7253     "\n"
7254     "Returns\n"
7255     "-------\n"
7256     "P : scalar or ndarray\n"
7257     "    Values of the Jacobi polynomial\n"
7258     "\n"
7259     "See Also\n"
7260     "--------\n"
7261     "roots_jacobi : roots and quadrature weights of Jacobi polynomials\n"
7262     "jacobi : Jacobi polynomial object\n"
7263     "hyp2f1 : Gauss hypergeometric function\n"
7264     "\n"
7265     "References\n"
7266     "----------\n"
7267     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7268     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7269     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
7270 ufunc_eval_jacobi_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pddd__As_pddd_d
7271 ufunc_eval_jacobi_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_ffff_f
7272 ufunc_eval_jacobi_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dddD__As_fffF_F
7273 ufunc_eval_jacobi_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_dddd_d
7274 ufunc_eval_jacobi_loops[4] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dddD__As_dddD_D
7275 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
7276 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7277 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7278 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7279 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7280 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7281 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7282 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[7] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7283 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[8] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7284 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[9] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7285 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[10] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7286 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[11] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7287 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[12] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7288 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[13] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
7289 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[14] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
7290 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[15] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7291 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[16] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7292 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[17] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7293 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[18] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7294 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[19] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7295 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[20] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7296 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[21] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7297 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[22] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7298 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[23] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
7299 ufunc_eval_jacobi_types[24] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
7300 ufunc_eval_jacobi_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_eval_jacobi_l
7301 ufunc_eval_jacobi_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_jacobi")
7302 ufunc_eval_jacobi_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_eval_jacobi[double]

7307 ufunc_eval_jacobi_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_jacobi")
7308 ufunc_eval_jacobi_ptr[2*4] = <void*>_func_eval_jacobi[double_complex]
7309 ufunc_eval_jacobi_ptr[2*4+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_jacobi")

7315 eval_jacobi = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_eval_jacobi_loops, ufunc_eval_jacobi_data, ufunc_eval_jacobi_types, 5, 4, 1, 0, "eval_jacobi", ufunc_eval_jacobi_doc, 0)
7316 
7317 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_laguerre_loops[5]
7318 cdef void *ufunc_eval_laguerre_ptr[10]
7319 cdef void *ufunc_eval_laguerre_data[5]
7320 cdef char ufunc_eval_laguerre_types[15]
7321 cdef char *ufunc_eval_laguerre_doc = (
7322     "eval_laguerre(n, x, out=None)\n"
7323     "\n"
7324     "Evaluate Laguerre polynomial at a point.\n"
7325     "\n"
7326     "The Laguerre polynomials can be defined via the confluent\n"
7327     "hypergeometric function :math:`{}_1F_1` as\n"
7328     "\n"
7329     ".. math::\n"
7330     "\n"
7331     "    L_n(x) = {}_1F_1(-n, 1, x).\n"
7332     "\n"
7333     "See 22.5.16 and 22.5.54 in [AS]_ for details. When :math:`n` is an\n"
7334     "integer the result is a polynomial of degree :math:`n`.\n"
7335     "\n"
7336     "Parameters\n"
7337     "----------\n"
7338     "n : array_like\n"
7339     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer the result is\n"
7340     "    determined via the relation to the confluent hypergeometric\n"
7341     "    function.\n"
7342     "x : array_like\n"
7343     "    Points at which to evaluate the Laguerre polynomial\n"
7344     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7345     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7346     "\n"
7347     "Returns\n"
7348     "-------\n"
7349     "L : scalar or ndarray\n"
7350     "    Values of the Laguerre polynomial\n"
7351     "\n"
7352     "See Also\n"
7353     "--------\n"
7354     "roots_laguerre : roots and quadrature weights of Laguerre\n"
7355     "                 polynomials\n"
7356     "laguerre : Laguerre polynomial object\n"
7357     "numpy.polynomial.laguerre.Laguerre : Laguerre series\n"
7358     "eval_genlaguerre : evaluate generalized Laguerre polynomials\n"
7359     "\n"
7360     "References\n"
7361     "----------\n"
7362     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7363     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7364     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
7365 ufunc_eval_laguerre_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
7366 ufunc_eval_laguerre_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f

7368 ufunc_eval_laguerre_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
7369 ufunc_eval_laguerre_loops[4] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_dD_D

7371 ufunc_eval_laguerre_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE

7376 ufunc_eval_laguerre_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7377 ufunc_eval_laguerre_types[7] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
7378 ufunc_eval_laguerre_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
7379 ufunc_eval_laguerre_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
