7400 eval_laguerre = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_eval_laguerre_loops, ufunc_eval_laguerre_data, ufunc_eval_laguerre_types, 5, 2, 1, 0, "eval_laguerre", ufunc_eval_laguerre_doc, 0)
7401 
7402 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_legendre_loops[5]
7403 cdef void *ufunc_eval_legendre_ptr[10]
7404 cdef void *ufunc_eval_legendre_data[5]
7405 cdef char ufunc_eval_legendre_types[15]
7406 cdef char *ufunc_eval_legendre_doc = (
7407     "eval_legendre(n, x, out=None)\n"
7408     "\n"
7409     "Evaluate Legendre polynomial at a point.\n"
7410     "\n"
7411     "The Legendre polynomials can be defined via the Gauss\n"
7412     "hypergeometric function :math:`{}_2F_1` as\n"
7413     "\n"
7414     ".. math::\n"
7415     "\n"
7416     "    P_n(x) = {}_2F_1(-n, n + 1; 1; (1 - x)/2).\n"
7417     "\n"
7418     "When :math:`n` is an integer the result is a polynomial of degree\n"
7419     ":math:`n`. See 22.5.49 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
7420     "\n"
7421     "Parameters\n"
7422     "----------\n"
7423     "n : array_like\n"
7424     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
7425     "    determined via the relation to the Gauss hypergeometric\n"
7426     "    function.\n"
7427     "x : array_like\n"
7428     "    Points at which to evaluate the Legendre polynomial\n"
7429     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7430     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7431     "\n"
7432     "Returns\n"
7433     "-------\n"
7434     "P : scalar or ndarray\n"
7435     "    Values of the Legendre polynomial\n"
7436     "\n"
7437     "See Also\n"
7438     "--------\n"
7439     "roots_legendre : roots and quadrature weights of Legendre\n"
7440     "                 polynomials\n"
7441     "legendre : Legendre polynomial object\n"
7442     "hyp2f1 : Gauss hypergeometric function\n"
7443     "numpy.polynomial.legendre.Legendre : Legendre series\n"
7444     "\n"
7445     "References\n"
7446     "----------\n"
7447     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7448     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7449     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.\n"
7450     "\n"
7451     "Examples\n"
7452     "--------\n"
7453     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
7454     ">>> from scipy.special import eval_legendre\n"
7455     "\n"
7456     "Evaluate the zero-order Legendre polynomial at x = 0\n"
7457     "\n"
7458     ">>> eval_legendre(0, 0)\n"
7459     "1.0\n"
7460     "\n"
7461     "Evaluate the first-order Legendre polynomial between -1 and 1\n"
7462     "\n"
7463     ">>> X = np.linspace(-1, 1, 5)  # Domain of Legendre polynomials\n"
7464     ">>> eval_legendre(1, X)\n"
7465     "array([-1. , -0.5,  0. ,  0.5,  1. ])\n"
7466     "\n"
7467     "Evaluate Legendre polynomials of order 0 through 4 at x = 0\n"
7468     "\n"
7469     ">>> N = range(0, 5)\n"
7470     ">>> eval_legendre(N, 0)\n"
7471     "array([ 1.   ,  0.   , -0.5  ,  0.   ,  0.375])\n"
7472     "\n"
7473     "Plot Legendre polynomials of order 0 through 4\n"
7474     "\n"
7475     ">>> X = np.linspace(-1, 1)\n"
7476     "\n"
7477     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
7478     ">>> for n in range(0, 5):\n"
7479     "...     y = eval_legendre(n, X)\n"
7480     "...     plt.plot(X, y, label=r'$P_{}(x)$'.format(n))\n"
7481     "\n"
7482     ">>> plt.title(\"Legendre Polynomials\")\n"
7483     ">>> plt.xlabel(\"x\")\n"
7484     ">>> plt.ylabel(r'$P_n(x)$')\n"
7485     ">>> plt.legend(loc='lower right')\n"
7486     ">>> plt.show()")
7487 ufunc_eval_legendre_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
7488 ufunc_eval_legendre_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
7489 ufunc_eval_legendre_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_fF_F
7490 ufunc_eval_legendre_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
7491 ufunc_eval_legendre_loops[4] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_dD_D
7492 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
7493 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7494 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7495 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7496 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7497 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7498 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7499 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[7] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
7500 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
7501 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7502 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[10] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7503 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[11] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7504 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[12] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE

7506 ufunc_eval_legendre_types[14] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE

7517 ufunc_eval_legendre_data[0] = &ufunc_eval_legendre_ptr[2*0]

7523 
7524 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_loops[5]
7525 cdef void *ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_ptr[10]
7526 cdef void *ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_data[5]
7527 cdef char ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[15]
7528 cdef char *ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_doc = (
7529     "eval_sh_chebyt(n, x, out=None)\n"
7530     "\n"
7531     "Evaluate shifted Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind at a\n"
7532     "point.\n"
7533     "\n"
7534     "These polynomials are defined as\n"
7535     "\n"
7536     ".. math::\n"
7537     "\n"
7538     "    T_n^*(x) = T_n(2x - 1)\n"
7539     "\n"
7540     "where :math:`T_n` is a Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind. See\n"
7541     "22.5.14 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
7542     "\n"
7543     "Parameters\n"
7544     "----------\n"
7545     "n : array_like\n"
7546     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
7547     "    determined via the relation to `eval_chebyt`.\n"
7548     "x : array_like\n"
7549     "    Points at which to evaluate the shifted Chebyshev polynomial\n"
7550     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7551     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7552     "\n"
7553     "Returns\n"
7554     "-------\n"
7555     "T : scalar or ndarray\n"
7556     "    Values of the shifted Chebyshev polynomial\n"
7557     "\n"
7558     "See Also\n"
7559     "--------\n"
7560     "roots_sh_chebyt : roots and quadrature weights of shifted\n"
7561     "                  Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind\n"
7562     "sh_chebyt : shifted Chebyshev polynomial object\n"
7563     "eval_chebyt : evaluate Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind\n"
7564     "numpy.polynomial.chebyshev.Chebyshev : Chebyshev series\n"
7565     "\n"
7566     "References\n"
7567     "----------\n"
7568     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7569     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7570     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
7571 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
7572 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
7573 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_fF_F
7574 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
7575 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_loops[4] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_dD_D
7576 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
7577 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7578 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7579 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7580 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7581 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7582 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7583 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[7] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
7584 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[8] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
7585 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7586 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[10] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7587 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[11] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7588 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[12] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7589 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[13] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
7590 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_types[14] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
7591 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_eval_sh_chebyt_l
7592 ufunc_eval_sh_chebyt_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"eval_sh_chebyt")

7607 
7608 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_sh_chebyu_loops[5]
7609 cdef void *ufunc_eval_sh_chebyu_ptr[10]
7610 cdef void *ufunc_eval_sh_chebyu_data[5]
7611 cdef char ufunc_eval_sh_chebyu_types[15]
7612 cdef char *ufunc_eval_sh_chebyu_doc = (
7613     "eval_sh_chebyu(n, x, out=None)\n"
7614     "\n"
7615     "Evaluate shifted Chebyshev polynomial of the second kind at a\n"
7616     "point.\n"
7617     "\n"
7618     "These polynomials are defined as\n"
7619     "\n"
7620     ".. math::\n"
7621     "\n"
7622     "    U_n^*(x) = U_n(2x - 1)\n"
7623     "\n"
7624     "where :math:`U_n` is a Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind. See\n"
7625     "22.5.15 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
7626     "\n"
7627     "Parameters\n"
7628     "----------\n"
7629     "n : array_like\n"
7630     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
7631     "    determined via the relation to `eval_chebyu`.\n"
7632     "x : array_like\n"
7633     "    Points at which to evaluate the shifted Chebyshev polynomial\n"
7634     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7635     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7636     "\n"
7637     "Returns\n"
7638     "-------\n"
7639     "U : scalar or ndarray\n"
7640     "    Values of the shifted Chebyshev polynomial\n"
7641     "\n"
7642     "See Also\n"
7643     "--------\n"
7644     "roots_sh_chebyu : roots and quadrature weights of shifted\n"
7645     "                  Chebychev polynomials of the second kind\n"
7646     "sh_chebyu : shifted Chebyshev polynomial object\n"
7647     "eval_chebyu : evaluate Chebyshev polynomials of the second kind\n"
7648     "\n"
7649     "References\n"
7650     "----------\n"
7651     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7652     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7653     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")

7691 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_sh_jacobi_loops[5]
7692 cdef void *ufunc_eval_sh_jacobi_ptr[10]
7693 cdef void *ufunc_eval_sh_jacobi_data[5]
7694 cdef char ufunc_eval_sh_jacobi_types[25]
7695 cdef char *ufunc_eval_sh_jacobi_doc = (
7696     "eval_sh_jacobi(n, p, q, x, out=None)\n"
7697     "\n"
7698     "Evaluate shifted Jacobi polynomial at a point.\n"
7699     "\n"
7700     "Defined by\n"
7701     "\n"
7702     ".. math::\n"
7703     "\n"
7704     "    G_n^{(p, q)}(x)\n"
7705     "      = \\binom{2n + p - 1}{n}^{-1} P_n^{(p - q, q - 1)}(2x - 1),\n"
7706     "\n"
7707     "where :math:`P_n^{(\\cdot, \\cdot)}` is the n-th Jacobi\n"
7708     "polynomial. See 22.5.2 in [AS]_ for details.\n"
7709     "\n"
7710     "Parameters\n"
7711     "----------\n"
7712     "n : int\n"
7713     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the result is\n"
7714     "    determined via the relation to `binom` and `eval_jacobi`.\n"
7715     "p : float\n"
7716     "    Parameter\n"
7717     "q : float\n"
7718     "    Parameter\n"
7719     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7720     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7721     "\n"
7722     "Returns\n"
7723     "-------\n"
7724     "G : scalar or ndarray\n"
7725     "    Values of the shifted Jacobi polynomial.\n"
7726     "\n"
7727     "See Also\n"
7728     "--------\n"
7729     "roots_sh_jacobi : roots and quadrature weights of shifted Jacobi\n"
7730     "                  polynomials\n"
7731     "sh_jacobi : shifted Jacobi polynomial object\n"
7732     "eval_jacobi : evaluate Jacobi polynomials\n"
7733     "\n"
7734     "References\n"
7735     "----------\n"
7736     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7737     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7738     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")
7739 ufunc_eval_sh_jacobi_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pddd__As_pddd_d
7740 ufunc_eval_sh_jacobi_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_ffff_f

7751 ufunc_eval_sh_jacobi_types[7] = <char>NPY_FLOAT

7786 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_eval_sh_legendre_loops[5]
7787 cdef void *ufunc_eval_sh_legendre_ptr[10]
7788 cdef void *ufunc_eval_sh_legendre_data[5]
7789 cdef char ufunc_eval_sh_legendre_types[15]
7790 cdef char *ufunc_eval_sh_legendre_doc = (
7791     "eval_sh_legendre(n, x, out=None)\n"
7792     "\n"
7793     "Evaluate shifted Legendre polynomial at a point.\n"
7794     "\n"
7795     "These polynomials are defined as\n"
7796     "\n"
7797     ".. math::\n"
7798     "\n"
7799     "    P_n^*(x) = P_n(2x - 1)\n"
7800     "\n"
7801     "where :math:`P_n` is a Legendre polynomial. See 2.2.11 in [AS]_\n"
7802     "for details.\n"
7803     "\n"
7804     "Parameters\n"
7805     "----------\n"
7806     "n : array_like\n"
7807     "    Degree of the polynomial. If not an integer, the value is\n"
7808     "    determined via the relation to `eval_legendre`.\n"
7809     "x : array_like\n"
7810     "    Points at which to evaluate the shifted Legendre polynomial\n"
7811     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7812     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7813     "\n"
7814     "Returns\n"
7815     "-------\n"
7816     "P : scalar or ndarray\n"
7817     "    Values of the shifted Legendre polynomial\n"
7818     "\n"
7819     "See Also\n"
7820     "--------\n"
7821     "roots_sh_legendre : roots and quadrature weights of shifted\n"
7822     "                    Legendre polynomials\n"
7823     "sh_legendre : shifted Legendre polynomial object\n"
7824     "eval_legendre : evaluate Legendre polynomials\n"
7825     "numpy.polynomial.legendre.Legendre : Legendre series\n"
7826     "\n"
7827     "References\n"
7828     "----------\n"
7829     ".. [AS] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
7830     "    Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
7831     "    Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.")

7869 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_exp10_loops[2]
7870 cdef void *ufunc_exp10_ptr[4]
7871 cdef void *ufunc_exp10_data[2]
7872 cdef char ufunc_exp10_types[4]
7873 cdef char *ufunc_exp10_doc = (
7874     "exp10(x, out=None)\n"
7875     "\n"
7876     "Compute ``10**x`` element-wise.\n"
7877     "\n"
7878     "Parameters\n"
7879     "----------\n"
7880     "x : array_like\n"
7881     "    `x` must contain real numbers.\n"
7882     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7883     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7884     "\n"
7885     "Returns\n"
7886     "-------\n"
7887     "scalar or ndarray\n"
7888     "    ``10**x``, computed element-wise.\n"
7889     "\n"
7890     "Examples\n"
7891     "--------\n"
7892     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
7893     ">>> from scipy.special import exp10\n"
7894     "\n"
7895     ">>> exp10(3)\n"
7896     "1000.0\n"
7897     ">>> x = np.array([[-1, -0.5, 0], [0.5, 1, 1.5]])\n"
7898     ">>> exp10(x)\n"
7899     "array([[  0.1       ,   0.31622777,   1.        ],\n"
7900     "       [  3.16227766,  10.        ,  31.6227766 ]])")
7901 ufunc_exp10_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
7902 ufunc_exp10_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
7903 ufunc_exp10_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7904 ufunc_exp10_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7905 ufunc_exp10_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7906 ufunc_exp10_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE

7908 ufunc_exp10_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"exp10")

7910 ufunc_exp10_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"exp10")
7911 ufunc_exp10_data[0] = &ufunc_exp10_ptr[2*0]
7912 ufunc_exp10_data[1] = &ufunc_exp10_ptr[2*1]
7913 exp10 = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_exp10_loops, ufunc_exp10_data, ufunc_exp10_types, 2, 1, 1, 0, "exp10", ufunc_exp10_doc, 0)

7915 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_exp2_loops[2]
7916 cdef void *ufunc_exp2_ptr[4]
7917 cdef void *ufunc_exp2_data[2]
7918 cdef char ufunc_exp2_types[4]
7919 cdef char *ufunc_exp2_doc = (
7920     "exp2(x, out=None)\n"
7921     "\n"
7922     "Compute ``2**x`` element-wise.\n"
7923     "\n"
7924     "Parameters\n"
7925     "----------\n"
7926     "x : array_like\n"
7927     "    `x` must contain real numbers.\n"
7928     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7929     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7930     "\n"
7931     "Returns\n"
7932     "-------\n"
7933     "scalar or ndarray\n"
7934     "    ``2**x``, computed element-wise.\n"
7935     "\n"
7936     "Examples\n"
7937     "--------\n"
7938     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
7939     ">>> from scipy.special import exp2\n"
7940     "\n"
7941     ">>> exp2(3)\n"
7942     "8.0\n"
7943     ">>> x = np.array([[-1, -0.5, 0], [0.5, 1, 1.5]])\n"
7944     ">>> exp2(x)\n"
7945     "array([[ 0.5       ,  0.70710678,  1.        ],\n"
7946     "       [ 1.41421356,  2.        ,  2.82842712]])")
7947 ufunc_exp2_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
7948 ufunc_exp2_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
7949 ufunc_exp2_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7950 ufunc_exp2_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
7951 ufunc_exp2_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7952 ufunc_exp2_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
7953 ufunc_exp2_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_exp2
7954 ufunc_exp2_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"exp2")
7955 ufunc_exp2_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_cephes_exp2
7956 ufunc_exp2_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"exp2")
7957 ufunc_exp2_data[0] = &ufunc_exp2_ptr[2*0]
7958 ufunc_exp2_data[1] = &ufunc_exp2_ptr[2*1]
7959 exp2 = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_exp2_loops, ufunc_exp2_data, ufunc_exp2_types, 2, 1, 1, 0, "exp2", ufunc_exp2_doc, 0)
7960 
7961 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_expm1_loops[4]
7962 cdef void *ufunc_expm1_ptr[8]
7963 cdef void *ufunc_expm1_data[4]
7964 cdef char ufunc_expm1_types[8]
7965 cdef char *ufunc_expm1_doc = (
7966     "expm1(x, out=None)\n"
7967     "\n"
7968     "Compute ``exp(x) - 1``.\n"
7969     "\n"
7970     "When `x` is near zero, ``exp(x)`` is near 1, so the numerical calculation\n"
7971     "of ``exp(x) - 1`` can suffer from catastrophic loss of precision.\n"
7972     "``expm1(x)`` is implemented to avoid the loss of precision that occurs when\n"
7973     "`x` is near zero.\n"
7974     "\n"
7975     "Parameters\n"
7976     "----------\n"
7977     "x : array_like\n"
7978     "    `x` must contain real numbers.\n"
7979     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
7980     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
7981     "\n"
7982     "Returns\n"
7983     "-------\n"
7984     "scalar or ndarray\n"
7985     "    ``exp(x) - 1`` computed element-wise.\n"
7986     "\n"
7987     "Examples\n"
7988     "--------\n"
7989     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
7990     ">>> from scipy.special import expm1\n"
7991     "\n"
7992     ">>> expm1(1.0)\n"
7993     "1.7182818284590451\n"
7994     ">>> expm1([-0.2, -0.1, 0, 0.1, 0.2])\n"
7995     "array([-0.18126925, -0.09516258,  0.        ,  0.10517092,  0.22140276])\n"
7996     "\n"
7997     "The exact value of ``exp(7.5e-13) - 1`` is::\n"
7998     "\n"
7999     "    7.5000000000028125000000007031250000001318...*10**-13.\n"
8000     "\n"
8001     "Here is what ``expm1(7.5e-13)`` gives:\n"
8002     "\n"
8003     ">>> expm1(7.5e-13)\n"
8004     "7.5000000000028135e-13\n"
8005     "\n"
8006     "Compare that to ``exp(7.5e-13) - 1``, where the subtraction results in\n"
8007     "a \"catastrophic\" loss of precision:\n"
8008     "\n"
8009     ">>> np.exp(7.5e-13) - 1\n"
8010     "7.5006667543675576e-13")
8011 ufunc_expm1_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
8012 ufunc_expm1_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
8013 ufunc_expm1_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_F_F
8014 ufunc_expm1_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_D_D
8015 ufunc_expm1_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8016 ufunc_expm1_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8017 ufunc_expm1_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8018 ufunc_expm1_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8019 ufunc_expm1_types[4] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
8020 ufunc_expm1_types[5] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
8021 ufunc_expm1_types[6] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
8022 ufunc_expm1_types[7] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
8023 ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_expm1
8024 ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"expm1")
8025 ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_cephes_expm1
8026 ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"expm1")
8027 ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_cexpm1
8028 ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"expm1")
8029 ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*3] = <void*>_func_cexpm1
8030 ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"expm1")
8031 ufunc_expm1_data[0] = &ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*0]
8032 ufunc_expm1_data[1] = &ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*1]
8033 ufunc_expm1_data[2] = &ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*2]
8034 ufunc_expm1_data[3] = &ufunc_expm1_ptr[2*3]
8035 expm1 = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_expm1_loops, ufunc_expm1_data, ufunc_expm1_types, 4, 1, 1, 0, "expm1", ufunc_expm1_doc, 0)
8036 
8037 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_expn_loops[3]
8038 cdef void *ufunc_expn_ptr[6]
8039 cdef void *ufunc_expn_data[3]
8040 cdef char ufunc_expn_types[9]
8041 cdef char *ufunc_expn_doc = (
8042     "expn(n, x, out=None)\n"
8043     "\n"
8044     "Generalized exponential integral En.\n"
8045     "\n"
8046     "For integer :math:`n \\geq 0` and real :math:`x \\geq 0` the\n"
8047     "generalized exponential integral is defined as [dlmf]_\n"
8048     "\n"
8049     ".. math::\n"
8050     "\n"
8051     "    E_n(x) = x^{n - 1} \\int_x^\\infty \\frac{e^{-t}}{t^n} dt.\n"
8052     "\n"
8053     "Parameters\n"
8054     "----------\n"
8055     "n : array_like\n"
8056     "    Non-negative integers\n"
8057     "x : array_like\n"
8058     "    Real argument\n"
8059     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8060     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
8061     "\n"
8062     "Returns\n"
8063     "-------\n"
8064     "scalar or ndarray\n"
8065     "    Values of the generalized exponential integral\n"
8066     "\n"
8067     "See Also\n"
8068     "--------\n"
8069     "exp1 : special case of :math:`E_n` for :math:`n = 1`\n"
8070     "expi : related to :math:`E_n` when :math:`n = 1`\n"
8071     "\n"
8072     "References\n"
8073     "----------\n"
8074     ".. [dlmf] Digital Library of Mathematical Functions, 8.19.2\n"
8075     "          https://dlmf.nist.gov/8.19#E2\n"
8076     "\n"
8077     "Examples\n"
8078     "--------\n"
8079     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
8080     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
8081     "\n"
8082     "Its domain is nonnegative n and x.\n"
8083     "\n"
8084     ">>> sc.expn(-1, 1.0), sc.expn(1, -1.0)\n"
8085     "(nan, nan)\n"
8086     "\n"
8087     "It has a pole at ``x = 0`` for ``n = 1, 2``; for larger ``n`` it\n"
8088     "is equal to ``1 / (n - 1)``.\n"
8089     "\n"
8090     ">>> sc.expn([0, 1, 2, 3, 4], 0)\n"
8091     "array([       inf,        inf, 1.        , 0.5       , 0.33333333])\n"
8092     "\n"
8093     "For n equal to 0 it reduces to ``exp(-x) / x``.\n"
8094     "\n"
8095     ">>> x = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4])\n"
8096     ">>> sc.expn(0, x)\n"
8097     "array([0.36787944, 0.06766764, 0.01659569, 0.00457891])\n"
8098     ">>> np.exp(-x) / x\n"
8099     "array([0.36787944, 0.06766764, 0.01659569, 0.00457891])\n"
8100     "\n"
8101     "For n equal to 1 it reduces to `exp1`.\n"
8102     "\n"
8103     ">>> sc.expn(1, x)\n"
8104     "array([0.21938393, 0.04890051, 0.01304838, 0.00377935])\n"
8105     ">>> sc.exp1(x)\n"
8106     "array([0.21938393, 0.04890051, 0.01304838, 0.00377935])")
8107 ufunc_expn_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
8108 ufunc_expn_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
8109 ufunc_expn_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
8110 ufunc_expn_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
8111 ufunc_expn_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8112 ufunc_expn_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8113 ufunc_expn_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8114 ufunc_expn_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8115 ufunc_expn_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8116 ufunc_expn_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8117 ufunc_expn_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8118 ufunc_expn_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8119 ufunc_expn_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_expn_wrap
8120 ufunc_expn_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"expn")
8121 ufunc_expn_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_expn_unsafe
8122 ufunc_expn_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"expn")
8123 ufunc_expn_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_expn_unsafe
8124 ufunc_expn_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"expn")
8125 ufunc_expn_data[0] = &ufunc_expn_ptr[2*0]
8126 ufunc_expn_data[1] = &ufunc_expn_ptr[2*1]
8127 ufunc_expn_data[2] = &ufunc_expn_ptr[2*2]
8128 expn = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_expn_loops, ufunc_expn_data, ufunc_expn_types, 3, 2, 1, 0, "expn", ufunc_expn_doc, 0)
8129 
8130 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_fdtr_loops[2]
8131 cdef void *ufunc_fdtr_ptr[4]
8132 cdef void *ufunc_fdtr_data[2]
8133 cdef char ufunc_fdtr_types[8]
8134 cdef char *ufunc_fdtr_doc = (
8135     "fdtr(dfn, dfd, x, out=None)\n"
8136     "\n"
8137     "F cumulative distribution function.\n"
8138     "\n"
8139     "Returns the value of the cumulative distribution function of the\n"
8140     "F-distribution, also known as Snedecor's F-distribution or the\n"
8141     "Fisher-Snedecor distribution.\n"
8142     "\n"
8143     "The F-distribution with parameters :math:`d_n` and :math:`d_d` is the\n"
8144     "distribution of the random variable,\n"
8145     "\n"
8146     ".. math::\n"
8147     "    X = \\frac{U_n/d_n}{U_d/d_d},\n"
8148     "\n"
8149     "where :math:`U_n` and :math:`U_d` are random variables distributed\n"
8150     ":math:`\\chi^2`, with :math:`d_n` and :math:`d_d` degrees of freedom,\n"
8151     "respectively.\n"
8152     "\n"
8153     "Parameters\n"
8154     "----------\n"
8155     "dfn : array_like\n"
8156     "    First parameter (positive float).\n"
8157     "dfd : array_like\n"
8158     "    Second parameter (positive float).\n"
8159     "x : array_like\n"
8160     "    Argument (nonnegative float).\n"
8161     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8162     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
8163     "\n"
8164     "Returns\n"
8165     "-------\n"
8166     "y : scalar or ndarray\n"
8167     "    The CDF of the F-distribution with parameters `dfn` and `dfd` at `x`.\n"
8168     "\n"
8169     "See Also\n"
8170     "--------\n"
8171     "fdtrc : F distribution survival function\n"
8172     "fdtri : F distribution inverse cumulative distribution\n"
8173     "scipy.stats.f : F distribution\n"
8174     "\n"
8175     "Notes\n"
8176     "-----\n"
8177     "The regularized incomplete beta function is used, according to the\n"
8178     "formula,\n"
8179     "\n"
8180     ".. math::\n"
8181     "    F(d_n, d_d; x) = I_{xd_n/(d_d + xd_n)}(d_n/2, d_d/2).\n"
8182     "\n"
8183     "Wrapper for the Cephes [1]_ routine `fdtr`. The F distribution is also\n"
8184     "available as `scipy.stats.f`. Calling `fdtr` directly can improve\n"
8185     "performance compared to the ``cdf`` method of `scipy.stats.f` (see last\n"
8186     "example below).\n"
8187     "\n"
8188     "References\n"
8189     "----------\n"
8190     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
8191     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
8192     "\n"
8193     "Examples\n"
8194     "--------\n"
8195     "Calculate the function for ``dfn=1`` and ``dfd=2`` at ``x=1``.\n"
8196     "\n"
8197     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
8198     ">>> from scipy.special import fdtr\n"
8199     ">>> fdtr(1, 2, 1)\n"
8200     "0.5773502691896258\n"
8201     "\n"
8202     "Calculate the function at several points by providing a NumPy array for\n"
8203     "`x`.\n"
8204     "\n"
8205     ">>> x = np.array([0.5, 2., 3.])\n"
8206     ">>> fdtr(1, 2, x)\n"
8207     "array([0.4472136 , 0.70710678, 0.77459667])\n"
8208     "\n"
8209     "Plot the function for several parameter sets.\n"
8210     "\n"
8211     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
8212     ">>> dfn_parameters = [1, 5, 10, 50]\n"
8213     ">>> dfd_parameters = [1, 1, 2, 3]\n"
8214     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
8215     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(dfn_parameters, dfd_parameters,\n"
8216     "...                            linestyles))\n"
8217     ">>> x = np.linspace(0, 30, 1000)\n"
8218     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
8219     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
8220     "...     dfn, dfd, style = parameter_set\n"
8221     "...     fdtr_vals = fdtr(dfn, dfd, x)\n"
8222     "...     ax.plot(x, fdtr_vals, label=rf\"$d_n={dfn},\\, d_d={dfd}$\",\n"
8223     "...             ls=style)\n"
8224     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
8225     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$x$\")\n"
8226     ">>> ax.set_title(\"F distribution cumulative distribution function\")\n"
8227     ">>> plt.show()\n"
8228     "\n"
8229     "The F distribution is also available as `scipy.stats.f`. Using `fdtr`\n"
8230     "directly can be much faster than calling the ``cdf`` method of\n"
8231     "`scipy.stats.f`, especially for small arrays or individual values.\n"
8232     "To get the same results one must use the following parametrization:\n"
8233     "``stats.f(dfn, dfd).cdf(x)=fdtr(dfn, dfd, x)``.\n"
8234     "\n"
8235     ">>> from scipy.stats import f\n"
8236     ">>> dfn, dfd = 1, 2\n"
8237     ">>> x = 1\n"
8238     ">>> fdtr_res = fdtr(dfn, dfd, x)  # this will often be faster than below\n"
8239     ">>> f_dist_res = f(dfn, dfd).cdf(x)\n"
8240     ">>> fdtr_res == f_dist_res  # test that results are equal\n"
8241     "True")
8242 ufunc_fdtr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
8243 ufunc_fdtr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
8244 ufunc_fdtr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8245 ufunc_fdtr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8246 ufunc_fdtr_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8247 ufunc_fdtr_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8248 ufunc_fdtr_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8249 ufunc_fdtr_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8250 ufunc_fdtr_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8251 ufunc_fdtr_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8252 ufunc_fdtr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_fdtr
8253 ufunc_fdtr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"fdtr")
8254 ufunc_fdtr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_fdtr
8255 ufunc_fdtr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"fdtr")
8256 ufunc_fdtr_data[0] = &ufunc_fdtr_ptr[2*0]
8257 ufunc_fdtr_data[1] = &ufunc_fdtr_ptr[2*1]
8258 fdtr = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_fdtr_loops, ufunc_fdtr_data, ufunc_fdtr_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "fdtr", ufunc_fdtr_doc, 0)
8259 
8260 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_fdtrc_loops[2]
8261 cdef void *ufunc_fdtrc_ptr[4]
8262 cdef void *ufunc_fdtrc_data[2]
8263 cdef char ufunc_fdtrc_types[8]
8264 cdef char *ufunc_fdtrc_doc = (
8265     "fdtrc(dfn, dfd, x, out=None)\n"
8266     "\n"
8267     "F survival function.\n"
8268     "\n"
8269     "Returns the complemented F-distribution function (the integral of the\n"
8270     "density from `x` to infinity).\n"
8271     "\n"
8272     "Parameters\n"
8273     "----------\n"
8274     "dfn : array_like\n"
8275     "    First parameter (positive float).\n"
8276     "dfd : array_like\n"
8277     "    Second parameter (positive float).\n"
8278     "x : array_like\n"
8279     "    Argument (nonnegative float).\n"
8280     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8281     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
8282     "\n"
8283     "Returns\n"
8284     "-------\n"
8285     "y : scalar or ndarray\n"
8286     "    The complemented F-distribution function with parameters `dfn` and\n"
8287     "    `dfd` at `x`.\n"
8288     "\n"
8289     "See Also\n"
8290     "--------\n"
8291     "fdtr : F distribution cumulative distribution function\n"
8292     "fdtri : F distribution inverse cumulative distribution function\n"
8293     "scipy.stats.f : F distribution\n"
8294     "\n"
8295     "Notes\n"
8296     "-----\n"
8297     "The regularized incomplete beta function is used, according to the\n"
8298     "formula,\n"
8299     "\n"
8300     ".. math::\n"
8301     "    F(d_n, d_d; x) = I_{d_d/(d_d + xd_n)}(d_d/2, d_n/2).\n"
8302     "\n"
8303     "Wrapper for the Cephes [1]_ routine `fdtrc`. The F distribution is also\n"
8304     "available as `scipy.stats.f`. Calling `fdtrc` directly can improve\n"
8305     "performance compared to the ``sf`` method of `scipy.stats.f` (see last\n"
8306     "example below).\n"
8307     "\n"
8308     "References\n"
8309     "----------\n"
8310     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
8311     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
8312     "\n"
8313     "Examples\n"
8314     "--------\n"
8315     "Calculate the function for ``dfn=1`` and ``dfd=2`` at ``x=1``.\n"
8316     "\n"
8317     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
8318     ">>> from scipy.special import fdtrc\n"
8319     ">>> fdtrc(1, 2, 1)\n"
8320     "0.42264973081037427\n"
8321     "\n"
8322     "Calculate the function at several points by providing a NumPy array for\n"
8323     "`x`.\n"
8324     "\n"
8325     ">>> x = np.array([0.5, 2., 3.])\n"
8326     ">>> fdtrc(1, 2, x)\n"
8327     "array([0.5527864 , 0.29289322, 0.22540333])\n"
8328     "\n"
8329     "Plot the function for several parameter sets.\n"
8330     "\n"
8331     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
8332     ">>> dfn_parameters = [1, 5, 10, 50]\n"
8333     ">>> dfd_parameters = [1, 1, 2, 3]\n"
8334     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
8335     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(dfn_parameters, dfd_parameters,\n"
8336     "...                            linestyles))\n"
8337     ">>> x = np.linspace(0, 30, 1000)\n"
8338     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
8339     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
8340     "...     dfn, dfd, style = parameter_set\n"
8341     "...     fdtrc_vals = fdtrc(dfn, dfd, x)\n"
8342     "...     ax.plot(x, fdtrc_vals, label=rf\"$d_n={dfn},\\, d_d={dfd}$\",\n"
8343     "...             ls=style)\n"
8344     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
8345     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$x$\")\n"
8346     ">>> ax.set_title(\"F distribution survival function\")\n"
8347     ">>> plt.show()\n"
8348     "\n"
8349     "The F distribution is also available as `scipy.stats.f`. Using `fdtrc`\n"
8350     "directly can be much faster than calling the ``sf`` method of\n"
8351     "`scipy.stats.f`, especially for small arrays or individual values.\n"
8352     "To get the same results one must use the following parametrization:\n"
8353     "``stats.f(dfn, dfd).sf(x)=fdtrc(dfn, dfd, x)``.\n"
8354     "\n"
8355     ">>> from scipy.stats import f\n"
8356     ">>> dfn, dfd = 1, 2\n"
8357     ">>> x = 1\n"
8358     ">>> fdtrc_res = fdtrc(dfn, dfd, x)  # this will often be faster than below\n"
8359     ">>> f_dist_res = f(dfn, dfd).sf(x)\n"
8360     ">>> f_dist_res == fdtrc_res  # test that results are equal\n"
8361     "True")
8362 ufunc_fdtrc_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
8363 ufunc_fdtrc_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
8364 ufunc_fdtrc_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8365 ufunc_fdtrc_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8366 ufunc_fdtrc_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8367 ufunc_fdtrc_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8368 ufunc_fdtrc_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8369 ufunc_fdtrc_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8370 ufunc_fdtrc_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8371 ufunc_fdtrc_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8372 ufunc_fdtrc_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_fdtrc
8373 ufunc_fdtrc_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"fdtrc")
8374 ufunc_fdtrc_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_fdtrc
8375 ufunc_fdtrc_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"fdtrc")
8376 ufunc_fdtrc_data[0] = &ufunc_fdtrc_ptr[2*0]
8377 ufunc_fdtrc_data[1] = &ufunc_fdtrc_ptr[2*1]
8378 fdtrc = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_fdtrc_loops, ufunc_fdtrc_data, ufunc_fdtrc_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "fdtrc", ufunc_fdtrc_doc, 0)
8379 
8380 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_fdtri_loops[2]
8381 cdef void *ufunc_fdtri_ptr[4]
8382 cdef void *ufunc_fdtri_data[2]
8383 cdef char ufunc_fdtri_types[8]
8384 cdef char *ufunc_fdtri_doc = (
8385     "fdtri(dfn, dfd, p, out=None)\n"
8386     "\n"
8387     "The `p`-th quantile of the F-distribution.\n"
8388     "\n"
8389     "This function is the inverse of the F-distribution CDF, `fdtr`, returning\n"
8390     "the `x` such that `fdtr(dfn, dfd, x) = p`.\n"
8391     "\n"
8392     "Parameters\n"
8393     "----------\n"
8394     "dfn : array_like\n"
8395     "    First parameter (positive float).\n"
8396     "dfd : array_like\n"
8397     "    Second parameter (positive float).\n"
8398     "p : array_like\n"
8399     "    Cumulative probability, in [0, 1].\n"
8400     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8401     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
8402     "\n"
8403     "Returns\n"
8404     "-------\n"
8405     "x : scalar or ndarray\n"
8406     "    The quantile corresponding to `p`.\n"
8407     "\n"
8408     "See Also\n"
8409     "--------\n"
8410     "fdtr : F distribution cumulative distribution function\n"
8411     "fdtrc : F distribution survival function\n"
8412     "scipy.stats.f : F distribution\n"
8413     "\n"
8414     "Notes\n"
8415     "-----\n"
8416     "The computation is carried out using the relation to the inverse\n"
8417     "regularized beta function, :math:`I^{-1}_x(a, b)`.  Let\n"
8418     ":math:`z = I^{-1}_p(d_d/2, d_n/2).`  Then,\n"
8419     "\n"
8420     ".. math::\n"
8421     "    x = \\frac{d_d (1 - z)}{d_n z}.\n"
8422     "\n"
8423     "If `p` is such that :math:`x < 0.5`, the following relation is used\n"
8424     "instead for improved stability: let\n"
8425     ":math:`z' = I^{-1}_{1 - p}(d_n/2, d_d/2).` Then,\n"
8426     "\n"
8427     ".. math::\n"
8428     "    x = \\frac{d_d z'}{d_n (1 - z')}.\n"
8429     "\n"
8430     "Wrapper for the Cephes [1]_ routine `fdtri`.\n"
8431     "\n"
8432     "The F distribution is also available as `scipy.stats.f`. Calling\n"
8433     "`fdtri` directly can improve performance compared to the ``ppf``\n"
8434     "method of `scipy.stats.f` (see last example below).\n"
8435     "\n"
8436     "References\n"
8437     "----------\n"
8438     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
8439     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
8440     "\n"
8441     "Examples\n"
8442     "--------\n"
8443     "`fdtri` represents the inverse of the F distribution CDF which is\n"
8444     "available as `fdtr`. Here, we calculate the CDF for ``df1=1``, ``df2=2``\n"
8445     "at ``x=3``. `fdtri` then returns ``3`` given the same values for `df1`,\n"
8446     "`df2` and the computed CDF value.\n"
8447     "\n"
8448     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
8449     ">>> from scipy.special import fdtri, fdtr\n"
8450     ">>> df1, df2 = 1, 2\n"
8451     ">>> x = 3\n"
8452     ">>> cdf_value =  fdtr(df1, df2, x)\n"
8453     ">>> fdtri(df1, df2, cdf_value)\n"
8454     "3.000000000000006\n"
8455     "\n"
8456     "Calculate the function at several points by providing a NumPy array for\n"
8457     "`x`.\n"
8458     "\n"
8459     ">>> x = np.array([0.1, 0.4, 0.7])\n"
8460     ">>> fdtri(1, 2, x)\n"
8461     "array([0.02020202, 0.38095238, 1.92156863])\n"
8462     "\n"
8463     "Plot the function for several parameter sets.\n"
8464     "\n"
8465     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
8466     ">>> dfn_parameters = [50, 10, 1, 50]\n"
8467     ">>> dfd_parameters = [0.5, 1, 1, 5]\n"
8468     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
8469     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(dfn_parameters, dfd_parameters,\n"
8470     "...                            linestyles))\n"
8471     ">>> x = np.linspace(0, 1, 1000)\n"
8472     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
8473     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
8474     "...     dfn, dfd, style = parameter_set\n"
8475     "...     fdtri_vals = fdtri(dfn, dfd, x)\n"
8476     "...     ax.plot(x, fdtri_vals, label=rf\"$d_n={dfn},\\, d_d={dfd}$\",\n"
8477     "...             ls=style)\n"
8478     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
8479     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$x$\")\n"
8480     ">>> title = \"F distribution inverse cumulative distribution function\"\n"
8481     ">>> ax.set_title(title)\n"
8482     ">>> ax.set_ylim(0, 30)\n"
8483     ">>> plt.show()\n"
8484     "\n"
8485     "The F distribution is also available as `scipy.stats.f`. Using `fdtri`\n"
8486     "directly can be much faster than calling the ``ppf`` method of\n"
8487     "`scipy.stats.f`, especially for small arrays or individual values.\n"
8488     "To get the same results one must use the following parametrization:\n"
8489     "``stats.f(dfn, dfd).ppf(x)=fdtri(dfn, dfd, x)``.\n"
8490     "\n"
8491     ">>> from scipy.stats import f\n"
8492     ">>> dfn, dfd = 1, 2\n"
8493     ">>> x = 0.7\n"
8494     ">>> fdtri_res = fdtri(dfn, dfd, x)  # this will often be faster than below\n"
8495     ">>> f_dist_res = f(dfn, dfd).ppf(x)\n"
8496     ">>> f_dist_res == fdtri_res  # test that results are equal\n"
8497     "True")
8498 ufunc_fdtri_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
8499 ufunc_fdtri_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
8500 ufunc_fdtri_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8501 ufunc_fdtri_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8502 ufunc_fdtri_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8503 ufunc_fdtri_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8504 ufunc_fdtri_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8505 ufunc_fdtri_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8506 ufunc_fdtri_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8507 ufunc_fdtri_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8508 ufunc_fdtri_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_fdtri
8509 ufunc_fdtri_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"fdtri")
8510 ufunc_fdtri_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_fdtri
8511 ufunc_fdtri_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"fdtri")
8512 ufunc_fdtri_data[0] = &ufunc_fdtri_ptr[2*0]
8513 ufunc_fdtri_data[1] = &ufunc_fdtri_ptr[2*1]
8514 fdtri = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_fdtri_loops, ufunc_fdtri_data, ufunc_fdtri_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "fdtri", ufunc_fdtri_doc, 0)
8515 
8516 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_fdtridfd_loops[2]
8517 cdef void *ufunc_fdtridfd_ptr[4]
8518 cdef void *ufunc_fdtridfd_data[2]
8519 cdef char ufunc_fdtridfd_types[8]
8520 cdef char *ufunc_fdtridfd_doc = (
8521     "fdtridfd(dfn, p, x, out=None)\n"
8522     "\n"
8523     "Inverse to `fdtr` vs dfd\n"
8524     "\n"
8525     "Finds the F density argument dfd such that ``fdtr(dfn, dfd, x) == p``.\n"
8526     "\n"
8527     "Parameters\n"
8528     "----------\n"
8529     "dfn : array_like\n"
8530     "    First parameter (positive float).\n"
8531     "p : array_like\n"
8532     "    Cumulative probability, in [0, 1].\n"
8533     "x : array_like\n"
8534     "    Argument (nonnegative float).\n"
8535     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8536     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
8537     "\n"
8538     "Returns\n"
8539     "-------\n"
8540     "dfd : scalar or ndarray\n"
8541     "    `dfd` such that ``fdtr(dfn, dfd, x) == p``.\n"
8542     "\n"
8543     "See Also\n"
8544     "--------\n"
8545     "fdtr : F distribution cumulative distribution function\n"
8546     "fdtrc : F distribution survival function\n"
8547     "fdtri : F distribution quantile function\n"
8548     "scipy.stats.f : F distribution\n"
8549     "\n"
8550     "Examples\n"
8551     "--------\n"
8552     "Compute the F distribution cumulative distribution function for one\n"
8553     "parameter set.\n"
8554     "\n"
8555     ">>> from scipy.special import fdtridfd, fdtr\n"
8556     ">>> dfn, dfd, x = 10, 5, 2\n"
8557     ">>> cdf_value = fdtr(dfn, dfd, x)\n"
8558     ">>> cdf_value\n"
8559     "0.7700248806501017\n"
8560     "\n"
8561     "Verify that `fdtridfd` recovers the original value for `dfd`:\n"
8562     "\n"
8563     ">>> fdtridfd(dfn, cdf_value, x)\n"
8564     "5.0")
8565 ufunc_fdtridfd_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
8566 ufunc_fdtridfd_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
8567 ufunc_fdtridfd_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8568 ufunc_fdtridfd_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8569 ufunc_fdtridfd_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8570 ufunc_fdtridfd_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8571 ufunc_fdtridfd_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8572 ufunc_fdtridfd_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8573 ufunc_fdtridfd_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8574 ufunc_fdtridfd_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8575 ufunc_fdtridfd_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_fdtridfd
8576 ufunc_fdtridfd_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"fdtridfd")
8577 ufunc_fdtridfd_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_fdtridfd
8578 ufunc_fdtridfd_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"fdtridfd")
8579 ufunc_fdtridfd_data[0] = &ufunc_fdtridfd_ptr[2*0]
8580 ufunc_fdtridfd_data[1] = &ufunc_fdtridfd_ptr[2*1]
8581 fdtridfd = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_fdtridfd_loops, ufunc_fdtridfd_data, ufunc_fdtridfd_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "fdtridfd", ufunc_fdtridfd_doc, 0)
8582 
8583 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_gdtr_loops[2]
8584 cdef void *ufunc_gdtr_ptr[4]
8585 cdef void *ufunc_gdtr_data[2]
8586 cdef char ufunc_gdtr_types[8]
8587 cdef char *ufunc_gdtr_doc = (
8588     "gdtr(a, b, x, out=None)\n"
8589     "\n"
8590     "Gamma distribution cumulative distribution function.\n"
8591     "\n"
8592     "Returns the integral from zero to `x` of the gamma probability density\n"
8593     "function,\n"
8594     "\n"
8595     ".. math::\n"
8596     "\n"
8597     "    F = \\int_0^x \\frac{a^b}{\\Gamma(b)} t^{b-1} e^{-at}\\,dt,\n"
8598     "\n"
8599     "where :math:`\\Gamma` is the gamma function.\n"
8600     "\n"
8601     "Parameters\n"
8602     "----------\n"
8603     "a : array_like\n"
8604     "    The rate parameter of the gamma distribution, sometimes denoted\n"
8605     "    :math:`\\beta` (float).  It is also the reciprocal of the scale\n"
8606     "    parameter :math:`\\theta`.\n"
8607     "b : array_like\n"
8608     "    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution, sometimes denoted\n"
8609     "    :math:`\\alpha` (float).\n"
8610     "x : array_like\n"
8611     "    The quantile (upper limit of integration; float).\n"
8612     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8613     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
8614     "\n"
8615     "Returns\n"
8616     "-------\n"
8617     "F : scalar or ndarray\n"
8618     "    The CDF of the gamma distribution with parameters `a` and `b`\n"
8619     "    evaluated at `x`.\n"
8620     "\n"
8621     "See Also\n"
8622     "--------\n"
8623     "gdtrc : 1 - CDF of the gamma distribution.\n"
8624     "scipy.stats.gamma: Gamma distribution\n"
8625     "\n"
8626     "Notes\n"
8627     "-----\n"
8628     "The evaluation is carried out using the relation to the incomplete gamma\n"
8629     "integral (regularized gamma function).\n"
8630     "\n"
8631     "Wrapper for the Cephes [1]_ routine `gdtr`. Calling `gdtr` directly can\n"
8632     "improve performance compared to the ``cdf`` method of `scipy.stats.gamma`\n"
8633     "(see last example below).\n"
8634     "\n"
8635     "References\n"
8636     "----------\n"
8637     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
8638     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
8639     "\n"
8640     "Examples\n"
8641     "--------\n"
8642     "Compute the function for ``a=1``, ``b=2`` at ``x=5``.\n"
8643     "\n"
8644     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
8645     ">>> from scipy.special import gdtr\n"
8646     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
8647     ">>> gdtr(1., 2., 5.)\n"
8648     "0.9595723180054873\n"
8649     "\n"
8650     "Compute the function for ``a=1`` and ``b=2`` at several points by\n"
8651     "providing a NumPy array for `x`.\n"
8652     "\n"
8653     ">>> xvalues = np.array([1., 2., 3., 4])\n"
8654     ">>> gdtr(1., 1., xvalues)\n"
8655     "array([0.63212056, 0.86466472, 0.95021293, 0.98168436])\n"
8656     "\n"
8657     "`gdtr` can evaluate different parameter sets by providing arrays with\n"
8658     "broadcasting compatible shapes for `a`, `b` and `x`. Here we compute the\n"
8659     "function for three different `a` at four positions `x` and ``b=3``,\n"
8660     "resulting in a 3x4 array.\n"
8661     "\n"
8662     ">>> a = np.array([[0.5], [1.5], [2.5]])\n"
8663     ">>> x = np.array([1., 2., 3., 4])\n"
8664     ">>> a.shape, x.shape\n"
8665     "((3, 1), (4,))\n"
8666     "\n"
8667     ">>> gdtr(a, 3., x)\n"
8668     "array([[0.01438768, 0.0803014 , 0.19115317, 0.32332358],\n"
8669     "       [0.19115317, 0.57680992, 0.82642193, 0.9380312 ],\n"
8670     "       [0.45618688, 0.87534798, 0.97974328, 0.9972306 ]])\n"
8671     "\n"
8672     "Plot the function for four different parameter sets.\n"
8673     "\n"
8674     ">>> a_parameters = [0.3, 1, 2, 6]\n"
8675     ">>> b_parameters = [2, 10, 15, 20]\n"
8676     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
8677     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(a_parameters, b_parameters, linestyles))\n"
8678     ">>> x = np.linspace(0, 30, 1000)\n"
8679     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
8680     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
8681     "...     a, b, style = parameter_set\n"
8682     "...     gdtr_vals = gdtr(a, b, x)\n"
8683     "...     ax.plot(x, gdtr_vals, label=fr\"$a= {a},\\, b={b}$\", ls=style)\n"
8684     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
8685     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$x$\")\n"
8686     ">>> ax.set_title(\"Gamma distribution cumulative distribution function\")\n"
8687     ">>> plt.show()\n"
8688     "\n"
8689     "The gamma distribution is also available as `scipy.stats.gamma`. Using\n"
8690     "`gdtr` directly can be much faster than calling the ``cdf`` method of\n"
8691     "`scipy.stats.gamma`, especially for small arrays or individual values.\n"
8692     "To get the same results one must use the following parametrization:\n"
8693     "``stats.gamma(b, scale=1/a).cdf(x)=gdtr(a, b, x)``.\n"
8694     "\n"
8695     ">>> from scipy.stats import gamma\n"
8696     ">>> a = 2.\n"
8697     ">>> b = 3\n"
8698     ">>> x = 1.\n"
8699     ">>> gdtr_result = gdtr(a, b, x)  # this will often be faster than below\n"
8700     ">>> gamma_dist_result = gamma(b, scale=1/a).cdf(x)\n"
8701     ">>> gdtr_result == gamma_dist_result  # test that results are equal\n"
8702     "True")
8703 ufunc_gdtr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
8704 ufunc_gdtr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
8705 ufunc_gdtr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8706 ufunc_gdtr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8707 ufunc_gdtr_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8708 ufunc_gdtr_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8709 ufunc_gdtr_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8710 ufunc_gdtr_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8711 ufunc_gdtr_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8712 ufunc_gdtr_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8713 ufunc_gdtr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_gdtr
8714 ufunc_gdtr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtr")
8715 ufunc_gdtr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_gdtr
8716 ufunc_gdtr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtr")
8717 ufunc_gdtr_data[0] = &ufunc_gdtr_ptr[2*0]
8718 ufunc_gdtr_data[1] = &ufunc_gdtr_ptr[2*1]
8719 gdtr = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_gdtr_loops, ufunc_gdtr_data, ufunc_gdtr_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "gdtr", ufunc_gdtr_doc, 0)
8720 
8721 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_gdtrc_loops[2]
8722 cdef void *ufunc_gdtrc_ptr[4]
8723 cdef void *ufunc_gdtrc_data[2]
8724 cdef char ufunc_gdtrc_types[8]
8725 cdef char *ufunc_gdtrc_doc = (
8726     "gdtrc(a, b, x, out=None)\n"
8727     "\n"
8728     "Gamma distribution survival function.\n"
8729     "\n"
8730     "Integral from `x` to infinity of the gamma probability density function,\n"
8731     "\n"
8732     ".. math::\n"
8733     "\n"
8734     "    F = \\int_x^\\infty \\frac{a^b}{\\Gamma(b)} t^{b-1} e^{-at}\\,dt,\n"
8735     "\n"
8736     "where :math:`\\Gamma` is the gamma function.\n"
8737     "\n"
8738     "Parameters\n"
8739     "----------\n"
8740     "a : array_like\n"
8741     "    The rate parameter of the gamma distribution, sometimes denoted\n"
8742     "    :math:`\\beta` (float). It is also the reciprocal of the scale\n"
8743     "    parameter :math:`\\theta`.\n"
8744     "b : array_like\n"
8745     "    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution, sometimes denoted\n"
8746     "    :math:`\\alpha` (float).\n"
8747     "x : array_like\n"
8748     "    The quantile (lower limit of integration; float).\n"
8749     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8750     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
8751     "\n"
8752     "Returns\n"
8753     "-------\n"
8754     "F : scalar or ndarray\n"
8755     "    The survival function of the gamma distribution with parameters `a`\n"
8756     "    and `b` evaluated at `x`.\n"
8757     "\n"
8758     "See Also\n"
8759     "--------\n"
8760     "gdtr: Gamma distribution cumulative distribution function\n"
8761     "scipy.stats.gamma: Gamma distribution\n"
8762     "gdtrix\n"
8763     "\n"
8764     "Notes\n"
8765     "-----\n"
8766     "The evaluation is carried out using the relation to the incomplete gamma\n"
8767     "integral (regularized gamma function).\n"
8768     "\n"
8769     "Wrapper for the Cephes [1]_ routine `gdtrc`. Calling `gdtrc` directly can\n"
8770     "improve performance compared to the ``sf`` method of `scipy.stats.gamma`\n"
8771     "(see last example below).\n"
8772     "\n"
8773     "References\n"
8774     "----------\n"
8775     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
8776     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
8777     "\n"
8778     "Examples\n"
8779     "--------\n"
8780     "Compute the function for ``a=1`` and ``b=2`` at ``x=5``.\n"
8781     "\n"
8782     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
8783     ">>> from scipy.special import gdtrc\n"
8784     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
8785     ">>> gdtrc(1., 2., 5.)\n"
8786     "0.04042768199451279\n"
8787     "\n"
8788     "Compute the function for ``a=1``, ``b=2`` at several points by providing\n"
8789     "a NumPy array for `x`.\n"
8790     "\n"
8791     ">>> xvalues = np.array([1., 2., 3., 4])\n"
8792     ">>> gdtrc(1., 1., xvalues)\n"
8793     "array([0.36787944, 0.13533528, 0.04978707, 0.01831564])\n"
8794     "\n"
8795     "`gdtrc` can evaluate different parameter sets by providing arrays with\n"
8796     "broadcasting compatible shapes for `a`, `b` and `x`. Here we compute the\n"
8797     "function for three different `a` at four positions `x` and ``b=3``,\n"
8798     "resulting in a 3x4 array.\n"
8799     "\n"
8800     ">>> a = np.array([[0.5], [1.5], [2.5]])\n"
8801     ">>> x = np.array([1., 2., 3., 4])\n"
8802     ">>> a.shape, x.shape\n"
8803     "((3, 1), (4,))\n"
8804     "\n"
8805     ">>> gdtrc(a, 3., x)\n"
8806     "array([[0.98561232, 0.9196986 , 0.80884683, 0.67667642],\n"
8807     "       [0.80884683, 0.42319008, 0.17357807, 0.0619688 ],\n"
8808     "       [0.54381312, 0.12465202, 0.02025672, 0.0027694 ]])\n"
8809     "\n"
8810     "Plot the function for four different parameter sets.\n"
8811     "\n"
8812     ">>> a_parameters = [0.3, 1, 2, 6]\n"
8813     ">>> b_parameters = [2, 10, 15, 20]\n"
8814     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
8815     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(a_parameters, b_parameters, linestyles))\n"
8816     ">>> x = np.linspace(0, 30, 1000)\n"
8817     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
8818     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
8819     "...     a, b, style = parameter_set\n"
8820     "...     gdtrc_vals = gdtrc(a, b, x)\n"
8821     "...     ax.plot(x, gdtrc_vals, label=fr\"$a= {a},\\, b={b}$\", ls=style)\n"
8822     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
8823     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$x$\")\n"
8824     ">>> ax.set_title(\"Gamma distribution survival function\")\n"
8825     ">>> plt.show()\n"
8826     "\n"
8827     "The gamma distribution is also available as `scipy.stats.gamma`.\n"
8828     "Using `gdtrc` directly can be much faster than calling the ``sf`` method\n"
8829     "of `scipy.stats.gamma`, especially for small arrays or individual\n"
8830     "values. To get the same results one must use the following parametrization:\n"
8831     "``stats.gamma(b, scale=1/a).sf(x)=gdtrc(a, b, x)``.\n"
8832     "\n"
8833     ">>> from scipy.stats import gamma\n"
8834     ">>> a = 2\n"
8835     ">>> b = 3\n"
8836     ">>> x = 1.\n"
8837     ">>> gdtrc_result = gdtrc(a, b, x)  # this will often be faster than below\n"
8838     ">>> gamma_dist_result = gamma(b, scale=1/a).sf(x)\n"
8839     ">>> gdtrc_result == gamma_dist_result  # test that results are equal\n"
8840     "True")
8841 ufunc_gdtrc_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
8842 ufunc_gdtrc_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
8843 ufunc_gdtrc_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8844 ufunc_gdtrc_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8845 ufunc_gdtrc_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8846 ufunc_gdtrc_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8847 ufunc_gdtrc_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8848 ufunc_gdtrc_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8849 ufunc_gdtrc_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8850 ufunc_gdtrc_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8851 ufunc_gdtrc_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_gdtrc
8852 ufunc_gdtrc_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtrc")
8853 ufunc_gdtrc_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_gdtrc
8854 ufunc_gdtrc_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtrc")
8855 ufunc_gdtrc_data[0] = &ufunc_gdtrc_ptr[2*0]
8856 ufunc_gdtrc_data[1] = &ufunc_gdtrc_ptr[2*1]
8857 gdtrc = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_gdtrc_loops, ufunc_gdtrc_data, ufunc_gdtrc_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "gdtrc", ufunc_gdtrc_doc, 0)
8858 
8859 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_gdtria_loops[2]
8860 cdef void *ufunc_gdtria_ptr[4]
8861 cdef void *ufunc_gdtria_data[2]
8862 cdef char ufunc_gdtria_types[8]
8863 cdef char *ufunc_gdtria_doc = (
8864     "gdtria(p, b, x, out=None)\n"
8865     "\n"
8866     "Inverse of `gdtr` vs a.\n"
8867     "\n"
8868     "Returns the inverse with respect to the parameter `a` of ``p =\n"
8869     "gdtr(a, b, x)``, the cumulative distribution function of the gamma\n"
8870     "distribution.\n"
8871     "\n"
8872     "Parameters\n"
8873     "----------\n"
8874     "p : array_like\n"
8875     "    Probability values.\n"
8876     "b : array_like\n"
8877     "    `b` parameter values of `gdtr(a, b, x)`. `b` is the \"shape\" parameter\n"
8878     "    of the gamma distribution.\n"
8879     "x : array_like\n"
8880     "    Nonnegative real values, from the domain of the gamma distribution.\n"
8881     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8882     "    If a fourth argument is given, it must be a numpy.ndarray whose size\n"
8883     "    matches the broadcast result of `a`, `b` and `x`.  `out` is then the\n"
8884     "    array returned by the function.\n"
8885     "\n"
8886     "Returns\n"
8887     "-------\n"
8888     "a : scalar or ndarray\n"
8889     "    Values of the `a` parameter such that ``p = gdtr(a, b, x)`.  ``1/a``\n"
8890     "    is the \"scale\" parameter of the gamma distribution.\n"
8891     "\n"
8892     "See Also\n"
8893     "--------\n"
8894     "gdtr : CDF of the gamma distribution.\n"
8895     "gdtrib : Inverse with respect to `b` of `gdtr(a, b, x)`.\n"
8896     "gdtrix : Inverse with respect to `x` of `gdtr(a, b, x)`.\n"
8897     "\n"
8898     "Notes\n"
8899     "-----\n"
8900     "Wrapper for the CDFLIB [1]_ Fortran routine `cdfgam`.\n"
8901     "\n"
8902     "The cumulative distribution function `p` is computed using a routine by\n"
8903     "DiDinato and Morris [2]_. Computation of `a` involves a search for a value\n"
8904     "that produces the desired value of `p`. The search relies on the\n"
8905     "monotonicity of `p` with `a`.\n"
8906     "\n"
8907     "References\n"
8908     "----------\n"
8909     ".. [1] Barry Brown, James Lovato, and Kathy Russell,\n"
8910     "       CDFLIB: Library of Fortran Routines for Cumulative Distribution\n"
8911     "       Functions, Inverses, and Other Parameters.\n"
8912     ".. [2] DiDinato, A. R. and Morris, A. H.,\n"
8913     "       Computation of the incomplete gamma function ratios and their\n"
8914     "       inverse.  ACM Trans. Math. Softw. 12 (1986), 377-393.\n"
8915     "\n"
8916     "Examples\n"
8917     "--------\n"
8918     "First evaluate `gdtr`.\n"
8919     "\n"
8920     ">>> from scipy.special import gdtr, gdtria\n"
8921     ">>> p = gdtr(1.2, 3.4, 5.6)\n"
8922     ">>> print(p)\n"
8923     "0.94378087442\n"
8924     "\n"
8925     "Verify the inverse.\n"
8926     "\n"
8927     ">>> gdtria(p, 3.4, 5.6)\n"
8928     "1.2")
8929 ufunc_gdtria_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
8930 ufunc_gdtria_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
8931 ufunc_gdtria_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8932 ufunc_gdtria_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8933 ufunc_gdtria_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8934 ufunc_gdtria_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
8935 ufunc_gdtria_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8936 ufunc_gdtria_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8937 ufunc_gdtria_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8938 ufunc_gdtria_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
8939 ufunc_gdtria_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_gdtria
8940 ufunc_gdtria_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtria")
8941 ufunc_gdtria_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_gdtria
8942 ufunc_gdtria_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtria")
8943 ufunc_gdtria_data[0] = &ufunc_gdtria_ptr[2*0]
8944 ufunc_gdtria_data[1] = &ufunc_gdtria_ptr[2*1]
8945 gdtria = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_gdtria_loops, ufunc_gdtria_data, ufunc_gdtria_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "gdtria", ufunc_gdtria_doc, 0)
8946 
8947 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_gdtrib_loops[2]
8948 cdef void *ufunc_gdtrib_ptr[4]
8949 cdef void *ufunc_gdtrib_data[2]
8950 cdef char ufunc_gdtrib_types[8]
8951 cdef char *ufunc_gdtrib_doc = (
8952     "gdtrib(a, p, x, out=None)\n"
8953     "\n"
8954     "Inverse of `gdtr` vs b.\n"
8955     "\n"
8956     "Returns the inverse with respect to the parameter `b` of ``p =\n"
8957     "gdtr(a, b, x)``, the cumulative distribution function of the gamma\n"
8958     "distribution.\n"
8959     "\n"
8960     "Parameters\n"
8961     "----------\n"
8962     "a : array_like\n"
8963     "    `a` parameter values of ``gdtr(a, b, x)`. ``1/a`` is the \"scale\"\n"
8964     "    parameter of the gamma distribution.\n"
8965     "p : array_like\n"
8966     "    Probability values.\n"
8967     "x : array_like\n"
8968     "    Nonnegative real values, from the domain of the gamma distribution.\n"
8969     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
8970     "    If a fourth argument is given, it must be a numpy.ndarray whose size\n"
8971     "    matches the broadcast result of `a`, `b` and `x`.  `out` is then the\n"
8972     "    array returned by the function.\n"
8973     "\n"
8974     "Returns\n"
8975     "-------\n"
8976     "b : scalar or ndarray\n"
8977     "    Values of the `b` parameter such that `p = gdtr(a, b, x)`.  `b` is\n"
8978     "    the \"shape\" parameter of the gamma distribution.\n"
8979     "\n"
8980     "See Also\n"
8981     "--------\n"
8982     "gdtr : CDF of the gamma distribution.\n"
8983     "gdtria : Inverse with respect to `a` of `gdtr(a, b, x)`.\n"
8984     "gdtrix : Inverse with respect to `x` of `gdtr(a, b, x)`.\n"
8985     "\n"
8986     "Notes\n"
8987     "-----\n"
8988     "\n"
8989     "The cumulative distribution function `p` is computed using the Cephes [1]_\n"
8990     "routines `igam` and `igamc`. Computation of `b` involves a search for a value\n"
8991     "that produces the desired value of `p` using Chandrupatla's bracketing\n"
8992     "root finding algorithm [2]_.\n"
8993     "\n"
8994     "Note that there are some edge cases where `gdtrib` is extended by taking\n"
8995     "limits where they are uniquely defined. In particular\n"
8996     "``x == 0`` with ``p > 0`` and ``p == 0`` with ``x > 0``.\n"
8997     "For these edge cases, a numerical result will be returned for\n"
8998     "``gdtrib(a, p, x)`` even though ``gdtr(a, gdtrib(a, p, x), x)`` is\n"
8999     "undefined.\n"
9000     "\n"
9001     "References\n"
9002     "----------\n"
9003     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
9004     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
9005     ".. [2] Chandrupatla, Tirupathi R.\n"
9006     "       \"A new hybrid quadratic/bisection algorithm for finding the zero of a\n"
9007     "       nonlinear function without using derivatives\".\n"
9008     "       Advances in Engineering Software, 28(3), 145-149.\n"
9009     "       https://doi.org/10.1016/s0965-9978(96)00051-8\n"
9010     "\n"
9011     "Examples\n"
9012     "--------\n"
9013     "First evaluate `gdtr`.\n"
9014     "\n"
9015     ">>> from scipy.special import gdtr, gdtrib\n"
9016     ">>> p = gdtr(1.2, 3.4, 5.6)\n"
9017     ">>> print(p)\n"
9018     "0.94378087442\n"
9019     "\n"
9020     "Verify the inverse.\n"
9021     "\n"
9022     ">>> gdtrib(1.2, p, 5.6)\n"
9023     "3.3999999999999995")
9024 ufunc_gdtrib_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
9025 ufunc_gdtrib_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
9026 ufunc_gdtrib_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9027 ufunc_gdtrib_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9028 ufunc_gdtrib_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9029 ufunc_gdtrib_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9030 ufunc_gdtrib_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9031 ufunc_gdtrib_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9032 ufunc_gdtrib_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9033 ufunc_gdtrib_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9034 ufunc_gdtrib_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_gdtrib
9035 ufunc_gdtrib_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtrib")
9036 ufunc_gdtrib_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_gdtrib
9037 ufunc_gdtrib_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtrib")
9038 ufunc_gdtrib_data[0] = &ufunc_gdtrib_ptr[2*0]
9039 ufunc_gdtrib_data[1] = &ufunc_gdtrib_ptr[2*1]
9040 gdtrib = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_gdtrib_loops, ufunc_gdtrib_data, ufunc_gdtrib_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "gdtrib", ufunc_gdtrib_doc, 0)
9041 
9042 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_gdtrix_loops[2]
9043 cdef void *ufunc_gdtrix_ptr[4]
9044 cdef void *ufunc_gdtrix_data[2]
9045 cdef char ufunc_gdtrix_types[8]
9046 cdef char *ufunc_gdtrix_doc = (
9047     "gdtrix(a, b, p, out=None)\n"
9048     "\n"
9049     "Inverse of `gdtr` vs x.\n"
9050     "\n"
9051     "Returns the inverse with respect to the parameter `x` of ``p =\n"
9052     "gdtr(a, b, x)``, the cumulative distribution function of the gamma\n"
9053     "distribution. This is also known as the pth quantile of the\n"
9054     "distribution.\n"
9055     "\n"
9056     "Parameters\n"
9057     "----------\n"
9058     "a : array_like\n"
9059     "    `a` parameter values of ``gdtr(a, b, x)``. ``1/a`` is the \"scale\"\n"
9060     "    parameter of the gamma distribution.\n"
9061     "b : array_like\n"
9062     "    `b` parameter values of ``gdtr(a, b, x)``. `b` is the \"shape\" parameter\n"
9063     "    of the gamma distribution.\n"
9064     "p : array_like\n"
9065     "    Probability values.\n"
9066     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9067     "    If a fourth argument is given, it must be a numpy.ndarray whose size\n"
9068     "    matches the broadcast result of `a`, `b` and `x`. `out` is then the\n"
9069     "    array returned by the function.\n"
9070     "\n"
9071     "Returns\n"
9072     "-------\n"
9073     "x : scalar or ndarray\n"
9074     "    Values of the `x` parameter such that `p = gdtr(a, b, x)`.\n"
9075     "\n"
9076     "See Also\n"
9077     "--------\n"
9078     "gdtr : CDF of the gamma distribution.\n"
9079     "gdtria : Inverse with respect to `a` of ``gdtr(a, b, x)``.\n"
9080     "gdtrib : Inverse with respect to `b` of ``gdtr(a, b, x)``.\n"
9081     "\n"
9082     "Notes\n"
9083     "-----\n"
9084     "Wrapper for the CDFLIB [1]_ Fortran routine `cdfgam`.\n"
9085     "\n"
9086     "The cumulative distribution function `p` is computed using a routine by\n"
9087     "DiDinato and Morris [2]_. Computation of `x` involves a search for a value\n"
9088     "that produces the desired value of `p`. The search relies on the\n"
9089     "monotonicity of `p` with `x`.\n"
9090     "\n"
9091     "References\n"
9092     "----------\n"
9093     ".. [1] Barry Brown, James Lovato, and Kathy Russell,\n"
9094     "       CDFLIB: Library of Fortran Routines for Cumulative Distribution\n"
9095     "       Functions, Inverses, and Other Parameters.\n"
9096     ".. [2] DiDinato, A. R. and Morris, A. H.,\n"
9097     "       Computation of the incomplete gamma function ratios and their\n"
9098     "       inverse.  ACM Trans. Math. Softw. 12 (1986), 377-393.\n"
9099     "\n"
9100     "Examples\n"
9101     "--------\n"
9102     "First evaluate `gdtr`.\n"
9103     "\n"
9104     ">>> from scipy.special import gdtr, gdtrix\n"
9105     ">>> p = gdtr(1.2, 3.4, 5.6)\n"
9106     ">>> print(p)\n"
9107     "0.94378087442\n"
9108     "\n"
9109     "Verify the inverse.\n"
9110     "\n"
9111     ">>> gdtrix(1.2, 3.4, p)\n"
9112     "5.5999999999999996")
9113 ufunc_gdtrix_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
9114 ufunc_gdtrix_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
9115 ufunc_gdtrix_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9116 ufunc_gdtrix_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9117 ufunc_gdtrix_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9118 ufunc_gdtrix_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9119 ufunc_gdtrix_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9120 ufunc_gdtrix_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9121 ufunc_gdtrix_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9122 ufunc_gdtrix_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9123 ufunc_gdtrix_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_gdtrix
9124 ufunc_gdtrix_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtrix")
9125 ufunc_gdtrix_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_gdtrix
9126 ufunc_gdtrix_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"gdtrix")
9127 ufunc_gdtrix_data[0] = &ufunc_gdtrix_ptr[2*0]
9128 ufunc_gdtrix_data[1] = &ufunc_gdtrix_ptr[2*1]
9129 gdtrix = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_gdtrix_loops, ufunc_gdtrix_data, ufunc_gdtrix_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "gdtrix", ufunc_gdtrix_doc, 0)
9130 
9131 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_huber_loops[2]
9132 cdef void *ufunc_huber_ptr[4]
9133 cdef void *ufunc_huber_data[2]
9134 cdef char ufunc_huber_types[6]
9135 cdef char *ufunc_huber_doc = (
9136     "huber(delta, r, out=None)\n"
9137     "\n"
9138     "Huber loss function.\n"
9139     "\n"
9140     ".. math:: \\text{huber}(\\delta, r) = \\begin{cases} \\infty & \\delta < 0  \\\\\n"
9141     "          \\frac{1}{2}r^2 & 0 \\le \\delta, | r | \\le \\delta \\\\\n"
9142     "          \\delta ( |r| - \\frac{1}{2}\\delta ) & \\text{otherwise} \\end{cases}\n"
9143     "\n"
9144     "Parameters\n"
9145     "----------\n"
9146     "delta : ndarray\n"
9147     "    Input array, indicating the quadratic vs. linear loss changepoint.\n"
9148     "r : ndarray\n"
9149     "    Input array, possibly representing residuals.\n"
9150     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9151     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
9152     "\n"
9153     "Returns\n"
9154     "-------\n"
9155     "scalar or ndarray\n"
9156     "    The computed Huber loss function values.\n"
9157     "\n"
9158     "See Also\n"
9159     "--------\n"
9160     "pseudo_huber : smooth approximation of this function\n"
9161     "\n"
9162     "Notes\n"
9163     "-----\n"
9164     "`huber` is useful as a loss function in robust statistics or machine\n"
9165     "learning to reduce the influence of outliers as compared to the common\n"
9166     "squared error loss, residuals with a magnitude higher than `delta` are\n"
9167     "not squared [1]_.\n"
9168     "\n"
9169     "Typically, `r` represents residuals, the difference\n"
9170     "between a model prediction and data. Then, for :math:`|r|\\leq\\delta`,\n"
9171     "`huber` resembles the squared error and for :math:`|r|>\\delta` the\n"
9172     "absolute error. This way, the Huber loss often achieves\n"
9173     "a fast convergence in model fitting for small residuals like the squared\n"
9174     "error loss function and still reduces the influence of outliers\n"
9175     "(:math:`|r|>\\delta`) like the absolute error loss. As :math:`\\delta` is\n"
9176     "the cutoff between squared and absolute error regimes, it has\n"
9177     "to be tuned carefully for each problem. `huber` is also\n"
9178     "convex, making it suitable for gradient based optimization.\n"
9179     "\n"
9180     ".. versionadded:: 0.15.0\n"
9181     "\n"
9182     "References\n"
9183     "----------\n"
9184     ".. [1] Peter Huber. \"Robust Estimation of a Location Parameter\",\n"
9185     "       1964. Annals of Statistics. 53 (1): 73 - 101.\n"
9186     "\n"
9187     "Examples\n"
9188     "--------\n"
9189     "Import all necessary modules.\n"
9190     "\n"
9191     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
9192     ">>> from scipy.special import huber\n"
9193     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
9194     "\n"
9195     "Compute the function for ``delta=1`` at ``r=2``\n"
9196     "\n"
9197     ">>> huber(1., 2.)\n"
9198     "1.5\n"
9199     "\n"
9200     "Compute the function for different `delta` by providing a NumPy array or\n"
9201     "list for `delta`.\n"
9202     "\n"
9203     ">>> huber([1., 3., 5.], 4.)\n"
9204     "array([3.5, 7.5, 8. ])\n"
9205     "\n"
9206     "Compute the function at different points by providing a NumPy array or\n"
9207     "list for `r`.\n"
9208     "\n"
9209     ">>> huber(2., np.array([1., 1.5, 3.]))\n"
9210     "array([0.5  , 1.125, 4.   ])\n"
9211     "\n"
9212     "The function can be calculated for different `delta` and `r` by\n"
9213     "providing arrays for both with compatible shapes for broadcasting.\n"
9214     "\n"
9215     ">>> r = np.array([1., 2.5, 8., 10.])\n"
9216     ">>> deltas = np.array([[1.], [5.], [9.]])\n"
9217     ">>> print(r.shape, deltas.shape)\n"
9218     "(4,) (3, 1)\n"
9219     "\n"
9220     ">>> huber(deltas, r)\n"
9221     "array([[ 0.5  ,  2.   ,  7.5  ,  9.5  ],\n"
9222     "       [ 0.5  ,  3.125, 27.5  , 37.5  ],\n"
9223     "       [ 0.5  ,  3.125, 32.   , 49.5  ]])\n"
9224     "\n"
9225     "Plot the function for different `delta`.\n"
9226     "\n"
9227     ">>> x = np.linspace(-4, 4, 500)\n"
9228     ">>> deltas = [1, 2, 3]\n"
9229     ">>> linestyles = [\"dashed\", \"dotted\", \"dashdot\"]\n"
9230     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
9231     ">>> combined_plot_parameters = list(zip(deltas, linestyles))\n"
9232     ">>> for delta, style in combined_plot_parameters:\n"
9233     "...     ax.plot(x, huber(delta, x), label=fr\"$\\delta={delta}$\", ls=style)\n"
9234     ">>> ax.legend(loc=\"upper center\")\n"
9235     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$x$\")\n"
9236     ">>> ax.set_title(r\"Huber loss function $h_{\\delta}(x)$\")\n"
9237     ">>> ax.set_xlim(-4, 4)\n"
9238     ">>> ax.set_ylim(0, 8)\n"
9239     ">>> plt.show()")
9240 ufunc_huber_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
9241 ufunc_huber_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
9242 ufunc_huber_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9243 ufunc_huber_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9244 ufunc_huber_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9245 ufunc_huber_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9246 ufunc_huber_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9247 ufunc_huber_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9248 ufunc_huber_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_huber
9249 ufunc_huber_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"huber")
9250 ufunc_huber_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_huber
9251 ufunc_huber_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"huber")
9252 ufunc_huber_data[0] = &ufunc_huber_ptr[2*0]
9253 ufunc_huber_data[1] = &ufunc_huber_ptr[2*1]
9254 huber = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_huber_loops, ufunc_huber_data, ufunc_huber_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "huber", ufunc_huber_doc, 0)
9255 
9256 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_hyp0f1_loops[4]
9257 cdef void *ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[8]
9258 cdef void *ufunc_hyp0f1_data[4]
9259 cdef char ufunc_hyp0f1_types[12]
9260 cdef char *ufunc_hyp0f1_doc = (
9261     "hyp0f1(v, z, out=None)\n"
9262     "\n"
9263     "Confluent hypergeometric limit function 0F1.\n"
9264     "\n"
9265     "Parameters\n"
9266     "----------\n"
9267     "v : array_like\n"
9268     "    Real-valued parameter\n"
9269     "z : array_like\n"
9270     "    Real- or complex-valued argument\n"
9271     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9272     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
9273     "\n"
9274     "Returns\n"
9275     "-------\n"
9276     "scalar or ndarray\n"
9277     "    The confluent hypergeometric limit function\n"
9278     "\n"
9279     "Notes\n"
9280     "-----\n"
9281     "This function is defined as:\n"
9282     "\n"
9283     ".. math:: _0F_1(v, z) = \\sum_{k=0}^{\\infty}\\frac{z^k}{(v)_k k!}.\n"
9284     "\n"
9285     "It's also the limit as :math:`q \\to \\infty` of :math:`_1F_1(q; v; z/q)`,\n"
9286     "and satisfies the differential equation :math:`f''(z) + vf'(z) =\n"
9287     "f(z)`. See [1]_ for more information.\n"
9288     "\n"
9289     "References\n"
9290     "----------\n"
9291     ".. [1] Wolfram MathWorld, \"Confluent Hypergeometric Limit Function\",\n"
9292     "       http://mathworld.wolfram.com/ConfluentHypergeometricLimitFunction.html\n"
9293     "\n"
9294     "Examples\n"
9295     "--------\n"
9296     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
9297     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
9298     "\n"
9299     "It is one when `z` is zero.\n"
9300     "\n"
9301     ">>> sc.hyp0f1(1, 0)\n"
9302     "1.0\n"
9303     "\n"
9304     "It is the limit of the confluent hypergeometric function as `q`\n"
9305     "goes to infinity.\n"
9306     "\n"
9307     ">>> q = np.array([1, 10, 100, 1000])\n"
9308     ">>> v = 1\n"
9309     ">>> z = 1\n"
9310     ">>> sc.hyp1f1(q, v, z / q)\n"
9311     "array([2.71828183, 2.31481985, 2.28303778, 2.27992985])\n"
9312     ">>> sc.hyp0f1(v, z)\n"
9313     "2.2795853023360673\n"
9314     "\n"
9315     "It is related to Bessel functions.\n"
9316     "\n"
9317     ">>> n = 1\n"
9318     ">>> x = np.linspace(0, 1, 5)\n"
9319     ">>> sc.jv(n, x)\n"
9320     "array([0.        , 0.12402598, 0.24226846, 0.3492436 , 0.44005059])\n"
9321     ">>> (0.5 * x)**n / sc.factorial(n) * sc.hyp0f1(n + 1, -0.25 * x**2)\n"
9322     "array([0.        , 0.12402598, 0.24226846, 0.3492436 , 0.44005059])")
9323 ufunc_hyp0f1_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
9324 ufunc_hyp0f1_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_fF_F
9325 ufunc_hyp0f1_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
9326 ufunc_hyp0f1_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_dD__As_dD_D
9327 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9328 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9329 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9330 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9331 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[4] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
9332 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[5] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
9333 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9334 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9335 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9336 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9337 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[10] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
9338 ufunc_hyp0f1_types[11] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
9339 ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func__hyp0f1_real
9340 ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyp0f1")
9341 ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func__hyp0f1_cmplx
9342 ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyp0f1")
9343 ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func__hyp0f1_real
9344 ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyp0f1")
9345 ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*3] = <void*>_func__hyp0f1_cmplx
9346 ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyp0f1")
9347 ufunc_hyp0f1_data[0] = &ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*0]
9348 ufunc_hyp0f1_data[1] = &ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*1]
9349 ufunc_hyp0f1_data[2] = &ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*2]
9350 ufunc_hyp0f1_data[3] = &ufunc_hyp0f1_ptr[2*3]
9351 hyp0f1 = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_hyp0f1_loops, ufunc_hyp0f1_data, ufunc_hyp0f1_types, 4, 2, 1, 0, "hyp0f1", ufunc_hyp0f1_doc, 0)
9352 
9353 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_hyp1f1_loops[4]
9354 cdef void *ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[8]
9355 cdef void *ufunc_hyp1f1_data[4]
9356 cdef char ufunc_hyp1f1_types[16]
9357 cdef char *ufunc_hyp1f1_doc = (
9358     "hyp1f1(a, b, x, out=None)\n"
9359     "\n"
9360     "Confluent hypergeometric function 1F1.\n"
9361     "\n"
9362     "The confluent hypergeometric function is defined by the series\n"
9363     "\n"
9364     ".. math::\n"
9365     "\n"
9366     "   {}_1F_1(a; b; x) = \\sum_{k = 0}^\\infty \\frac{(a)_k}{(b)_k k!} x^k.\n"
9367     "\n"
9368     "See [dlmf]_ for more details. Here :math:`(\\cdot)_k` is the\n"
9369     "Pochhammer symbol; see `poch`.\n"
9370     "\n"
9371     "Parameters\n"
9372     "----------\n"
9373     "a, b : array_like\n"
9374     "    Real parameters\n"
9375     "x : array_like\n"
9376     "    Real or complex argument\n"
9377     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9378     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
9379     "\n"
9380     "Returns\n"
9381     "-------\n"
9382     "scalar or ndarray\n"
9383     "    Values of the confluent hypergeometric function\n"
9384     "\n"
9385     "See Also\n"
9386     "--------\n"
9387     "hyperu : another confluent hypergeometric function\n"
9388     "hyp0f1 : confluent hypergeometric limit function\n"
