9389     "hyp2f1 : Gaussian hypergeometric function\n"
9390     "\n"
9391     "Notes\n"
9392     "-----\n"
9393     "For real values, this function uses the ``hyp1f1`` routine from the C++ Boost\n"
9394     "library [2]_, for complex values a C translation of the specfun\n"
9395     "Fortran library [3]_.\n"
9396     "\n"
9397     "References\n"
9398     "----------\n"
9399     ".. [dlmf] NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions\n"
9400     "          https://dlmf.nist.gov/13.2#E2\n"
9401     ".. [2] The Boost Developers. \"Boost C++ Libraries\". https://www.boost.org/.\n"
9402     ".. [3] Zhang, Jin, \"Computation of Special Functions\", John Wiley\n"
9403     "       and Sons, Inc, 1996.\n"
9404     "\n"
9405     "Examples\n"
9406     "--------\n"
9407     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
9408     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
9409     "\n"
9410     "It is one when `x` is zero:\n"
9411     "\n"
9412     ">>> sc.hyp1f1(0.5, 0.5, 0)\n"
9413     "1.0\n"
9414     "\n"
9415     "It is singular when `b` is a nonpositive integer.\n"
9416     "\n"
9417     ">>> sc.hyp1f1(0.5, -1, 0)\n"
9418     "inf\n"
9419     "\n"
9420     "It is a polynomial when `a` is a nonpositive integer.\n"
9421     "\n"
9422     ">>> a, b, x = -1, 0.5, np.array([1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0])\n"
9423     ">>> sc.hyp1f1(a, b, x)\n"
9424     "array([-1., -3., -5., -7.])\n"
9425     ">>> 1 + (a / b) * x\n"
9426     "array([-1., -3., -5., -7.])\n"
9427     "\n"
9428     "It reduces to the exponential function when ``a = b``.\n"
9429     "\n"
9430     ">>> sc.hyp1f1(2, 2, [1, 2, 3, 4])\n"
9431     "array([ 2.71828183,  7.3890561 , 20.08553692, 54.59815003])\n"
9432     ">>> np.exp([1, 2, 3, 4])\n"
9433     "array([ 2.71828183,  7.3890561 , 20.08553692, 54.59815003])")
9434 ufunc_hyp1f1_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
9435 ufunc_hyp1f1_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_ddD__As_ffF_F
9436 ufunc_hyp1f1_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
9437 ufunc_hyp1f1_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_ddD__As_ddD_D
9438 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9439 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9440 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9441 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9442 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9443 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9444 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[6] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
9445 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[7] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
9446 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9447 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9448 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[10] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9449 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[11] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9450 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[12] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9451 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[13] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9452 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[14] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
9453 ufunc_hyp1f1_types[15] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
9454 ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_hyp1f1_double
9455 ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyp1f1")
9456 ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_chyp1f1_wrap
9457 ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyp1f1")
9458 ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_hyp1f1_double
9459 ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyp1f1")
9460 ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*3] = <void*>_func_chyp1f1_wrap
9461 ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyp1f1")
9462 ufunc_hyp1f1_data[0] = &ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*0]
9463 ufunc_hyp1f1_data[1] = &ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*1]
9464 ufunc_hyp1f1_data[2] = &ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*2]
9465 ufunc_hyp1f1_data[3] = &ufunc_hyp1f1_ptr[2*3]
9466 hyp1f1 = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_hyp1f1_loops, ufunc_hyp1f1_data, ufunc_hyp1f1_types, 4, 3, 1, 0, "hyp1f1", ufunc_hyp1f1_doc, 0)
9467 
9468 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_hyperu_loops[2]
9469 cdef void *ufunc_hyperu_ptr[4]
9470 cdef void *ufunc_hyperu_data[2]
9471 cdef char ufunc_hyperu_types[8]
9472 cdef char *ufunc_hyperu_doc = (
9473     "hyperu(a, b, x, out=None)\n"
9474     "\n"
9475     "Confluent hypergeometric function U\n"
9476     "\n"
9477     "It is defined as the solution to the equation\n"
9478     "\n"
9479     ".. math::\n"
9480     "\n"
9481     "   x \\frac{d^2w}{dx^2} + (b - x) \\frac{dw}{dx} - aw = 0\n"
9482     "\n"
9483     "which satisfies the property\n"
9484     "\n"
9485     ".. math::\n"
9486     "\n"
9487     "   U(a, b, x) \\sim x^{-a}\n"
9488     "\n"
9489     "as :math:`x \\to \\infty`. See [dlmf]_ for more details.\n"
9490     "\n"
9491     "Parameters\n"
9492     "----------\n"
9493     "a, b : array_like\n"
9494     "    Real-valued parameters\n"
9495     "x : array_like\n"
9496     "    Real-valued argument\n"
9497     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9498     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
9499     "\n"
9500     "Returns\n"
9501     "-------\n"
9502     "scalar or ndarray\n"
9503     "    Values of `U`\n"
9504     "\n"
9505     "References\n"
9506     "----------\n"
9507     ".. [dlmf] NIST Digital Library of Mathematics Functions\n"
9508     "          https://dlmf.nist.gov/13.2#E6\n"
9509     "\n"
9510     "Examples\n"
9511     "--------\n"
9512     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
9513     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
9514     "\n"
9515     "It has a branch cut along the negative `x` axis.\n"
9516     "\n"
9517     ">>> x = np.linspace(-0.1, -10, 5)\n"
9518     ">>> sc.hyperu(1, 1, x)\n"
9519     "array([nan, nan, nan, nan, nan])\n"
9520     "\n"
9521     "It approaches zero as `x` goes to infinity.\n"
9522     "\n"
9523     ">>> x = np.array([1, 10, 100])\n"
9524     ">>> sc.hyperu(1, 1, x)\n"
9525     "array([0.59634736, 0.09156333, 0.00990194])\n"
9526     "\n"
9527     "It satisfies Kummer's transformation.\n"
9528     "\n"
9529     ">>> a, b, x = 2, 1, 1\n"
9530     ">>> sc.hyperu(a, b, x)\n"
9531     "0.1926947246463881\n"
9532     ">>> x**(1 - b) * sc.hyperu(a - b + 1, 2 - b, x)\n"
9533     "0.1926947246463881")
9534 ufunc_hyperu_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
9535 ufunc_hyperu_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
9536 ufunc_hyperu_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9537 ufunc_hyperu_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9538 ufunc_hyperu_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9539 ufunc_hyperu_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9540 ufunc_hyperu_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9541 ufunc_hyperu_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9542 ufunc_hyperu_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9543 ufunc_hyperu_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9544 ufunc_hyperu_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_hyperu
9545 ufunc_hyperu_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyperu")
9546 ufunc_hyperu_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_hyperu
9547 ufunc_hyperu_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"hyperu")
9548 ufunc_hyperu_data[0] = &ufunc_hyperu_ptr[2*0]
9549 ufunc_hyperu_data[1] = &ufunc_hyperu_ptr[2*1]
9550 hyperu = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_hyperu_loops, ufunc_hyperu_data, ufunc_hyperu_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "hyperu", ufunc_hyperu_doc, 0)
9551 
9552 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_inv_boxcox_loops[2]
9553 cdef void *ufunc_inv_boxcox_ptr[4]
9554 cdef void *ufunc_inv_boxcox_data[2]
9555 cdef char ufunc_inv_boxcox_types[6]
9556 cdef char *ufunc_inv_boxcox_doc = (
9557     "inv_boxcox(y, lmbda, out=None)\n"
9558     "\n"
9559     "Compute the inverse of the Box-Cox transformation.\n"
9560     "\n"
9561     "Find ``x`` such that::\n"
9562     "\n"
9563     "    y = (x**lmbda - 1) / lmbda  if lmbda != 0\n"
9564     "        log(x)                  if lmbda == 0\n"
9565     "\n"
9566     "Parameters\n"
9567     "----------\n"
9568     "y : array_like\n"
9569     "    Data to be transformed.\n"
9570     "lmbda : array_like\n"
9571     "    Power parameter of the Box-Cox transform.\n"
9572     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9573     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
9574     "\n"
9575     "Returns\n"
9576     "-------\n"
9577     "x : scalar or ndarray\n"
9578     "    Transformed data.\n"
9579     "\n"
9580     "Notes\n"
9581     "-----\n"
9582     "\n"
9583     ".. versionadded:: 0.16.0\n"
9584     "\n"
9585     "Examples\n"
9586     "--------\n"
9587     ">>> from scipy.special import boxcox, inv_boxcox\n"
9588     ">>> y = boxcox([1, 4, 10], 2.5)\n"
9589     ">>> inv_boxcox(y, 2.5)\n"
9590     "array([1., 4., 10.])")
9591 ufunc_inv_boxcox_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
9592 ufunc_inv_boxcox_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
9593 ufunc_inv_boxcox_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9594 ufunc_inv_boxcox_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9595 ufunc_inv_boxcox_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9596 ufunc_inv_boxcox_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9597 ufunc_inv_boxcox_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9598 ufunc_inv_boxcox_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9599 ufunc_inv_boxcox_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_inv_boxcox
9600 ufunc_inv_boxcox_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"inv_boxcox")
9601 ufunc_inv_boxcox_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_inv_boxcox
9602 ufunc_inv_boxcox_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"inv_boxcox")
9603 ufunc_inv_boxcox_data[0] = &ufunc_inv_boxcox_ptr[2*0]
9604 ufunc_inv_boxcox_data[1] = &ufunc_inv_boxcox_ptr[2*1]
9605 inv_boxcox = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_inv_boxcox_loops, ufunc_inv_boxcox_data, ufunc_inv_boxcox_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "inv_boxcox", ufunc_inv_boxcox_doc, 0)
9606 
9607 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_loops[2]
9608 cdef void *ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_ptr[4]
9609 cdef void *ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_data[2]
9610 cdef char ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_types[6]
9611 cdef char *ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_doc = (
9612     "inv_boxcox1p(y, lmbda, out=None)\n"
9613     "\n"
9614     "Compute the inverse of the Box-Cox transformation.\n"
9615     "\n"
9616     "Find ``x`` such that::\n"
9617     "\n"
9618     "    y = ((1+x)**lmbda - 1) / lmbda  if lmbda != 0\n"
9619     "        log(1+x)                    if lmbda == 0\n"
9620     "\n"
9621     "Parameters\n"
9622     "----------\n"
9623     "y : array_like\n"
9624     "    Data to be transformed.\n"
9625     "lmbda : array_like\n"
9626     "    Power parameter of the Box-Cox transform.\n"
9627     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9628     "    Optional output array for the function values\n"
9629     "\n"
9630     "Returns\n"
9631     "-------\n"
9632     "x : scalar or ndarray\n"
9633     "    Transformed data.\n"
9634     "\n"
9635     "Notes\n"
9636     "-----\n"
9637     "\n"
9638     ".. versionadded:: 0.16.0\n"
9639     "\n"
9640     "Examples\n"
9641     "--------\n"
9642     ">>> from scipy.special import boxcox1p, inv_boxcox1p\n"
9643     ">>> y = boxcox1p([1, 4, 10], 2.5)\n"
9644     ">>> inv_boxcox1p(y, 2.5)\n"
9645     "array([1., 4., 10.])")
9646 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
9647 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
9648 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9649 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9650 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9651 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9652 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9653 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9654 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_inv_boxcox1p
9655 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"inv_boxcox1p")
9656 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_inv_boxcox1p
9657 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"inv_boxcox1p")
9658 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_data[0] = &ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_ptr[2*0]
9659 ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_data[1] = &ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_ptr[2*1]
9660 inv_boxcox1p = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_loops, ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_data, ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "inv_boxcox1p", ufunc_inv_boxcox1p_doc, 0)
9661 
9662 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_kl_div_loops[2]
9663 cdef void *ufunc_kl_div_ptr[4]
9664 cdef void *ufunc_kl_div_data[2]
9665 cdef char ufunc_kl_div_types[6]
9666 cdef char *ufunc_kl_div_doc = (
9667     "kl_div(x, y, out=None)\n"
9668     "\n"
9669     "Elementwise function for computing Kullback-Leibler divergence.\n"
9670     "\n"
9671     ".. math::\n"
9672     "\n"
9673     "    \\mathrm{kl\\_div}(x, y) =\n"
9674     "      \\begin{cases}\n"
9675     "        x \\log(x / y) - x + y & x > 0, y > 0 \\\\\n"
9676     "        y & x = 0, y \\ge 0 \\\\\n"
9677     "        \\infty & \\text{otherwise}\n"
9678     "      \\end{cases}\n"
9679     "\n"
9680     "Parameters\n"
9681     "----------\n"
9682     "x, y : array_like\n"
9683     "    Real arguments\n"
9684     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9685     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
9686     "\n"
9687     "Returns\n"
9688     "-------\n"
9689     "scalar or ndarray\n"
9690     "    Values of the Kullback-Liebler divergence.\n"
9691     "\n"
9692     "See Also\n"
9693     "--------\n"
9694     "entr, rel_entr, scipy.stats.entropy\n"
9695     "\n"
9696     "Notes\n"
9697     "-----\n"
9698     ".. versionadded:: 0.15.0\n"
9699     "\n"
9700     "This function is non-negative and is jointly convex in `x` and `y`.\n"
9701     "\n"
9702     "The origin of this function is in convex programming; see [1]_ for\n"
9703     "details. This is why the function contains the extra :math:`-x\n"
9704     "+ y` terms over what might be expected from the Kullback-Leibler\n"
9705     "divergence. For a version of the function without the extra terms,\n"
9706     "see `rel_entr`.\n"
9707     "\n"
9708     "References\n"
9709     "----------\n"
9710     ".. [1] Boyd, Stephen and Lieven Vandenberghe. *Convex optimization*.\n"
9711     "       Cambridge University Press, 2004.\n"
9712     "       :doi:`https://doi.org/10.1017/CBO9780511804441`")
9713 ufunc_kl_div_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
9714 ufunc_kl_div_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
9715 ufunc_kl_div_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9716 ufunc_kl_div_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9717 ufunc_kl_div_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9718 ufunc_kl_div_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9719 ufunc_kl_div_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9720 ufunc_kl_div_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9721 ufunc_kl_div_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_kl_div
9722 ufunc_kl_div_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kl_div")
9723 ufunc_kl_div_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_kl_div
9724 ufunc_kl_div_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kl_div")
9725 ufunc_kl_div_data[0] = &ufunc_kl_div_ptr[2*0]
9726 ufunc_kl_div_data[1] = &ufunc_kl_div_ptr[2*1]
9727 kl_div = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_kl_div_loops, ufunc_kl_div_data, ufunc_kl_div_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "kl_div", ufunc_kl_div_doc, 0)
9728 
9729 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_kn_loops[3]
9730 cdef void *ufunc_kn_ptr[6]
9731 cdef void *ufunc_kn_data[3]
9732 cdef char ufunc_kn_types[9]
9733 cdef char *ufunc_kn_doc = (
9734     "kn(n, x, out=None)\n"
9735     "\n"
9736     "Modified Bessel function of the second kind of integer order `n`\n"
9737     "\n"
9738     "Returns the modified Bessel function of the second kind for integer order\n"
9739     "`n` at real `z`.\n"
9740     "\n"
9741     "These are also sometimes called functions of the third kind, Basset\n"
9742     "functions, or Macdonald functions.\n"
9743     "\n"
9744     "Parameters\n"
9745     "----------\n"
9746     "n : array_like of int\n"
9747     "    Order of Bessel functions (floats will truncate with a warning)\n"
9748     "x : array_like of float\n"
9749     "    Argument at which to evaluate the Bessel functions\n"
9750     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9751     "    Optional output array for the function results.\n"
9752     "\n"
9753     "Returns\n"
9754     "-------\n"
9755     "scalar or ndarray\n"
9756     "    Value of the Modified Bessel function of the second kind,\n"
9757     "    :math:`K_n(x)`.\n"
9758     "\n"
9759     "See Also\n"
9760     "--------\n"
9761     "kv : Same function, but accepts real order and complex argument\n"
9762     "kvp : Derivative of this function\n"
9763     "\n"
9764     "Notes\n"
9765     "-----\n"
9766     "Wrapper for AMOS [1]_ routine `zbesk`.  For a discussion of the\n"
9767     "algorithm used, see [2]_ and the references therein.\n"
9768     "\n"
9769     "References\n"
9770     "----------\n"
9771     ".. [1] Donald E. Amos, \"AMOS, A Portable Package for Bessel Functions\n"
9772     "       of a Complex Argument and Nonnegative Order\",\n"
9773     "       http://netlib.org/amos/\n"
9774     ".. [2] Donald E. Amos, \"Algorithm 644: A portable package for Bessel\n"
9775     "       functions of a complex argument and nonnegative order\", ACM\n"
9776     "       TOMS Vol. 12 Issue 3, Sept. 1986, p. 265\n"
9777     "\n"
9778     "Examples\n"
9779     "--------\n"
9780     "Plot the function of several orders for real input:\n"
9781     "\n"
9782     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
9783     ">>> from scipy.special import kn\n"
9784     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
9785     ">>> x = np.linspace(0, 5, 1000)\n"
9786     ">>> for N in range(6):\n"
9787     "...     plt.plot(x, kn(N, x), label='$K_{}(x)$'.format(N))\n"
9788     ">>> plt.ylim(0, 10)\n"
9789     ">>> plt.legend()\n"
9790     ">>> plt.title(r'Modified Bessel function of the second kind $K_n(x)$')\n"
9791     ">>> plt.show()\n"
9792     "\n"
9793     "Calculate for a single value at multiple orders:\n"
9794     "\n"
9795     ">>> kn([4, 5, 6], 1)\n"
9796     "array([   44.23241585,   360.9605896 ,  3653.83831186])")
9797 ufunc_kn_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
9798 ufunc_kn_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
9799 ufunc_kn_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
9800 ufunc_kn_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
9801 ufunc_kn_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9802 ufunc_kn_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9803 ufunc_kn_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9804 ufunc_kn_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9805 ufunc_kn_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9806 ufunc_kn_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9807 ufunc_kn_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9808 ufunc_kn_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9809 ufunc_kn_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_special_cyl_bessel_k_int
9810 ufunc_kn_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kn")
9811 ufunc_kn_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_kn_unsafe
9812 ufunc_kn_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kn")
9813 ufunc_kn_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_kn_unsafe
9814 ufunc_kn_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kn")
9815 ufunc_kn_data[0] = &ufunc_kn_ptr[2*0]
9816 ufunc_kn_data[1] = &ufunc_kn_ptr[2*1]
9817 ufunc_kn_data[2] = &ufunc_kn_ptr[2*2]
9818 kn = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_kn_loops, ufunc_kn_data, ufunc_kn_types, 3, 2, 1, 0, "kn", ufunc_kn_doc, 0)

9820 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_kolmogi_loops[2]
9821 cdef void *ufunc_kolmogi_ptr[4]
9822 cdef void *ufunc_kolmogi_data[2]
9823 cdef char ufunc_kolmogi_types[4]
9824 cdef char *ufunc_kolmogi_doc = (
9825     "kolmogi(p, out=None)\n"
9826     "\n"
9827     "Inverse Survival Function of Kolmogorov distribution\n"
9828     "\n"
9829     "It is the inverse function to `kolmogorov`.\n"
9830     "Returns y such that ``kolmogorov(y) == p``.\n"
9831     "\n"
9832     "Parameters\n"
9833     "----------\n"
9834     "p : float array_like\n"
9835     "    Probability\n"
9836     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9837     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
9838     "\n"
9839     "Returns\n"
9840     "-------\n"
9841     "scalar or ndarray\n"
9842     "    The value(s) of kolmogi(p)\n"
9843     "\n"
9844     "See Also\n"
9845     "--------\n"
9846     "kolmogorov : The Survival Function for the distribution\n"
9847     "scipy.stats.kstwobign : Provides the functionality as a continuous distribution\n"
9848     "smirnov, smirnovi : Functions for the one-sided distribution\n"
9849     "\n"
9850     "Notes\n"
9851     "-----\n"
9852     "`kolmogorov` is used by `stats.kstest` in the application of the\n"
9853     "Kolmogorov-Smirnov Goodness of Fit test. For historical reasons this\n"
9854     "function is exposed in `scpy.special`, but the recommended way to achieve\n"
9855     "the most accurate CDF/SF/PDF/PPF/ISF computations is to use the\n"
9856     "`stats.kstwobign` distribution.\n"
9857     "\n"
9858     "Examples\n"
9859     "--------\n"
9860     ">>> from scipy.special import kolmogi\n"
9861     ">>> kolmogi([0, 0.1, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.9, 1.0])\n"
9862     "array([        inf,  1.22384787,  1.01918472,  0.82757356,  0.67644769,\n"
9863     "        0.57117327,  0.        ])")
9864 ufunc_kolmogi_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
9865 ufunc_kolmogi_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
9866 ufunc_kolmogi_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9867 ufunc_kolmogi_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9868 ufunc_kolmogi_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9869 ufunc_kolmogi_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9870 ufunc_kolmogi_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_kolmogi
9871 ufunc_kolmogi_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kolmogi")
9872 ufunc_kolmogi_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_kolmogi
9873 ufunc_kolmogi_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kolmogi")
9874 ufunc_kolmogi_data[0] = &ufunc_kolmogi_ptr[2*0]
9875 ufunc_kolmogi_data[1] = &ufunc_kolmogi_ptr[2*1]
9876 kolmogi = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_kolmogi_loops, ufunc_kolmogi_data, ufunc_kolmogi_types, 2, 1, 1, 0, "kolmogi", ufunc_kolmogi_doc, 0)
9877 
9878 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_kolmogorov_loops[2]
9879 cdef void *ufunc_kolmogorov_ptr[4]
9880 cdef void *ufunc_kolmogorov_data[2]
9881 cdef char ufunc_kolmogorov_types[4]
9882 cdef char *ufunc_kolmogorov_doc = (
9883     "kolmogorov(y, out=None)\n"
9884     "\n"
9885     "Complementary cumulative distribution (Survival Function) function of\n"
9886     "Kolmogorov distribution.\n"
9887     "\n"
9888     "Returns the complementary cumulative distribution function of\n"
9889     "Kolmogorov's limiting distribution (``D_n*\\sqrt(n)`` as n goes to infinity)\n"
9890     "of a two-sided test for equality between an empirical and a theoretical\n"
9891     "distribution. It is equal to the (limit as n->infinity of the)\n"
9892     "probability that ``sqrt(n) * max absolute deviation > y``.\n"
9893     "\n"
9894     "Parameters\n"
9895     "----------\n"
9896     "y : float array_like\n"
9897     "  Absolute deviation between the Empirical CDF (ECDF) and the target CDF,\n"
9898     "  multiplied by sqrt(n).\n"
9899     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
9900     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
9901     "\n"
9902     "Returns\n"
9903     "-------\n"
9904     "scalar or ndarray\n"
9905     "    The value(s) of kolmogorov(y)\n"
9906     "\n"
9907     "See Also\n"
9908     "--------\n"
9909     "kolmogi : The Inverse Survival Function for the distribution\n"
9910     "scipy.stats.kstwobign : Provides the functionality as a continuous distribution\n"
9911     "smirnov, smirnovi : Functions for the one-sided distribution\n"
9912     "\n"
9913     "Notes\n"
9914     "-----\n"
9915     "`kolmogorov` is used by `stats.kstest` in the application of the\n"
9916     "Kolmogorov-Smirnov Goodness of Fit test. For historical reasons this\n"
9917     "function is exposed in `scpy.special`, but the recommended way to achieve\n"
9918     "the most accurate CDF/SF/PDF/PPF/ISF computations is to use the\n"
9919     "`stats.kstwobign` distribution.\n"
9920     "\n"
9921     "Examples\n"
9922     "--------\n"
9923     "Show the probability of a gap at least as big as 0, 0.5 and 1.0.\n"
9924     "\n"
9925     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
9926     ">>> from scipy.special import kolmogorov\n"
9927     ">>> from scipy.stats import kstwobign\n"
9928     ">>> kolmogorov([0, 0.5, 1.0])\n"
9929     "array([ 1.        ,  0.96394524,  0.26999967])\n"
9930     "\n"
9931     "Compare a sample of size 1000 drawn from a Laplace(0, 1) distribution against\n"
9932     "the target distribution, a Normal(0, 1) distribution.\n"
9933     "\n"
9934     ">>> from scipy.stats import norm, laplace\n"
9935     ">>> rng = np.random.default_rng()\n"
9936     ">>> n = 1000\n"
9937     ">>> lap01 = laplace(0, 1)\n"
9938     ">>> x = np.sort(lap01.rvs(n, random_state=rng))\n"
9939     ">>> np.mean(x), np.std(x)\n"
9940     "(-0.05841730131499543, 1.3968109101997568)\n"
9941     "\n"
9942     "Construct the Empirical CDF and the K-S statistic Dn.\n"
9943     "\n"
9944     ">>> target = norm(0,1)  # Normal mean 0, stddev 1\n"
9945     ">>> cdfs = target.cdf(x)\n"
9946     ">>> ecdfs = np.arange(n+1, dtype=float)/n\n"
9947     ">>> gaps = np.column_stack([cdfs - ecdfs[:n], ecdfs[1:] - cdfs])\n"
9948     ">>> Dn = np.max(gaps)\n"
9949     ">>> Kn = np.sqrt(n) * Dn\n"
9950     ">>> print('Dn=%f, sqrt(n)*Dn=%f' % (Dn, Kn))\n"
9951     "Dn=0.043363, sqrt(n)*Dn=1.371265\n"
9952     ">>> print(chr(10).join(['For a sample of size n drawn from a N(0, 1) distribution:',\n"
9953     "...   ' the approximate Kolmogorov probability that sqrt(n)*Dn>=%f is %f' %\n"
9954     "...    (Kn, kolmogorov(Kn)),\n"
9955     "...   ' the approximate Kolmogorov probability that sqrt(n)*Dn<=%f is %f' %\n"
9956     "...    (Kn, kstwobign.cdf(Kn))]))\n"
9957     "For a sample of size n drawn from a N(0, 1) distribution:\n"
9958     " the approximate Kolmogorov probability that sqrt(n)*Dn>=1.371265 is 0.046533\n"
9959     " the approximate Kolmogorov probability that sqrt(n)*Dn<=1.371265 is 0.953467\n"
9960     "\n"
9961     "Plot the Empirical CDF against the target N(0, 1) CDF.\n"
9962     "\n"
9963     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
9964     ">>> plt.step(np.concatenate([[-3], x]), ecdfs, where='post', label='Empirical CDF')\n"
9965     ">>> x3 = np.linspace(-3, 3, 100)\n"
9966     ">>> plt.plot(x3, target.cdf(x3), label='CDF for N(0, 1)')\n"
9967     ">>> plt.ylim([0, 1]); plt.grid(True); plt.legend();\n"
9968     ">>> # Add vertical lines marking Dn+ and Dn-\n"
9969     ">>> iminus, iplus = np.argmax(gaps, axis=0)\n"
9970     ">>> plt.vlines([x[iminus]], ecdfs[iminus], cdfs[iminus],\n"
9971     "...            color='r', linestyle='dashed', lw=4)\n"
9972     ">>> plt.vlines([x[iplus]], cdfs[iplus], ecdfs[iplus+1],\n"
9973     "...            color='r', linestyle='dashed', lw=4)\n"
9974     ">>> plt.show()")
9975 ufunc_kolmogorov_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
9976 ufunc_kolmogorov_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
9977 ufunc_kolmogorov_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9978 ufunc_kolmogorov_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
9979 ufunc_kolmogorov_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9980 ufunc_kolmogorov_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
9981 ufunc_kolmogorov_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_kolmogorov
9982 ufunc_kolmogorov_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kolmogorov")
9983 ufunc_kolmogorov_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_kolmogorov
9984 ufunc_kolmogorov_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"kolmogorov")
9985 ufunc_kolmogorov_data[0] = &ufunc_kolmogorov_ptr[2*0]
9986 ufunc_kolmogorov_data[1] = &ufunc_kolmogorov_ptr[2*1]
9987 kolmogorov = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_kolmogorov_loops, ufunc_kolmogorov_data, ufunc_kolmogorov_types, 2, 1, 1, 0, "kolmogorov", ufunc_kolmogorov_doc, 0)
9988 
9989 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_log1p_loops[4]
9990 cdef void *ufunc_log1p_ptr[8]
9991 cdef void *ufunc_log1p_data[4]
9992 cdef char ufunc_log1p_types[8]
9993 cdef char *ufunc_log1p_doc = (
9994     "log1p(x, out=None)\n"
9995     "\n"
9996     "Calculates log(1 + x) for use when `x` is near zero.\n"
9997     "\n"
9998     "Parameters\n"
9999     "----------\n"
10000     "x : array_like\n"
10001     "    Real or complex valued input.\n"
10002     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10003     "    Optional output array for the function results.\n"
10004     "\n"
10005     "Returns\n"
10006     "-------\n"
10007     "scalar or ndarray\n"
10008     "    Values of ``log(1 + x)``.\n"
10009     "\n"
10010     "See Also\n"
10011     "--------\n"
10012     "expm1, cosm1\n"
10013     "\n"
10014     "Examples\n"
10015     "--------\n"
10016     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
10017     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
10018     "\n"
10019     "It is more accurate than using ``log(1 + x)`` directly for ``x``\n"
10020     "near 0. Note that in the below example ``1 + 1e-17 == 1`` to\n"
10021     "double precision.\n"
10022     "\n"
10023     ">>> sc.log1p(1e-17)\n"
10024     "1e-17\n"
10025     ">>> np.log(1 + 1e-17)\n"
10026     "0.0")
10027 ufunc_log1p_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
10028 ufunc_log1p_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
10029 ufunc_log1p_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_F_F
10030 ufunc_log1p_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_D_D
10031 ufunc_log1p_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10032 ufunc_log1p_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10033 ufunc_log1p_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10034 ufunc_log1p_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10035 ufunc_log1p_types[4] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
10036 ufunc_log1p_types[5] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
10037 ufunc_log1p_types[6] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
10038 ufunc_log1p_types[7] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
10039 ufunc_log1p_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_log1p
10040 ufunc_log1p_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"log1p")
10041 ufunc_log1p_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_cephes_log1p
10042 ufunc_log1p_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"log1p")
10043 ufunc_log1p_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_clog1p
10044 ufunc_log1p_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"log1p")
10045 ufunc_log1p_ptr[2*3] = <void*>_func_clog1p
10046 ufunc_log1p_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"log1p")

10052 
10053 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_log_ndtr_loops[4]
10054 cdef void *ufunc_log_ndtr_ptr[8]
10055 cdef void *ufunc_log_ndtr_data[4]
10056 cdef char ufunc_log_ndtr_types[8]
10057 cdef char *ufunc_log_ndtr_doc = (
10058     "log_ndtr(x, out=None)\n"
10059     "\n"
10060     "Logarithm of Gaussian cumulative distribution function.\n"
10061     "\n"
10062     "Returns the log of the area under the standard Gaussian probability\n"
10063     "density function, integrated from minus infinity to `x`::\n"
10064     "\n"
10065     "    log(1/sqrt(2*pi) * integral(exp(-t**2 / 2), t=-inf..x))\n"
10066     "\n"
10067     "Parameters\n"
10068     "----------\n"
10069     "x : array_like, real or complex\n"
10070     "    Argument\n"
10071     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10072     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
10073     "\n"
10074     "Returns\n"
10075     "-------\n"
10076     "scalar or ndarray\n"
10077     "    The value of the log of the normal CDF evaluated at `x`\n"
10078     "\n"
10079     "See Also\n"
10080     "--------\n"
10081     "erf\n"
10082     "erfc\n"
10083     "scipy.stats.norm\n"
10084     "ndtr\n"
10085     "\n"
10086     "Examples\n"
10087     "--------\n"
10088     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
10089     ">>> from scipy.special import log_ndtr, ndtr\n"
10090     "\n"
10091     "The benefit of ``log_ndtr(x)`` over the naive implementation\n"
10092     "``np.log(ndtr(x))`` is most evident with moderate to large positive\n"
10093     "values of ``x``:\n"
10094     "\n"
10095     ">>> x = np.array([6, 7, 9, 12, 15, 25])\n"
10096     ">>> log_ndtr(x)\n"
10097     "array([-9.86587646e-010, -1.27981254e-012, -1.12858841e-019,\n"
10098     "       -1.77648211e-033, -3.67096620e-051, -3.05669671e-138])\n"
10099     "\n"
10100     "The results of the naive calculation for the moderate ``x`` values\n"
10101     "have only 5 or 6 correct significant digits. For values of ``x``\n"
10102     "greater than approximately 8.3, the naive expression returns 0:\n"
10103     "\n"
10104     ">>> np.log(ndtr(x))\n"
10105     "array([-9.86587701e-10, -1.27986510e-12,  0.00000000e+00,\n"
10106     "        0.00000000e+00,  0.00000000e+00,  0.00000000e+00])")
10107 ufunc_log_ndtr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
10108 ufunc_log_ndtr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
10109 ufunc_log_ndtr_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_F_F
10110 ufunc_log_ndtr_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_D_D
10111 ufunc_log_ndtr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10112 ufunc_log_ndtr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10113 ufunc_log_ndtr_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10114 ufunc_log_ndtr_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10115 ufunc_log_ndtr_types[4] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
10116 ufunc_log_ndtr_types[5] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
10117 ufunc_log_ndtr_types[6] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
10118 ufunc_log_ndtr_types[7] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
10119 ufunc_log_ndtr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_log_ndtr
10120 ufunc_log_ndtr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"log_ndtr")
10121 ufunc_log_ndtr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_log_ndtr
10122 ufunc_log_ndtr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"log_ndtr")

10124 ufunc_log_ndtr_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"log_ndtr")
10125 ufunc_log_ndtr_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_log_ndtr_complex
10126 ufunc_log_ndtr_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"log_ndtr")
