10132 
10133 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_lpmv_loops[2]
10134 cdef void *ufunc_lpmv_ptr[4]
10135 cdef void *ufunc_lpmv_data[2]
10136 cdef char ufunc_lpmv_types[8]
10137 cdef char *ufunc_lpmv_doc = (
10138     "lpmv(m, v, x, out=None)\n"
10139     "\n"
10140     "Associated Legendre function of integer order and real degree.\n"
10141     "\n"
10142     "Defined as\n"
10143     "\n"
10144     ".. math::\n"
10145     "\n"
10146     "    P_v^m = (-1)^m (1 - x^2)^{m/2} \\frac{d^m}{dx^m} P_v(x)\n"
10147     "\n"
10148     "where\n"
10149     "\n"
10150     ".. math::\n"
10151     "\n"
10152     "    P_v = \\sum_{k = 0}^\\infty \\frac{(-v)_k (v + 1)_k}{(k!)^2}\n"
10153     "            \\left(\\frac{1 - x}{2}\\right)^k\n"
10154     "\n"
10155     "is the Legendre function of the first kind. Here :math:`(\\cdot)_k`\n"
10156     "is the Pochhammer symbol; see `poch`.\n"
10157     "\n"
10158     "Parameters\n"
10159     "----------\n"
10160     "m : array_like\n"
10161     "    Order (int or float). If passed a float not equal to an\n"
10162     "    integer the function returns NaN.\n"
10163     "v : array_like\n"
10164     "    Degree (float).\n"
10165     "x : array_like\n"
10166     "    Argument (float). Must have ``|x| <= 1``.\n"
10167     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10168     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
10169     "\n"
10170     "Returns\n"
10171     "-------\n"
10172     "pmv : scalar or ndarray\n"
10173     "    Value of the associated Legendre function.\n"
10174     "\n"
10175     "See Also\n"
10176     "--------\n"
10177     "lpmn : Compute the associated Legendre function for all orders\n"
10178     "       ``0, ..., m`` and degrees ``0, ..., n``.\n"
10179     "clpmn : Compute the associated Legendre function at complex\n"
10180     "        arguments.\n"
10181     "\n"
10182     "Notes\n"
10183     "-----\n"
10184     "Note that this implementation includes the Condon-Shortley phase.\n"
10185     "\n"
10186     "References\n"
10187     "----------\n"
10188     ".. [1] Zhang, Jin, \"Computation of Special Functions\", John Wiley\n"
10189     "       and Sons, Inc, 1996.")
10190 ufunc_lpmv_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
10191 ufunc_lpmv_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
10192 ufunc_lpmv_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10193 ufunc_lpmv_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10194 ufunc_lpmv_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10195 ufunc_lpmv_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10196 ufunc_lpmv_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10197 ufunc_lpmv_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10198 ufunc_lpmv_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10199 ufunc_lpmv_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10200 ufunc_lpmv_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_pmv_wrap
10201 ufunc_lpmv_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"lpmv")
10202 ufunc_lpmv_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_pmv_wrap
10203 ufunc_lpmv_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"lpmv")
10204 ufunc_lpmv_data[0] = &ufunc_lpmv_ptr[2*0]
10205 ufunc_lpmv_data[1] = &ufunc_lpmv_ptr[2*1]
10206 lpmv = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_lpmv_loops, ufunc_lpmv_data, ufunc_lpmv_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "lpmv", ufunc_lpmv_doc, 0)
10207 
10208 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nbdtr_loops[3]
10209 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[6]
10210 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtr_data[3]
10211 cdef char ufunc_nbdtr_types[12]
10212 cdef char *ufunc_nbdtr_doc = (
10213     "nbdtr(k, n, p, out=None)\n"
10214     "\n"
10215     "Negative binomial cumulative distribution function.\n"
10216     "\n"
10217     "Returns the sum of the terms 0 through `k` of the negative binomial\n"
10218     "distribution probability mass function,\n"
10219     "\n"
10220     ".. math::\n"
10221     "\n"
10222     "    F = \\sum_{j=0}^k {{n + j - 1}\\choose{j}} p^n (1 - p)^j.\n"
10223     "\n"
10224     "In a sequence of Bernoulli trials with individual success probabilities\n"
10225     "`p`, this is the probability that `k` or fewer failures precede the nth\n"
10226     "success.\n"
10227     "\n"
10228     "Parameters\n"
10229     "----------\n"
10230     "k : array_like\n"
10231     "    The maximum number of allowed failures (nonnegative int).\n"
10232     "n : array_like\n"
10233     "    The target number of successes (positive int).\n"
10234     "p : array_like\n"
10235     "    Probability of success in a single event (float).\n"
10236     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10237     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
10238     "\n"
10239     "Returns\n"
10240     "-------\n"
10241     "F : scalar or ndarray\n"
10242     "    The probability of `k` or fewer failures before `n` successes in a\n"
10243     "    sequence of events with individual success probability `p`.\n"
10244     "\n"
10245     "See Also\n"
10246     "--------\n"
10247     "nbdtrc : Negative binomial survival function\n"
10248     "nbdtrik : Negative binomial quantile function\n"
10249     "scipy.stats.nbinom : Negative binomial distribution\n"
10250     "\n"
10251     "Notes\n"
10252     "-----\n"
10253     "If floating point values are passed for `k` or `n`, they will be truncated\n"
10254     "to integers.\n"
10255     "\n"
10256     "The terms are not summed directly; instead the regularized incomplete beta\n"
10257     "function is employed, according to the formula,\n"
10258     "\n"
10259     ".. math::\n"
10260     "    \\mathrm{nbdtr}(k, n, p) = I_{p}(n, k + 1).\n"
10261     "\n"
10262     "Wrapper for the Cephes [1]_ routine `nbdtr`.\n"
10263     "\n"
10264     "The negative binomial distribution is also available as\n"
10265     "`scipy.stats.nbinom`. Using `nbdtr` directly can improve performance\n"
10266     "compared to the ``cdf`` method of `scipy.stats.nbinom` (see last example).\n"
10267     "\n"
10268     "References\n"
10269     "----------\n"
10270     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
10271     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
10272     "\n"
10273     "Examples\n"
10274     "--------\n"
10275     "Compute the function for ``k=10`` and ``n=5`` at ``p=0.5``.\n"
10276     "\n"
10277     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
10278     ">>> from scipy.special import nbdtr\n"
10279     ">>> nbdtr(10, 5, 0.5)\n"
10280     "0.940765380859375\n"
10281     "\n"
10282     "Compute the function for ``n=10`` and ``p=0.5`` at several points by\n"
10283     "providing a NumPy array or list for `k`.\n"
10284     "\n"
10285     ">>> nbdtr([5, 10, 15], 10, 0.5)\n"
10286     "array([0.15087891, 0.58809853, 0.88523853])\n"
10287     "\n"
10288     "Plot the function for four different parameter sets.\n"
10289     "\n"
10290     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
10291     ">>> k = np.arange(130)\n"
10292     ">>> n_parameters = [20, 20, 20, 80]\n"
10293     ">>> p_parameters = [0.2, 0.5, 0.8, 0.5]\n"
10294     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
10295     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(p_parameters, n_parameters,\n"
10296     "...                            linestyles))\n"
10297     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))\n"
10298     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
10299     "...     p, n, style = parameter_set\n"
10300     "...     nbdtr_vals = nbdtr(k, n, p)\n"
10301     "...     ax.plot(k, nbdtr_vals, label=rf\"$n={n},\\, p={p}$\",\n"
10302     "...             ls=style)\n"
10303     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
10304     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$k$\")\n"
10305     ">>> ax.set_title(\"Negative binomial cumulative distribution function\")\n"
10306     ">>> plt.show()\n"
10307     "\n"
10308     "The negative binomial distribution is also available as\n"
10309     "`scipy.stats.nbinom`. Using `nbdtr` directly can be much faster than\n"
10310     "calling the ``cdf`` method of `scipy.stats.nbinom`, especially for small\n"
10311     "arrays or individual values. To get the same results one must use the\n"
10312     "following parametrization: ``nbinom(n, p).cdf(k)=nbdtr(k, n, p)``.\n"
10313     "\n"
10314     ">>> from scipy.stats import nbinom\n"
10315     ">>> k, n, p = 5, 3, 0.5\n"
10316     ">>> nbdtr_res = nbdtr(k, n, p)  # this will often be faster than below\n"
10317     ">>> stats_res = nbinom(n, p).cdf(k)\n"
10318     ">>> stats_res, nbdtr_res  # test that results are equal\n"
10319     "(0.85546875, 0.85546875)\n"
10320     "\n"
10321     "`nbdtr` can evaluate different parameter sets by providing arrays with\n"
10322     "shapes compatible for broadcasting for `k`, `n` and `p`. Here we compute\n"
10323     "the function for three different `k` at four locations `p`, resulting in\n"
10324     "a 3x4 array.\n"
10325     "\n"
10326     ">>> k = np.array([[5], [10], [15]])\n"
10327     ">>> p = np.array([0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 0.9])\n"
10328     ">>> k.shape, p.shape\n"
10329     "((3, 1), (4,))\n"
10330     "\n"
10331     ">>> nbdtr(k, 5, p)\n"
10332     "array([[0.15026833, 0.62304687, 0.95265101, 0.9998531 ],\n"
10333     "       [0.48450894, 0.94076538, 0.99932777, 0.99999999],\n"
10334     "       [0.76249222, 0.99409103, 0.99999445, 1.        ]])")
10335 ufunc_nbdtr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ppd__As_ppd_d
10336 ufunc_nbdtr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
10337 ufunc_nbdtr_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
10338 ufunc_nbdtr_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
10339 ufunc_nbdtr_types[1] = <char>NPY_INTP
10340 ufunc_nbdtr_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10341 ufunc_nbdtr_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10342 ufunc_nbdtr_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10343 ufunc_nbdtr_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10344 ufunc_nbdtr_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10345 ufunc_nbdtr_types[7] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10346 ufunc_nbdtr_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10347 ufunc_nbdtr_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10348 ufunc_nbdtr_types[10] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10349 ufunc_nbdtr_types[11] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10350 ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_nbdtr_wrap
10351 ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtr")
10352 ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_nbdtr_unsafe
10353 ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtr")
10354 ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_nbdtr_unsafe
10355 ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtr")
10356 ufunc_nbdtr_data[0] = &ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*0]
10357 ufunc_nbdtr_data[1] = &ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*1]
10358 ufunc_nbdtr_data[2] = &ufunc_nbdtr_ptr[2*2]
10359 nbdtr = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_nbdtr_loops, ufunc_nbdtr_data, ufunc_nbdtr_types, 3, 3, 1, 0, "nbdtr", ufunc_nbdtr_doc, 0)
10360 
10361 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nbdtrc_loops[3]
10362 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[6]
10363 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtrc_data[3]
10364 cdef char ufunc_nbdtrc_types[12]
10365 cdef char *ufunc_nbdtrc_doc = (
10366     "nbdtrc(k, n, p, out=None)\n"
10367     "\n"
10368     "Negative binomial survival function.\n"
10369     "\n"
10370     "Returns the sum of the terms `k + 1` to infinity of the negative binomial\n"
10371     "distribution probability mass function,\n"
10372     "\n"
10373     ".. math::\n"
10374     "\n"
10375     "    F = \\sum_{j=k + 1}^\\infty {{n + j - 1}\\choose{j}} p^n (1 - p)^j.\n"
10376     "\n"
10377     "In a sequence of Bernoulli trials with individual success probabilities\n"
10378     "`p`, this is the probability that more than `k` failures precede the nth\n"
10379     "success.\n"
10380     "\n"
10381     "Parameters\n"
10382     "----------\n"
10383     "k : array_like\n"
10384     "    The maximum number of allowed failures (nonnegative int).\n"
10385     "n : array_like\n"
10386     "    The target number of successes (positive int).\n"
10387     "p : array_like\n"
10388     "    Probability of success in a single event (float).\n"
10389     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10390     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
10391     "\n"
10392     "Returns\n"
10393     "-------\n"
10394     "F : scalar or ndarray\n"
10395     "    The probability of `k + 1` or more failures before `n` successes in a\n"
10396     "    sequence of events with individual success probability `p`.\n"
10397     "\n"
10398     "See Also\n"
10399     "--------\n"
10400     "nbdtr : Negative binomial cumulative distribution function\n"
10401     "nbdtrik : Negative binomial percentile function\n"
10402     "scipy.stats.nbinom : Negative binomial distribution\n"
10403     "\n"
10404     "Notes\n"
10405     "-----\n"
10406     "If floating point values are passed for `k` or `n`, they will be truncated\n"
10407     "to integers.\n"
10408     "\n"
10409     "The terms are not summed directly; instead the regularized incomplete beta\n"
10410     "function is employed, according to the formula,\n"
10411     "\n"
10412     ".. math::\n"
10413     "    \\mathrm{nbdtrc}(k, n, p) = I_{1 - p}(k + 1, n).\n"
10414     "\n"
10415     "Wrapper for the Cephes [1]_ routine `nbdtrc`.\n"
10416     "\n"
10417     "The negative binomial distribution is also available as\n"
10418     "`scipy.stats.nbinom`. Using `nbdtrc` directly can improve performance\n"
10419     "compared to the ``sf`` method of `scipy.stats.nbinom` (see last example).\n"
10420     "\n"
10421     "References\n"
10422     "----------\n"
10423     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
10424     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
10425     "\n"
10426     "Examples\n"
10427     "--------\n"
10428     "Compute the function for ``k=10`` and ``n=5`` at ``p=0.5``.\n"
10429     "\n"
10430     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
10431     ">>> from scipy.special import nbdtrc\n"
10432     ">>> nbdtrc(10, 5, 0.5)\n"
10433     "0.059234619140624986\n"
10434     "\n"
10435     "Compute the function for ``n=10`` and ``p=0.5`` at several points by\n"
10436     "providing a NumPy array or list for `k`.\n"
10437     "\n"
10438     ">>> nbdtrc([5, 10, 15], 10, 0.5)\n"
10439     "array([0.84912109, 0.41190147, 0.11476147])\n"
10440     "\n"
10441     "Plot the function for four different parameter sets.\n"
10442     "\n"
10443     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
10444     ">>> k = np.arange(130)\n"
10445     ">>> n_parameters = [20, 20, 20, 80]\n"
10446     ">>> p_parameters = [0.2, 0.5, 0.8, 0.5]\n"
10447     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
10448     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(p_parameters, n_parameters,\n"
10449     "...                            linestyles))\n"
10450     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))\n"
10451     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
10452     "...     p, n, style = parameter_set\n"
10453     "...     nbdtrc_vals = nbdtrc(k, n, p)\n"
10454     "...     ax.plot(k, nbdtrc_vals, label=rf\"$n={n},\\, p={p}$\",\n"
10455     "...             ls=style)\n"
10456     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
10457     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$k$\")\n"
10458     ">>> ax.set_title(\"Negative binomial distribution survival function\")\n"
10459     ">>> plt.show()\n"
10460     "\n"
10461     "The negative binomial distribution is also available as\n"
10462     "`scipy.stats.nbinom`. Using `nbdtrc` directly can be much faster than\n"
10463     "calling the ``sf`` method of `scipy.stats.nbinom`, especially for small\n"
10464     "arrays or individual values. To get the same results one must use the\n"
10465     "following parametrization: ``nbinom(n, p).sf(k)=nbdtrc(k, n, p)``.\n"
10466     "\n"
10467     ">>> from scipy.stats import nbinom\n"
10468     ">>> k, n, p = 3, 5, 0.5\n"
10469     ">>> nbdtr_res = nbdtrc(k, n, p)  # this will often be faster than below\n"
10470     ">>> stats_res = nbinom(n, p).sf(k)\n"
10471     ">>> stats_res, nbdtr_res  # test that results are equal\n"
10472     "(0.6367187499999999, 0.6367187499999999)\n"
10473     "\n"
10474     "`nbdtrc` can evaluate different parameter sets by providing arrays with\n"
10475     "shapes compatible for broadcasting for `k`, `n` and `p`. Here we compute\n"
10476     "the function for three different `k` at four locations `p`, resulting in\n"
10477     "a 3x4 array.\n"
10478     "\n"
10479     ">>> k = np.array([[5], [10], [15]])\n"
10480     ">>> p = np.array([0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 0.9])\n"
10481     ">>> k.shape, p.shape\n"
10482     "((3, 1), (4,))\n"
10483     "\n"
10484     ">>> nbdtrc(k, 5, p)\n"
10485     "array([[8.49731667e-01, 3.76953125e-01, 4.73489874e-02, 1.46902600e-04],\n"
10486     "       [5.15491059e-01, 5.92346191e-02, 6.72234070e-04, 9.29610100e-09],\n"
10487     "       [2.37507779e-01, 5.90896606e-03, 5.55025308e-06, 3.26346760e-13]])")
10488 ufunc_nbdtrc_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ppd__As_ppd_d
10489 ufunc_nbdtrc_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
10490 ufunc_nbdtrc_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
10491 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
10492 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[1] = <char>NPY_INTP
10493 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10494 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10495 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10496 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10497 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10498 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[7] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10499 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10500 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10501 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[10] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10502 ufunc_nbdtrc_types[11] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10503 ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_nbdtrc_wrap
10504 ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtrc")
10505 ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_nbdtrc_unsafe
10506 ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtrc")
10507 ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_nbdtrc_unsafe
10508 ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtrc")
10509 ufunc_nbdtrc_data[0] = &ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*0]
10510 ufunc_nbdtrc_data[1] = &ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*1]
10511 ufunc_nbdtrc_data[2] = &ufunc_nbdtrc_ptr[2*2]
10512 nbdtrc = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_nbdtrc_loops, ufunc_nbdtrc_data, ufunc_nbdtrc_types, 3, 3, 1, 0, "nbdtrc", ufunc_nbdtrc_doc, 0)
10513 
10514 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nbdtri_loops[3]
10515 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[6]
10516 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtri_data[3]
10517 cdef char ufunc_nbdtri_types[12]
10518 cdef char *ufunc_nbdtri_doc = (
10519     "nbdtri(k, n, y, out=None)\n"
10520     "\n"
10521     "Returns the inverse with respect to the parameter `p` of\n"
10522     "``y = nbdtr(k, n, p)``, the negative binomial cumulative distribution\n"
10523     "function.\n"
10524     "\n"
10525     "Parameters\n"
10526     "----------\n"
10527     "k : array_like\n"
10528     "    The maximum number of allowed failures (nonnegative int).\n"
10529     "n : array_like\n"
10530     "    The target number of successes (positive int).\n"
10531     "y : array_like\n"
10532     "    The probability of `k` or fewer failures before `n` successes (float).\n"
10533     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10534     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
10535     "\n"
10536     "Returns\n"
10537     "-------\n"
10538     "p : scalar or ndarray\n"
10539     "    Probability of success in a single event (float) such that\n"
10540     "    `nbdtr(k, n, p) = y`.\n"
10541     "\n"
10542     "See Also\n"
10543     "--------\n"
10544     "nbdtr : Cumulative distribution function of the negative binomial.\n"
10545     "nbdtrc : Negative binomial survival function.\n"
10546     "scipy.stats.nbinom : negative binomial distribution.\n"
10547     "nbdtrik : Inverse with respect to `k` of `nbdtr(k, n, p)`.\n"
10548     "nbdtrin : Inverse with respect to `n` of `nbdtr(k, n, p)`.\n"
10549     "scipy.stats.nbinom : Negative binomial distribution\n"
10550     "\n"
10551     "Notes\n"
10552     "-----\n"
10553     "Wrapper for the Cephes [1]_ routine `nbdtri`.\n"
10554     "\n"
10555     "The negative binomial distribution is also available as\n"
10556     "`scipy.stats.nbinom`. Using `nbdtri` directly can improve performance\n"
10557     "compared to the ``ppf`` method of `scipy.stats.nbinom`.\n"
10558     "\n"
10559     "References\n"
10560     "----------\n"
10561     ".. [1] Cephes Mathematical Functions Library,\n"
10562     "       http://www.netlib.org/cephes/\n"
10563     "\n"
10564     "Examples\n"
10565     "--------\n"
10566     "`nbdtri` is the inverse of `nbdtr` with respect to `p`.\n"
10567     "Up to floating point errors the following holds:\n"
10568     "``nbdtri(k, n, nbdtr(k, n, p))=p``.\n"
10569     "\n"
10570     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
10571     ">>> from scipy.special import nbdtri, nbdtr\n"
10572     ">>> k, n, y = 5, 10, 0.2\n"
10573     ">>> cdf_val = nbdtr(k, n, y)\n"
10574     ">>> nbdtri(k, n, cdf_val)\n"
10575     "0.20000000000000004\n"
10576     "\n"
10577     "Compute the function for ``k=10`` and ``n=5`` at several points by\n"
10578     "providing a NumPy array or list for `y`.\n"
10579     "\n"
10580     ">>> y = np.array([0.1, 0.4, 0.8])\n"
10581     ">>> nbdtri(3, 5, y)\n"
10582     "array([0.34462319, 0.51653095, 0.69677416])\n"
10583     "\n"
10584     "Plot the function for three different parameter sets.\n"
10585     "\n"
10586     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
10587     ">>> n_parameters = [5, 20, 30, 30]\n"
10588     ">>> k_parameters = [20, 20, 60, 80]\n"
10589     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
10590     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(n_parameters, k_parameters, linestyles))\n"
10591     ">>> cdf_vals = np.linspace(0, 1, 1000)\n"
10592     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))\n"
10593     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
10594     "...     n, k, style = parameter_set\n"
10595     "...     nbdtri_vals = nbdtri(k, n, cdf_vals)\n"
10596     "...     ax.plot(cdf_vals, nbdtri_vals, label=rf\"$k={k},\\ n={n}$\",\n"
10597     "...             ls=style)\n"
10598     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
10599     ">>> ax.set_ylabel(\"$p$\")\n"
10600     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$CDF$\")\n"
10601     ">>> title = \"nbdtri: inverse of negative binomial CDF with respect to $p$\"\n"
10602     ">>> ax.set_title(title)\n"
10603     ">>> plt.show()\n"
10604     "\n"
10605     "`nbdtri` can evaluate different parameter sets by providing arrays with\n"
10606     "shapes compatible for broadcasting for `k`, `n` and `p`. Here we compute\n"
10607     "the function for three different `k` at four locations `p`, resulting in\n"
10608     "a 3x4 array.\n"
10609     "\n"
10610     ">>> k = np.array([[5], [10], [15]])\n"
10611     ">>> y = np.array([0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 0.9])\n"
10612     ">>> k.shape, y.shape\n"
10613     "((3, 1), (4,))\n"
10614     "\n"
10615     ">>> nbdtri(k, 5, y)\n"
10616     "array([[0.37258157, 0.45169416, 0.53249956, 0.64578407],\n"
10617     "       [0.24588501, 0.30451981, 0.36778453, 0.46397088],\n"
10618     "       [0.18362101, 0.22966758, 0.28054743, 0.36066188]])")
10619 ufunc_nbdtri_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ppd__As_ppd_d
10620 ufunc_nbdtri_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
10621 ufunc_nbdtri_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
10622 ufunc_nbdtri_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
10623 ufunc_nbdtri_types[1] = <char>NPY_INTP
10624 ufunc_nbdtri_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10625 ufunc_nbdtri_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10626 ufunc_nbdtri_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10627 ufunc_nbdtri_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10628 ufunc_nbdtri_types[6] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10629 ufunc_nbdtri_types[7] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10630 ufunc_nbdtri_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10631 ufunc_nbdtri_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10632 ufunc_nbdtri_types[10] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10633 ufunc_nbdtri_types[11] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10634 ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_nbdtri_wrap
10635 ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtri")
10636 ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_nbdtri_unsafe
10637 ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtri")
10638 ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_nbdtri_unsafe
10639 ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtri")
10640 ufunc_nbdtri_data[0] = &ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*0]
10641 ufunc_nbdtri_data[1] = &ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*1]
10642 ufunc_nbdtri_data[2] = &ufunc_nbdtri_ptr[2*2]
10643 nbdtri = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_nbdtri_loops, ufunc_nbdtri_data, ufunc_nbdtri_types, 3, 3, 1, 0, "nbdtri", ufunc_nbdtri_doc, 0)
10644 
10645 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nbdtrik_loops[2]
10646 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtrik_ptr[4]
10647 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtrik_data[2]
10648 cdef char ufunc_nbdtrik_types[8]
10649 cdef char *ufunc_nbdtrik_doc = (
10650     "nbdtrik(y, n, p, out=None)\n"
10651     "\n"
10652     "Negative binomial percentile function.\n"
10653     "\n"
10654     "Returns the inverse with respect to the parameter `k` of\n"
10655     "``y = nbdtr(k, n, p)``, the negative binomial cumulative distribution\n"
10656     "function.\n"
10657     "\n"
10658     "Parameters\n"
10659     "----------\n"
10660     "y : array_like\n"
10661     "    The probability of `k` or fewer failures before `n` successes (float).\n"
10662     "n : array_like\n"
10663     "    The target number of successes (positive int).\n"
10664     "p : array_like\n"
10665     "    Probability of success in a single event (float).\n"
10666     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10667     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
10668     "\n"
10669     "Returns\n"
10670     "-------\n"
10671     "k : scalar or ndarray\n"
10672     "    The maximum number of allowed failures such that `nbdtr(k, n, p) = y`.\n"
10673     "\n"
10674     "See Also\n"
10675     "--------\n"
10676     "nbdtr : Cumulative distribution function of the negative binomial.\n"
10677     "nbdtrc : Survival function of the negative binomial.\n"
10678     "nbdtri : Inverse with respect to `p` of `nbdtr(k, n, p)`.\n"
10679     "nbdtrin : Inverse with respect to `n` of `nbdtr(k, n, p)`.\n"
10680     "scipy.stats.nbinom : Negative binomial distribution\n"
10681     "\n"
10682     "Notes\n"
10683     "-----\n"
10684     "Wrapper for the CDFLIB [1]_ Fortran routine `cdfnbn`.\n"
10685     "\n"
10686     "Formula 26.5.26 of [2]_,\n"
10687     "\n"
10688     ".. math::\n"
10689     "    \\sum_{j=k + 1}^\\infty {{n + j - 1}\n"
10690     "    \\choose{j}} p^n (1 - p)^j = I_{1 - p}(k + 1, n),\n"
10691     "\n"
10692     "is used to reduce calculation of the cumulative distribution function to\n"
10693     "that of a regularized incomplete beta :math:`I`.\n"
10694     "\n"
10695     "Computation of `k` involves a search for a value that produces the desired\n"
10696     "value of `y`.  The search relies on the monotonicity of `y` with `k`.\n"
10697     "\n"
10698     "References\n"
10699     "----------\n"
10700     ".. [1] Barry Brown, James Lovato, and Kathy Russell,\n"
10701     "       CDFLIB: Library of Fortran Routines for Cumulative Distribution\n"
10702     "       Functions, Inverses, and Other Parameters.\n"
10703     ".. [2] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
10704     "       Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
10705     "       Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.\n"
10706     "\n"
10707     "Examples\n"
10708     "--------\n"
10709     "Compute the negative binomial cumulative distribution function for an\n"
10710     "exemplary parameter set.\n"
10711     "\n"
10712     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
10713     ">>> from scipy.special import nbdtr, nbdtrik\n"
10714     ">>> k, n, p = 5, 2, 0.5\n"
10715     ">>> cdf_value = nbdtr(k, n, p)\n"
10716     ">>> cdf_value\n"
10717     "0.9375\n"
10718     "\n"
10719     "Verify that `nbdtrik` recovers the original value for `k`.\n"
10720     "\n"
10721     ">>> nbdtrik(cdf_value, n, p)\n"
10722     "5.0\n"
10723     "\n"
10724     "Plot the function for different parameter sets.\n"
10725     "\n"
10726     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
10727     ">>> p_parameters = [0.2, 0.5, 0.7, 0.5]\n"
10728     ">>> n_parameters = [30, 30, 30, 80]\n"
10729     ">>> linestyles = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dashdot']\n"
10730     ">>> parameters_list = list(zip(p_parameters, n_parameters, linestyles))\n"
10731     ">>> cdf_vals = np.linspace(0, 1, 1000)\n"
10732     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))\n"
10733     ">>> for parameter_set in parameters_list:\n"
10734     "...     p, n, style = parameter_set\n"
10735     "...     nbdtrik_vals = nbdtrik(cdf_vals, n, p)\n"
10736     "...     ax.plot(cdf_vals, nbdtrik_vals, label=rf\"$n={n},\\ p={p}$\",\n"
10737     "...             ls=style)\n"
10738     ">>> ax.legend()\n"
10739     ">>> ax.set_ylabel(\"$k$\")\n"
10740     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$CDF$\")\n"
10741     ">>> ax.set_title(\"Negative binomial percentile function\")\n"
10742     ">>> plt.show()\n"
10743     "\n"
10744     "The negative binomial distribution is also available as\n"
10745     "`scipy.stats.nbinom`. The percentile function  method ``ppf``\n"
10746     "returns the result of `nbdtrik` rounded up to integers:\n"
10747     "\n"
10748     ">>> from scipy.stats import nbinom\n"
10749     ">>> q, n, p = 0.6, 5, 0.5\n"
10750     ">>> nbinom.ppf(q, n, p), nbdtrik(q, n, p)\n"
10751     "(5.0, 4.800428460273882)")
10752 ufunc_nbdtrik_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
10753 ufunc_nbdtrik_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
10754 ufunc_nbdtrik_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10755 ufunc_nbdtrik_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10756 ufunc_nbdtrik_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10757 ufunc_nbdtrik_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10758 ufunc_nbdtrik_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10759 ufunc_nbdtrik_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10760 ufunc_nbdtrik_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10761 ufunc_nbdtrik_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10762 ufunc_nbdtrik_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_nbdtrik
10763 ufunc_nbdtrik_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtrik")
10764 ufunc_nbdtrik_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_nbdtrik
10765 ufunc_nbdtrik_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtrik")
10766 ufunc_nbdtrik_data[0] = &ufunc_nbdtrik_ptr[2*0]
10767 ufunc_nbdtrik_data[1] = &ufunc_nbdtrik_ptr[2*1]
10768 nbdtrik = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_nbdtrik_loops, ufunc_nbdtrik_data, ufunc_nbdtrik_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "nbdtrik", ufunc_nbdtrik_doc, 0)
10769 
10770 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nbdtrin_loops[2]
10771 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtrin_ptr[4]
10772 cdef void *ufunc_nbdtrin_data[2]
10773 cdef char ufunc_nbdtrin_types[8]
10774 cdef char *ufunc_nbdtrin_doc = (
10775     "nbdtrin(k, y, p, out=None)\n"
10776     "\n"
10777     "Inverse of `nbdtr` vs `n`.\n"
10778     "\n"
10779     "Returns the inverse with respect to the parameter `n` of\n"
10780     "``y = nbdtr(k, n, p)``, the negative binomial cumulative distribution\n"
10781     "function.\n"
10782     "\n"
10783     "Parameters\n"
10784     "----------\n"
10785     "k : array_like\n"
10786     "    The maximum number of allowed failures (nonnegative int).\n"
10787     "y : array_like\n"
10788     "    The probability of `k` or fewer failures before `n` successes (float).\n"
10789     "p : array_like\n"
10790     "    Probability of success in a single event (float).\n"
10791     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10792     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
10793     "\n"
10794     "Returns\n"
10795     "-------\n"
10796     "n : scalar or ndarray\n"
10797     "    The number of successes `n` such that `nbdtr(k, n, p) = y`.\n"
10798     "\n"
10799     "See Also\n"
10800     "--------\n"
10801     "nbdtr : Cumulative distribution function of the negative binomial.\n"
10802     "nbdtri : Inverse with respect to `p` of `nbdtr(k, n, p)`.\n"
10803     "nbdtrik : Inverse with respect to `k` of `nbdtr(k, n, p)`.\n"
10804     "\n"
10805     "Notes\n"
10806     "-----\n"
10807     "Wrapper for the CDFLIB [1]_ Fortran routine `cdfnbn`.\n"
10808     "\n"
10809     "Formula 26.5.26 of [2]_,\n"
10810     "\n"
10811     ".. math::\n"
10812     "    \\sum_{j=k + 1}^\\infty {{n + j - 1}\n"
10813     "    \\choose{j}} p^n (1 - p)^j = I_{1 - p}(k + 1, n),\n"
10814     "\n"
10815     "is used to reduce calculation of the cumulative distribution function to\n"
10816     "that of a regularized incomplete beta :math:`I`.\n"
10817     "\n"
10818     "Computation of `n` involves a search for a value that produces the desired\n"
10819     "value of `y`.  The search relies on the monotonicity of `y` with `n`.\n"
10820     "\n"
10821     "References\n"
10822     "----------\n"
10823     ".. [1] Barry Brown, James Lovato, and Kathy Russell,\n"
10824     "       CDFLIB: Library of Fortran Routines for Cumulative Distribution\n"
10825     "       Functions, Inverses, and Other Parameters.\n"
10826     ".. [2] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
10827     "       Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
10828     "       Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.\n"
10829     "\n"
10830     "Examples\n"
10831     "--------\n"
10832     "Compute the negative binomial cumulative distribution function for an\n"
10833     "exemplary parameter set.\n"
10834     "\n"
10835     ">>> from scipy.special import nbdtr, nbdtrin\n"
10836     ">>> k, n, p = 5, 2, 0.5\n"
10837     ">>> cdf_value = nbdtr(k, n, p)\n"
10838     ">>> cdf_value\n"
10839     "0.9375\n"
10840     "\n"
10841     "Verify that `nbdtrin` recovers the original value for `n` up to floating\n"
10842     "point accuracy.\n"
10843     "\n"
10844     ">>> nbdtrin(k, cdf_value, p)\n"
10845     "1.999999999998137")
10846 ufunc_nbdtrin_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
10847 ufunc_nbdtrin_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
10848 ufunc_nbdtrin_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10849 ufunc_nbdtrin_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10850 ufunc_nbdtrin_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10851 ufunc_nbdtrin_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10852 ufunc_nbdtrin_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10853 ufunc_nbdtrin_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10854 ufunc_nbdtrin_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10855 ufunc_nbdtrin_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10856 ufunc_nbdtrin_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_nbdtrin
10857 ufunc_nbdtrin_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtrin")
10858 ufunc_nbdtrin_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_nbdtrin
10859 ufunc_nbdtrin_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nbdtrin")
10860 ufunc_nbdtrin_data[0] = &ufunc_nbdtrin_ptr[2*0]
10861 ufunc_nbdtrin_data[1] = &ufunc_nbdtrin_ptr[2*1]
10862 nbdtrin = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_nbdtrin_loops, ufunc_nbdtrin_data, ufunc_nbdtrin_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "nbdtrin", ufunc_nbdtrin_doc, 0)
10863 
10864 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_ncfdtr_loops[2]
10865 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtr_ptr[4]
10866 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtr_data[2]
10867 cdef char ufunc_ncfdtr_types[10]
10868 cdef char *ufunc_ncfdtr_doc = (
10869     "ncfdtr(dfn, dfd, nc, f, out=None)\n"
10870     "\n"
10871     "Cumulative distribution function of the non-central F distribution.\n"
10872     "\n"
10873     "The non-central F describes the distribution of,\n"
10874     "\n"
10875     ".. math::\n"
10876     "    Z = \\frac{X/d_n}{Y/d_d}\n"
10877     "\n"
10878     "where :math:`X` and :math:`Y` are independently distributed, with\n"
10879     ":math:`X` distributed non-central :math:`\\chi^2` with noncentrality\n"
10880     "parameter `nc` and :math:`d_n` degrees of freedom, and :math:`Y`\n"
10881     "distributed :math:`\\chi^2` with :math:`d_d` degrees of freedom.\n"
10882     "\n"
10883     "Parameters\n"
10884     "----------\n"
10885     "dfn : array_like\n"
10886     "    Degrees of freedom of the numerator sum of squares.  Range (0, inf).\n"
10887     "dfd : array_like\n"
10888     "    Degrees of freedom of the denominator sum of squares.  Range (0, inf).\n"
10889     "nc : array_like\n"
10890     "    Noncentrality parameter.  Range [0, inf).\n"
10891     "f : array_like\n"
10892     "    Quantiles, i.e. the upper limit of integration.\n"
10893     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
10894     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
10895     "\n"
10896     "Returns\n"
10897     "-------\n"
10898     "cdf : scalar or ndarray\n"
10899     "    The calculated CDF.  If all inputs are scalar, the return will be a\n"
10900     "    float.  Otherwise it will be an array.\n"
10901     "\n"
10902     "See Also\n"
10903     "--------\n"
10904     "ncfdtri : Quantile function; inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `f`.\n"
10905     "ncfdtridfd : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `dfd`.\n"
10906     "ncfdtridfn : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `dfn`.\n"
10907     "ncfdtrinc : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `nc`.\n"
10908     "scipy.stats.ncf : Non-central F distribution.\n"
10909     "\n"
10910     "Notes\n"
10911     "-----\n"
10912     "This function calculates the CDF of the non-central f distribution using\n"
10913     "the Boost Math C++ library [1]_.\n"
10914     "\n"
10915     "The cumulative distribution function is computed using Formula 26.6.20 of\n"
10916     "[2]_:\n"
10917     "\n"
10918     ".. math::\n"
10919     "    F(d_n, d_d, n_c, f) = \\sum_{j=0}^\\infty e^{-n_c/2}\n"
10920     "    \\frac{(n_c/2)^j}{j!} I_{x}(\\frac{d_n}{2} + j, \\frac{d_d}{2}),\n"
10921     "\n"
10922     "where :math:`I` is the regularized incomplete beta function, and\n"
10923     ":math:`x = f d_n/(f d_n + d_d)`.\n"
10924     "\n"
10925     "Note that argument order of `ncfdtr` is different from that of the\n"
10926     "similar ``cdf`` method of `scipy.stats.ncf`: `f` is the last\n"
10927     "parameter of `ncfdtr` but the first parameter of ``scipy.stats.ncf.cdf``.\n"
10928     "\n"
10929     "References\n"
10930     "----------\n"
10931     ".. [1] The Boost Developers. \"Boost C++ Libraries\". https://www.boost.org/.\n"
10932     ".. [2] Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun, eds.\n"
10933     "       Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas,\n"
10934     "       Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. New York: Dover, 1972.\n"
10935     "\n"
10936     "Examples\n"
10937     "--------\n"
10938     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
10939     ">>> from scipy import special\n"
10940     ">>> from scipy import stats\n"
10941     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
10942     "\n"
10943     "Plot the CDF of the non-central F distribution, for nc=0.  Compare with the\n"
10944     "F-distribution from scipy.stats:\n"
10945     "\n"
10946     ">>> x = np.linspace(-1, 8, num=500)\n"
10947     ">>> dfn = 3\n"
10948     ">>> dfd = 2\n"
10949     ">>> ncf_stats = stats.f.cdf(x, dfn, dfd)\n"
10950     ">>> ncf_special = special.ncfdtr(dfn, dfd, 0, x)\n"
10951     "\n"
10952     ">>> fig = plt.figure()\n"
10953     ">>> ax = fig.add_subplot(111)\n"
10954     ">>> ax.plot(x, ncf_stats, 'b-', lw=3)\n"
10955     ">>> ax.plot(x, ncf_special, 'r-')\n"
10956     ">>> plt.show()")
10957 ufunc_ncfdtr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_f_ffff__As_ffff_f
10958 ufunc_ncfdtr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_dddd_d
10959 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10960 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10961 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10962 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10963 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
10964 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10965 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10966 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10967 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10968 ufunc_ncfdtr_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
10969 ufunc_ncfdtr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_ncf_cdf_float
10970 ufunc_ncfdtr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtr")
10971 ufunc_ncfdtr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_ncf_cdf_double
10972 ufunc_ncfdtr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtr")
10973 ufunc_ncfdtr_data[0] = &ufunc_ncfdtr_ptr[2*0]
10974 ufunc_ncfdtr_data[1] = &ufunc_ncfdtr_ptr[2*1]
10975 ncfdtr = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_ncfdtr_loops, ufunc_ncfdtr_data, ufunc_ncfdtr_types, 2, 4, 1, 0, "ncfdtr", ufunc_ncfdtr_doc, 0)
10976 
10977 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_ncfdtri_loops[2]
10978 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtri_ptr[4]
10979 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtri_data[2]
10980 cdef char ufunc_ncfdtri_types[10]
10981 cdef char *ufunc_ncfdtri_doc = (
10982     "ncfdtri(dfn, dfd, nc, p, out=None)\n"
10983     "\n"
10984     "Inverse with respect to `f` of the CDF of the non-central F distribution.\n"
10985     "\n"
10986     "See `ncfdtr` for more details.\n"
10987     "\n"
10988     "Parameters\n"
10989     "----------\n"
10990     "dfn : array_like\n"
10991     "    Degrees of freedom of the numerator sum of squares.  Range (0, inf).\n"
10992     "dfd : array_like\n"
10993     "    Degrees of freedom of the denominator sum of squares.  Range (0, inf).\n"
10994     "nc : array_like\n"
10995     "    Noncentrality parameter.  Range [0, inf).\n"
10996     "p : array_like\n"
10997     "    Value of the cumulative distribution function.  Must be in the\n"
10998     "    range [0, 1].\n"
10999     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11000     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11001     "\n"
11002     "Returns\n"
11003     "-------\n"
11004     "f : scalar or ndarray\n"
11005     "    Quantiles, i.e., the upper limit of integration.\n"
11006     "\n"
11007     "See Also\n"
11008     "--------\n"
11009     "ncfdtr : CDF of the non-central F distribution.\n"
11010     "ncfdtridfd : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `dfd`.\n"
11011     "ncfdtridfn : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `dfn`.\n"
11012     "ncfdtrinc : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `nc`.\n"
11013     "scipy.stats.ncf : Non-central F distribution.\n"
11014     "\n"
11015     "Notes\n"
11016     "-----\n"
11017     "This function calculates the Quantile of the non-central f distribution\n"
11018     "using the Boost Math C++ library [1]_.\n"
11019     "\n"
11020     "Note that argument order of `ncfdtri` is different from that of the\n"
11021     "similar ``ppf`` method of `scipy.stats.ncf`. `p` is the last parameter\n"
11022     "of `ncfdtri` but the first parameter of ``scipy.stats.ncf.ppf``.\n"
11023     "\n"
11024     "References\n"
11025     "----------\n"
11026     ".. [1] The Boost Developers. \"Boost C++ Libraries\". https://www.boost.org/.\n"
11027     "\n"
11028     "Examples\n"
11029     "--------\n"
11030     ">>> from scipy.special import ncfdtr, ncfdtri\n"
11031     "\n"
11032     "Compute the CDF for several values of `f`:\n"
11033     "\n"
11034     ">>> f = [0.5, 1, 1.5]\n"
11035     ">>> p = ncfdtr(2, 3, 1.5, f)\n"
11036     ">>> p\n"
11037     "array([ 0.20782291,  0.36107392,  0.47345752])\n"
11038     "\n"
11039     "Compute the inverse.  We recover the values of `f`, as expected:\n"
11040     "\n"
11041     ">>> ncfdtri(2, 3, 1.5, p)\n"
11042     "array([ 0.5,  1. ,  1.5])")
11043 ufunc_ncfdtri_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_f_ffff__As_ffff_f
11044 ufunc_ncfdtri_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_dddd_d
11045 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11046 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11047 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11048 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11049 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11050 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11051 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11052 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11053 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11054 ufunc_ncfdtri_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11055 ufunc_ncfdtri_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_ncf_ppf_float
11056 ufunc_ncfdtri_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtri")
11057 ufunc_ncfdtri_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_ncf_ppf_double
11058 ufunc_ncfdtri_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtri")
11059 ufunc_ncfdtri_data[0] = &ufunc_ncfdtri_ptr[2*0]
11060 ufunc_ncfdtri_data[1] = &ufunc_ncfdtri_ptr[2*1]
11061 ncfdtri = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_ncfdtri_loops, ufunc_ncfdtri_data, ufunc_ncfdtri_types, 2, 4, 1, 0, "ncfdtri", ufunc_ncfdtri_doc, 0)
11062 
11063 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_ncfdtridfd_loops[2]
11064 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtridfd_ptr[4]
11065 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtridfd_data[2]
11066 cdef char ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[10]
11067 cdef char *ufunc_ncfdtridfd_doc = (
11068     "ncfdtridfd(dfn, p, nc, f, out=None)\n"
11069     "\n"
11070     "Calculate degrees of freedom (denominator) for the noncentral F-distribution.\n"
11071     "\n"
11072     "This is the inverse with respect to `dfd` of `ncfdtr`.\n"
11073     "See `ncfdtr` for more details.\n"
11074     "\n"
11075     "Parameters\n"
11076     "----------\n"
11077     "dfn : array_like\n"
11078     "    Degrees of freedom of the numerator sum of squares.  Range (0, inf).\n"
11079     "p : array_like\n"
11080     "    Value of the cumulative distribution function.  Must be in the\n"
11081     "    range [0, 1].\n"
11082     "nc : array_like\n"
11083     "    Noncentrality parameter.  Should be in range (0, 1e4).\n"
11084     "f : array_like\n"
11085     "    Quantiles, i.e., the upper limit of integration.\n"
11086     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11087     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11088     "\n"
11089     "Returns\n"
11090     "-------\n"
11091     "dfd : scalar or ndarray\n"
11092     "    Degrees of freedom of the denominator sum of squares.\n"
11093     "\n"
11094     "See Also\n"
11095     "--------\n"
11096     "ncfdtr : CDF of the non-central F distribution.\n"
11097     "ncfdtri : Quantile function; inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `f`.\n"
11098     "ncfdtridfn : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `dfn`.\n"
11099     "ncfdtrinc : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `nc`.\n"
11100     "\n"
11101     "Notes\n"
11102     "-----\n"
11103     "The value of the cumulative noncentral F distribution is not necessarily\n"
11104     "monotone in either degrees of freedom. There thus may be two values that\n"
11105     "provide a given CDF value. This routine assumes monotonicity and will\n"
11106     "find an arbitrary one of the two values.\n"
11107     "\n"
11108     "Examples\n"
11109     "--------\n"
11110     ">>> from scipy.special import ncfdtr, ncfdtridfd\n"
11111     "\n"
11112     "Compute the CDF for several values of `dfd`:\n"
11113     "\n"
11114     ">>> dfd = [1, 2, 3]\n"
11115     ">>> p = ncfdtr(2, dfd, 0.25, 15)\n"
11116     ">>> p\n"
11117     "array([ 0.8097138 ,  0.93020416,  0.96787852])\n"
11118     "\n"
11119     "Compute the inverse.  We recover the values of `dfd`, as expected:\n"
11120     "\n"
11121     ">>> ncfdtridfd(2, p, 0.25, 15)\n"
11122     "array([ 1.,  2.,  3.])")
11123 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_ffff_f
11124 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_dddd_d
11125 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11126 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11127 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11128 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11129 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11130 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11131 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11132 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11133 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11134 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11135 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_ncfdtridfd
11136 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtridfd")
11137 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_ncfdtridfd
11138 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtridfd")
11139 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_data[0] = &ufunc_ncfdtridfd_ptr[2*0]
11140 ufunc_ncfdtridfd_data[1] = &ufunc_ncfdtridfd_ptr[2*1]
11141 ncfdtridfd = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_ncfdtridfd_loops, ufunc_ncfdtridfd_data, ufunc_ncfdtridfd_types, 2, 4, 1, 0, "ncfdtridfd", ufunc_ncfdtridfd_doc, 0)
11142 
11143 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_ncfdtridfn_loops[2]
11144 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtridfn_ptr[4]
11145 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtridfn_data[2]
11146 cdef char ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[10]
11147 cdef char *ufunc_ncfdtridfn_doc = (
11148     "ncfdtridfn(p, dfd, nc, f, out=None)\n"
11149     "\n"
11150     "Calculate degrees of freedom (numerator) for the noncentral F-distribution.\n"
11151     "\n"
11152     "This is the inverse with respect to `dfn` of `ncfdtr`.\n"
11153     "See `ncfdtr` for more details.\n"
11154     "\n"
11155     "Parameters\n"
11156     "----------\n"
11157     "p : array_like\n"
11158     "    Value of the cumulative distribution function. Must be in the\n"
11159     "    range [0, 1].\n"
11160     "dfd : array_like\n"
11161     "    Degrees of freedom of the denominator sum of squares. Range (0, inf).\n"
11162     "nc : array_like\n"
11163     "    Noncentrality parameter.  Should be in range (0, 1e4).\n"
11164     "f : float\n"
11165     "    Quantiles, i.e., the upper limit of integration.\n"
11166     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11167     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11168     "\n"
11169     "Returns\n"
11170     "-------\n"
11171     "dfn : scalar or ndarray\n"
11172     "    Degrees of freedom of the numerator sum of squares.\n"
11173     "\n"
11174     "See Also\n"
11175     "--------\n"
11176     "ncfdtr : CDF of the non-central F distribution.\n"
11177     "ncfdtri : Quantile function; inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `f`.\n"
11178     "ncfdtridfd : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `dfd`.\n"
11179     "ncfdtrinc : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `nc`.\n"
11180     "\n"
11181     "Notes\n"
11182     "-----\n"
11183     "The value of the cumulative noncentral F distribution is not necessarily\n"
11184     "monotone in either degrees of freedom. There thus may be two values that\n"
11185     "provide a given CDF value. This routine assumes monotonicity and will\n"
11186     "find an arbitrary one of the two values.\n"
11187     "\n"
11188     "Examples\n"
11189     "--------\n"
11190     ">>> from scipy.special import ncfdtr, ncfdtridfn\n"
11191     "\n"
11192     "Compute the CDF for several values of `dfn`:\n"
11193     "\n"
11194     ">>> dfn = [1, 2, 3]\n"
11195     ">>> p = ncfdtr(dfn, 2, 0.25, 15)\n"
11196     ">>> p\n"
11197     "array([ 0.92562363,  0.93020416,  0.93188394])\n"
11198     "\n"
11199     "Compute the inverse. We recover the values of `dfn`, as expected:\n"
11200     "\n"
11201     ">>> ncfdtridfn(p, 2, 0.25, 15)\n"
11202     "array([ 1.,  2.,  3.])")
11203 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_ffff_f
11204 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_dddd_d
11205 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11206 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11207 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11208 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11209 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11210 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11211 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11212 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11213 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11214 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11215 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_ncfdtridfn
11216 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtridfn")
11217 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_ncfdtridfn
11218 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtridfn")
11219 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_data[0] = &ufunc_ncfdtridfn_ptr[2*0]
11220 ufunc_ncfdtridfn_data[1] = &ufunc_ncfdtridfn_ptr[2*1]
11221 ncfdtridfn = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_ncfdtridfn_loops, ufunc_ncfdtridfn_data, ufunc_ncfdtridfn_types, 2, 4, 1, 0, "ncfdtridfn", ufunc_ncfdtridfn_doc, 0)
11222 
11223 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_ncfdtrinc_loops[2]
11224 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtrinc_ptr[4]
11225 cdef void *ufunc_ncfdtrinc_data[2]
11226 cdef char ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[10]
11227 cdef char *ufunc_ncfdtrinc_doc = (
11228     "ncfdtrinc(dfn, dfd, p, f, out=None)\n"
11229     "\n"
11230     "Calculate non-centrality parameter for non-central F distribution.\n"
11231     "\n"
11232     "This is the inverse with respect to `nc` of `ncfdtr`.\n"
11233     "See `ncfdtr` for more details.\n"
11234     "\n"
11235     "Parameters\n"
11236     "----------\n"
11237     "dfn : array_like\n"
11238     "    Degrees of freedom of the numerator sum of squares. Range (0, inf).\n"
11239     "dfd : array_like\n"
11240     "    Degrees of freedom of the denominator sum of squares. Range (0, inf).\n"
11241     "p : array_like\n"
11242     "    Value of the cumulative distribution function. Must be in the\n"
11243     "    range [0, 1].\n"
11244     "f : array_like\n"
11245     "    Quantiles, i.e., the upper limit of integration.\n"
11246     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11247     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11248     "\n"
11249     "Returns\n"
11250     "-------\n"
11251     "nc : scalar or ndarray\n"
11252     "    Noncentrality parameter.\n"
11253     "\n"
11254     "See Also\n"
11255     "--------\n"
11256     "ncfdtr : CDF of the non-central F distribution.\n"
11257     "ncfdtri : Quantile function; inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `f`.\n"
11258     "ncfdtridfd : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `dfd`.\n"
11259     "ncfdtridfn : Inverse of `ncfdtr` with respect to `dfn`.\n"
11260     "\n"
11261     "Examples\n"
11262     "--------\n"
11263     ">>> from scipy.special import ncfdtr, ncfdtrinc\n"
11264     "\n"
11265     "Compute the CDF for several values of `nc`:\n"
11266     "\n"
11267     ">>> nc = [0.5, 1.5, 2.0]\n"
11268     ">>> p = ncfdtr(2, 3, nc, 15)\n"
11269     ">>> p\n"
11270     "array([ 0.96309246,  0.94327955,  0.93304098])\n"
11271     "\n"
11272     "Compute the inverse. We recover the values of `nc`, as expected:\n"
11273     "\n"
11274     ">>> ncfdtrinc(2, 3, p, 15)\n"
11275     "array([ 0.5,  1.5,  2. ])")
11276 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_ffff_f
11277 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dddd__As_dddd_d
11278 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11279 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11280 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11281 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11282 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11283 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11284 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11285 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11286 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11287 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types[9] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11288 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_ncfdtrinc
11289 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtrinc")
11290 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_ncfdtrinc
11291 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ncfdtrinc")
11292 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_data[0] = &ufunc_ncfdtrinc_ptr[2*0]
11293 ufunc_ncfdtrinc_data[1] = &ufunc_ncfdtrinc_ptr[2*1]
11294 ncfdtrinc = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_ncfdtrinc_loops, ufunc_ncfdtrinc_data, ufunc_ncfdtrinc_types, 2, 4, 1, 0, "ncfdtrinc", ufunc_ncfdtrinc_doc, 0)
11295 
11296 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nctdtr_loops[2]
11297 cdef void *ufunc_nctdtr_ptr[4]
11298 cdef void *ufunc_nctdtr_data[2]
11299 cdef char ufunc_nctdtr_types[8]
11300 cdef char *ufunc_nctdtr_doc = (
11301     "nctdtr(df, nc, t, out=None)\n"
11302     "\n"
11303     "Cumulative distribution function of the non-central `t` distribution.\n"
11304     "\n"
11305     "Parameters\n"
11306     "----------\n"
11307     "df : array_like\n"
11308     "    Degrees of freedom of the distribution. Should be in range (0, inf).\n"
11309     "nc : array_like\n"
11310     "    Noncentrality parameter.\n"
11311     "t : array_like\n"
11312     "    Quantiles, i.e., the upper limit of integration.\n"
11313     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11314     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11315     "\n"
11316     "Returns\n"
11317     "-------\n"
11318     "cdf : scalar or ndarray\n"
11319     "    The calculated CDF. If all inputs are scalar, the return will be a\n"
11320     "    float. Otherwise, it will be an array.\n"
11321     "\n"
11322     "See Also\n"
11323     "--------\n"
11324     "nctdtrit : Inverse CDF (iCDF) of the non-central t distribution.\n"
11325     "nctdtridf : Calculate degrees of freedom, given CDF and iCDF values.\n"
11326     "nctdtrinc : Calculate non-centrality parameter, given CDF iCDF values.\n"
11327     "\n"
11328     "Notes\n"
11329     "-----\n"
11330     "This function calculates the CDF of the non-central t distribution using\n"
11331     "the Boost Math C++ library [1]_.\n"
11332     "\n"
11333     "Note that the argument order of `nctdtr` is different from that of the\n"
11334     "similar ``cdf`` method of `scipy.stats.nct`: `t` is the last\n"
11335     "parameter of `nctdtr` but the first parameter of ``scipy.stats.nct.cdf``.\n"
11336     "\n"
11337     "References\n"
11338     "----------\n"
11339     ".. [1] The Boost Developers. \"Boost C++ Libraries\". https://www.boost.org/.\n"
11340     "\n"
11341     "Examples\n"
11342     "--------\n"
11343     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
11344     ">>> from scipy import special\n"
11345     ">>> from scipy import stats\n"
11346     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
11347     "\n"
11348     "Plot the CDF of the non-central t distribution, for nc=0. Compare with the\n"
11349     "t-distribution from scipy.stats:\n"
11350     "\n"
11351     ">>> x = np.linspace(-5, 5, num=500)\n"
11352     ">>> df = 3\n"
11353     ">>> nct_stats = stats.t.cdf(x, df)\n"
11354     ">>> nct_special = special.nctdtr(df, 0, x)\n"
11355     "\n"
11356     ">>> fig = plt.figure()\n"
11357     ">>> ax = fig.add_subplot(111)\n"
11358     ">>> ax.plot(x, nct_stats, 'b-', lw=3)\n"
11359     ">>> ax.plot(x, nct_special, 'r-')\n"
11360     ">>> plt.show()")
11361 ufunc_nctdtr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_f_fff__As_fff_f
11362 ufunc_nctdtr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
11363 ufunc_nctdtr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11364 ufunc_nctdtr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11365 ufunc_nctdtr_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11366 ufunc_nctdtr_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11367 ufunc_nctdtr_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11368 ufunc_nctdtr_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11369 ufunc_nctdtr_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11370 ufunc_nctdtr_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11371 ufunc_nctdtr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_nct_cdf_float
11372 ufunc_nctdtr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nctdtr")
11373 ufunc_nctdtr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_nct_cdf_double
11374 ufunc_nctdtr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nctdtr")
11375 ufunc_nctdtr_data[0] = &ufunc_nctdtr_ptr[2*0]
11376 ufunc_nctdtr_data[1] = &ufunc_nctdtr_ptr[2*1]
11377 nctdtr = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_nctdtr_loops, ufunc_nctdtr_data, ufunc_nctdtr_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "nctdtr", ufunc_nctdtr_doc, 0)

11379 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nctdtridf_loops[2]
11380 cdef void *ufunc_nctdtridf_ptr[4]
11381 cdef void *ufunc_nctdtridf_data[2]
11382 cdef char ufunc_nctdtridf_types[8]
11383 cdef char *ufunc_nctdtridf_doc = (
11384     "nctdtridf(p, nc, t, out=None)\n"
11385     "\n"
11386     "Calculate degrees of freedom for non-central t distribution.\n"
11387     "\n"
11388     "See `nctdtr` for more details.\n"
11389     "\n"
11390     "Parameters\n"
11391     "----------\n"
11392     "p : array_like\n"
11393     "    CDF values, in range (0, 1].\n"
11394     "nc : array_like\n"
11395     "    Noncentrality parameter. Should be in range (-1e6, 1e6).\n"
11396     "t : array_like\n"
11397     "    Quantiles, i.e., the upper limit of integration.\n"
11398     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11399     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11400     "\n"
11401     "Returns\n"
11402     "-------\n"
11403     "df : scalar or ndarray\n"
11404     "    The degrees of freedom. If all inputs are scalar, the return will be a\n"
11405     "    float. Otherwise, it will be an array.\n"
11406     "\n"
11407     "See Also\n"
11408     "--------\n"
11409     "nctdtr :  CDF of the non-central `t` distribution.\n"
11410     "nctdtrit : Inverse CDF (iCDF) of the non-central t distribution.\n"
11411     "nctdtrinc : Calculate non-centrality parameter, given CDF iCDF values.\n"
11412     "\n"
11413     "Examples\n"
11414     "--------\n"
11415     ">>> from scipy.special import nctdtr, nctdtridf\n"
11416     "\n"
11417     "Compute the CDF for several values of `df`:\n"
11418     "\n"
11419     ">>> df = [1, 2, 3]\n"
11420     ">>> p = nctdtr(df, 0.25, 1)\n"
11421     ">>> p\n"
11422     "array([0.67491974, 0.716464  , 0.73349456])\n"
11423     "\n"
11424     "Compute the inverse. We recover the values of `df`, as expected:\n"
11425     "\n"
11426     ">>> nctdtridf(p, 0.25, 1)\n"
11427     "array([1., 2., 3.])")

11454     "\n"

11456     "\n"
11457     "Parameters\n"
11458     "----------\n"
11459     "df : array_like\n"
11460     "    Degrees of freedom of the distribution. Should be in range (0, inf).\n"
11461     "p : array_like\n"
11462     "    CDF values, in range (0, 1].\n"
11463     "t : array_like\n"
11464     "    Quantiles, i.e., the upper limit of integration.\n"

11466     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"

11485     ">>> nc = [0.5, 1.5, 2.5]\n"
11486     ">>> p = nctdtr(3, nc, 1.5)\n"
11487     ">>> p\n"
11488     "array([0.77569497, 0.45524533, 0.1668691 ])\n"
11489     "\n"
11490     "Compute the inverse. We recover the values of `nc`, as expected:\n"
11491     "\n"
11492     ">>> nctdtrinc(3, p, 1.5)\n"
11493     "array([0.5, 1.5, 2.5])")

11518     "\n"
11519     "Inverse cumulative distribution function of the non-central t distribution.\n"
11520     "\n"
11521     "See `nctdtr` for more details.\n"
11522     "\n"
11523     "Parameters\n"
11524     "----------\n"
11525     "df : array_like\n"
11526     "    Degrees of freedom of the distribution. Should be in range (0, inf).\n"
11527     "nc : array_like\n"
11528     "    Noncentrality parameter. Should be in range (-1e6, 1e6).\n"
11529     "p : array_like\n"
11530     "    CDF values, in range (0, 1].\n"
11531     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11532     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11533     "\n"
11534     "Returns\n"

11537     "    Quantiles\n"
11538     "\n"
11539     "See Also\n"

11542     "nctdtridf : Calculate degrees of freedom, given CDF and iCDF values.\n"
11543     "nctdtrinc : Calculate non-centrality parameter, given CDF iCDF values.\n"
11544     "\n"

11546     "--------\n"
11547     ">>> from scipy.special import nctdtr, nctdtrit\n"
11548     "\n"
11549     "Compute the CDF for several values of `t`:\n"
11550     "\n"
11551     ">>> t = [0.5, 1, 1.5]\n"
11552     ">>> p = nctdtr(3, 1, t)\n"
11553     ">>> p\n"
11554     "array([0.29811049, 0.46922687, 0.6257559 ])\n"
11555     "\n"
11556     "Compute the inverse. We recover the values of `t`, as expected:\n"
11557     "\n"
11558     ">>> nctdtrit(3, 1, p)\n"
11559     "array([0.5, 1. , 1.5])")

11578 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_ndtr_loops[4]
11579 cdef void *ufunc_ndtr_ptr[8]
11580 cdef void *ufunc_ndtr_data[4]
11581 cdef char ufunc_ndtr_types[8]
11582 cdef char *ufunc_ndtr_doc = (
11583     "ndtr(x, out=None)\n"
11584     "\n"
11585     "Cumulative distribution of the standard normal distribution.\n"
11586     "\n"
11587     "Returns the area under the standard Gaussian probability\n"
11588     "density function, integrated from minus infinity to `x`\n"
11589     "\n"
11590     ".. math::\n"
11591     "\n"
11592     "   \\frac{1}{\\sqrt{2\\pi}} \\int_{-\\infty}^x \\exp(-t^2/2) dt\n"
11593     "\n"
11594     "Parameters\n"
11595     "----------\n"
11596     "x : array_like, real or complex\n"
11597     "    Argument\n"
11598     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11599     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11600     "\n"
11601     "Returns\n"
11602     "-------\n"
11603     "scalar or ndarray\n"
11604     "    The value of the normal CDF evaluated at `x`\n"
11605     "\n"
11606     "See Also\n"
11607     "--------\n"
11608     "log_ndtr : Logarithm of ndtr\n"
11609     "ndtri : Inverse of ndtr, standard normal percentile function\n"
11610     "erf : Error function\n"
11611     "erfc : 1 - erf\n"
11612     "scipy.stats.norm : Normal distribution\n"
11613     "\n"
11614     "Examples\n"
11615     "--------\n"
11616     "Evaluate `ndtr` at one point.\n"
11617     "\n"
11618     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
11619     ">>> from scipy.special import ndtr\n"
11620     ">>> ndtr(0.5)\n"
11621     "0.6914624612740131\n"
11622     "\n"
11623     "Evaluate the function at several points by providing a NumPy array\n"
11624     "or list for `x`.\n"
11625     "\n"
11626     ">>> ndtr([0, 0.5, 2])\n"
11627     "array([0.5       , 0.69146246, 0.97724987])\n"
11628     "\n"
11629     "Plot the function.\n"
11630     "\n"
11631     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
11632     ">>> x = np.linspace(-5, 5, 100)\n"
11633     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
11634     ">>> ax.plot(x, ndtr(x))\n"
11635     ">>> ax.set_title(r\"Standard normal cumulative distribution function $\\Phi$\")\n"
11636     ">>> plt.show()")
11637 ufunc_ndtr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
11638 ufunc_ndtr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
11639 ufunc_ndtr_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_F_F
11640 ufunc_ndtr_loops[3] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_D_D__As_D_D
11641 ufunc_ndtr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11642 ufunc_ndtr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11643 ufunc_ndtr_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11644 ufunc_ndtr_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11645 ufunc_ndtr_types[4] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
11646 ufunc_ndtr_types[5] = <char>NPY_CFLOAT
11647 ufunc_ndtr_types[6] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
11648 ufunc_ndtr_types[7] = <char>NPY_CDOUBLE
11649 ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_ndtr
11650 ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ndtr")
11651 ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_ndtr
11652 ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ndtr")
11653 ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*2] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_ndtr
11654 ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ndtr")
11655 ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*3] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_faddeeva_ndtr
11656 ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*3+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ndtr")
11657 ufunc_ndtr_data[0] = &ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*0]
11658 ufunc_ndtr_data[1] = &ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*1]
11659 ufunc_ndtr_data[2] = &ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*2]
11660 ufunc_ndtr_data[3] = &ufunc_ndtr_ptr[2*3]
11661 ndtr = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_ndtr_loops, ufunc_ndtr_data, ufunc_ndtr_types, 4, 1, 1, 0, "ndtr", ufunc_ndtr_doc, 0)
11662 
11663 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_ndtri_loops[2]
11664 cdef void *ufunc_ndtri_ptr[4]
11665 cdef void *ufunc_ndtri_data[2]
11666 cdef char ufunc_ndtri_types[4]
11667 cdef char *ufunc_ndtri_doc = (
11668     "ndtri(y, out=None)\n"
11669     "\n"
11670     "Inverse of `ndtr` vs x\n"
11671     "\n"
11672     "Returns the argument x for which the area under the standard normal\n"
11673     "probability density function (integrated from minus infinity to `x`)\n"
11674     "is equal to y.\n"
11675     "\n"
11676     "Parameters\n"
11677     "----------\n"
11678     "p : array_like\n"
11679     "    Probability\n"
11680     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11681     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11682     "\n"
11683     "Returns\n"
11684     "-------\n"
11685     "x : scalar or ndarray\n"
11686     "    Value of x such that ``ndtr(x) == p``.\n"
11687     "\n"
11688     "See Also\n"
11689     "--------\n"
11690     "ndtr : Standard normal cumulative probability distribution\n"
11691     "ndtri_exp : Inverse of log_ndtr\n"
11692     "\n"
11693     "Examples\n"
11694     "--------\n"
11695     "`ndtri` is the percentile function of the standard normal distribution.\n"
11696     "This means it returns the inverse of the cumulative density `ndtr`. First,\n"
11697     "let us compute a cumulative density value.\n"
11698     "\n"
11699     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
11700     ">>> from scipy.special import ndtri, ndtr\n"
11701     ">>> cdf_val = ndtr(2)\n"
11702     ">>> cdf_val\n"
11703     "0.9772498680518208\n"
11704     "\n"
11705     "Verify that `ndtri` yields the original value for `x` up to floating point\n"
11706     "errors.\n"
11707     "\n"
11708     ">>> ndtri(cdf_val)\n"
11709     "2.0000000000000004\n"
11710     "\n"
11711     "Plot the function. For that purpose, we provide a NumPy array as argument.\n"
11712     "\n"
11713     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
11714     ">>> x = np.linspace(0.01, 1, 200)\n"
11715     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
11716     ">>> ax.plot(x, ndtri(x))\n"
11717     ">>> ax.set_title(\"Standard normal percentile function\")\n"
11718     ">>> plt.show()")
11719 ufunc_ndtri_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
11720 ufunc_ndtri_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
11721 ufunc_ndtri_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11722 ufunc_ndtri_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11723 ufunc_ndtri_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11724 ufunc_ndtri_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11725 ufunc_ndtri_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_ndtri
11726 ufunc_ndtri_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ndtri")
11727 ufunc_ndtri_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_ndtri
11728 ufunc_ndtri_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ndtri")
11729 ufunc_ndtri_data[0] = &ufunc_ndtri_ptr[2*0]
11730 ufunc_ndtri_data[1] = &ufunc_ndtri_ptr[2*1]
11731 ndtri = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_ndtri_loops, ufunc_ndtri_data, ufunc_ndtri_types, 2, 1, 1, 0, "ndtri", ufunc_ndtri_doc, 0)
11732 
11733 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_ndtri_exp_loops[2]
11734 cdef void *ufunc_ndtri_exp_ptr[4]
11735 cdef void *ufunc_ndtri_exp_data[2]
11736 cdef char ufunc_ndtri_exp_types[4]
11737 cdef char *ufunc_ndtri_exp_doc = (
11738     "ndtri_exp(y, out=None)\n"
11739     "\n"
11740     "Inverse of `log_ndtr` vs x. Allows for greater precision than\n"
11741     "`ndtri` composed with `numpy.exp` for very small values of y and for\n"
11742     "y close to 0.\n"
11743     "\n"
11744     "Parameters\n"
11745     "----------\n"
11746     "y : array_like of float\n"
11747     "    Function argument\n"
11748     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11749     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11750     "\n"
11751     "Returns\n"
11752     "-------\n"
11753     "scalar or ndarray\n"
11754     "    Inverse of the log CDF of the standard normal distribution, evaluated\n"
11755     "    at y.\n"
11756     "\n"
11757     "See Also\n"
11758     "--------\n"
11759     "log_ndtr : log of the standard normal cumulative distribution function\n"
11760     "ndtr : standard normal cumulative distribution function\n"
11761     "ndtri : standard normal percentile function\n"
11762     "\n"
11763     "Examples\n"
11764     "--------\n"
11765     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
11766     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
11767     "\n"
11768     "`ndtri_exp` agrees with the naive implementation when the latter does\n"
11769     "not suffer from underflow.\n"
11770     "\n"
11771     ">>> sc.ndtri_exp(-1)\n"
11772     "-0.33747496376420244\n"
11773     ">>> sc.ndtri(np.exp(-1))\n"
11774     "-0.33747496376420244\n"
11775     "\n"
11776     "For extreme values of y, the naive approach fails\n"
11777     "\n"
11778     ">>> sc.ndtri(np.exp(-800))\n"
11779     "-inf\n"
11780     ">>> sc.ndtri(np.exp(-1e-20))\n"
11781     "inf\n"
11782     "\n"
11783     "whereas `ndtri_exp` is still able to compute the result to high precision.\n"
11784     "\n"
11785     ">>> sc.ndtri_exp(-800)\n"
11786     "-39.88469483825668\n"
11787     ">>> sc.ndtri_exp(-1e-20)\n"
11788     "9.262340089798409")
11789 ufunc_ndtri_exp_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_f_f
11790 ufunc_ndtri_exp_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_d__As_d_d
11791 ufunc_ndtri_exp_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11792 ufunc_ndtri_exp_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11793 ufunc_ndtri_exp_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11794 ufunc_ndtri_exp_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11795 ufunc_ndtri_exp_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_ndtri_exp
11796 ufunc_ndtri_exp_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ndtri_exp")
11797 ufunc_ndtri_exp_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_ndtri_exp
11798 ufunc_ndtri_exp_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"ndtri_exp")
11799 ufunc_ndtri_exp_data[0] = &ufunc_ndtri_exp_ptr[2*0]
11800 ufunc_ndtri_exp_data[1] = &ufunc_ndtri_exp_ptr[2*1]
11801 ndtri_exp = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_ndtri_exp_loops, ufunc_ndtri_exp_data, ufunc_ndtri_exp_types, 2, 1, 1, 0, "ndtri_exp", ufunc_ndtri_exp_doc, 0)

11803 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nrdtrimn_loops[2]
11804 cdef void *ufunc_nrdtrimn_ptr[4]
11805 cdef void *ufunc_nrdtrimn_data[2]
11806 cdef char ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[8]
11807 cdef char *ufunc_nrdtrimn_doc = (
11808     "nrdtrimn(p, std, x, out=None)\n"
11809     "\n"
11810     "Calculate mean of normal distribution given other params.\n"
11811     "\n"
11812     "Parameters\n"
11813     "----------\n"
11814     "p : array_like\n"
11815     "    CDF values, in range (0, 1].\n"
11816     "std : array_like\n"
11817     "    Standard deviation.\n"
11818     "x : array_like\n"
11819     "    Quantiles, i.e. the upper limit of integration.\n"
11820     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11821     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11822     "\n"
11823     "Returns\n"
11824     "-------\n"
11825     "mn : scalar or ndarray\n"
11826     "    The mean of the normal distribution.\n"
11827     "\n"
11828     "See Also\n"
11829     "--------\n"
11830     "scipy.stats.norm : Normal distribution\n"
11831     "ndtr : Standard normal cumulative probability distribution\n"
11832     "ndtri : Inverse of standard normal CDF with respect to quantile\n"
11833     "nrdtrisd : Inverse of normal distribution CDF with respect to\n"
11834     "           standard deviation\n"
11835     "\n"
11836     "Examples\n"
11837     "--------\n"
11838     "`nrdtrimn` can be used to recover the mean of a normal distribution\n"
11839     "if we know the CDF value `p` for a given quantile `x` and the\n"
11840     "standard deviation `std`. First, we calculate\n"
11841     "the normal distribution CDF for an exemplary parameter set.\n"
11842     "\n"
11843     ">>> from scipy.stats import norm\n"
11844     ">>> mean = 3.\n"
11845     ">>> std = 2.\n"
11846     ">>> x = 6.\n"
11847     ">>> p = norm.cdf(x, loc=mean, scale=std)\n"
11848     ">>> p\n"
11849     "0.9331927987311419\n"
11850     "\n"
11851     "Verify that `nrdtrimn` returns the original value for `mean`.\n"
11852     "\n"
11853     ">>> from scipy.special import nrdtrimn\n"
11854     ">>> nrdtrimn(p, std, x)\n"
11855     "3.0000000000000004")
11856 ufunc_nrdtrimn_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_fff_f
11857 ufunc_nrdtrimn_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_ddd__As_ddd_d
11858 ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11859 ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11860 ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11861 ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11862 ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11863 ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11864 ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11865 ufunc_nrdtrimn_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11866 ufunc_nrdtrimn_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_nrdtrimn
11867 ufunc_nrdtrimn_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nrdtrimn")
11868 ufunc_nrdtrimn_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_nrdtrimn
11869 ufunc_nrdtrimn_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"nrdtrimn")
11870 ufunc_nrdtrimn_data[0] = &ufunc_nrdtrimn_ptr[2*0]
11871 ufunc_nrdtrimn_data[1] = &ufunc_nrdtrimn_ptr[2*1]
11872 nrdtrimn = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_nrdtrimn_loops, ufunc_nrdtrimn_data, ufunc_nrdtrimn_types, 2, 3, 1, 0, "nrdtrimn", ufunc_nrdtrimn_doc, 0)

11874 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_nrdtrisd_loops[2]
11875 cdef void *ufunc_nrdtrisd_ptr[4]
11876 cdef void *ufunc_nrdtrisd_data[2]
11877 cdef char ufunc_nrdtrisd_types[8]
11878 cdef char *ufunc_nrdtrisd_doc = (
11879     "nrdtrisd(mn, p, x, out=None)\n"
11880     "\n"
11881     "Calculate standard deviation of normal distribution given other params.\n"
11882     "\n"
11883     "Parameters\n"
11884     "----------\n"
11885     "mn : scalar or ndarray\n"
11886     "    The mean of the normal distribution.\n"
11887     "p : array_like\n"
11888     "    CDF values, in range (0, 1].\n"
11889     "x : array_like\n"
11890     "    Quantiles, i.e. the upper limit of integration.\n"
11891     "\n"
11892     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11893     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11894     "\n"
11895     "Returns\n"
11896     "-------\n"
11897     "std : scalar or ndarray\n"
11898     "    Standard deviation.\n"
11899     "\n"
11900     "See Also\n"
11901     "--------\n"
11902     "scipy.stats.norm : Normal distribution\n"
11903     "ndtr : Standard normal cumulative probability distribution\n"
11904     "ndtri : Inverse of standard normal CDF with respect to quantile\n"
11905     "nrdtrimn : Inverse of normal distribution CDF with respect to\n"
11906     "           mean\n"
11907     "\n"
11908     "Examples\n"
11909     "--------\n"
11910     "`nrdtrisd` can be used to recover the standard deviation of a normal\n"
11911     "distribution if we know the CDF value `p` for a given quantile `x` and\n"
11912     "the mean `mn`. First, we calculate the normal distribution CDF for an\n"
11913     "exemplary parameter set.\n"
11914     "\n"
11915     ">>> from scipy.stats import norm\n"
11916     ">>> mean = 3.\n"
11917     ">>> std = 2.\n"
11918     ">>> x = 6.\n"
11919     ">>> p = norm.cdf(x, loc=mean, scale=std)\n"
11920     ">>> p\n"
11921     "0.9331927987311419\n"
11922     "\n"
11923     "Verify that `nrdtrisd` returns the original value for `std`.\n"
11924     "\n"
11925     ">>> from scipy.special import nrdtrisd\n"
11926     ">>> nrdtrisd(mean, p, x)\n"
11927     "2.0000000000000004")

11946 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_owens_t_loops[2]
11947 cdef void *ufunc_owens_t_ptr[4]
11948 cdef void *ufunc_owens_t_data[2]
11949 cdef char ufunc_owens_t_types[6]
11950 cdef char *ufunc_owens_t_doc = (
11951     "owens_t(h, a, out=None)\n"
11952     "\n"
11953     "Owen's T Function.\n"
11954     "\n"
11955     "The function T(h, a) gives the probability of the event\n"
11956     "(X > h and 0 < Y < a * X) where X and Y are independent\n"
11957     "standard normal random variables.\n"
11958     "\n"
11959     "Parameters\n"
11960     "----------\n"
11961     "h: array_like\n"
11962     "    Input value.\n"
11963     "a: array_like\n"
11964     "    Input value.\n"
11965     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
11966     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
11967     "\n"
11968     "Returns\n"
11969     "-------\n"
11970     "t: scalar or ndarray\n"
11971     "    Probability of the event (X > h and 0 < Y < a * X),\n"
11972     "    where X and Y are independent standard normal random variables.\n"
11973     "\n"
11974     "References\n"
11975     "----------\n"
11976     ".. [1] M. Patefield and D. Tandy, \"Fast and accurate calculation of\n"
11977     "       Owen's T Function\", Statistical Software vol. 5, pp. 1-25, 2000.\n"
11978     "\n"
11979     "Examples\n"
11980     "--------\n"
11981     ">>> from scipy import special\n"
11982     ">>> a = 3.5\n"
11983     ">>> h = 0.78\n"
11984     ">>> special.owens_t(h, a)\n"
11985     "0.10877216734852274")
11986 ufunc_owens_t_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f

11988 ufunc_owens_t_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11989 ufunc_owens_t_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11990 ufunc_owens_t_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
11991 ufunc_owens_t_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11992 ufunc_owens_t_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11993 ufunc_owens_t_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
11994 ufunc_owens_t_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_owens_t
11995 ufunc_owens_t_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"owens_t")
11996 ufunc_owens_t_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_owens_t
