12002 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_pdtr_loops[2]
12003 cdef void *ufunc_pdtr_ptr[4]
12004 cdef void *ufunc_pdtr_data[2]
12005 cdef char ufunc_pdtr_types[6]
12006 cdef char *ufunc_pdtr_doc = (
12007     "pdtr(k, m, out=None)\n"
12008     "\n"
12009     "Poisson cumulative distribution function.\n"
12010     "\n"
12011     "Defined as the probability that a Poisson-distributed random\n"
12012     "variable with event rate :math:`m` is less than or equal to\n"
12013     ":math:`k`. More concretely, this works out to be [1]_\n"
12014     "\n"
12015     ".. math::\n"
12016     "\n"
12017     "   \\exp(-m) \\sum_{j = 0}^{\\lfloor{k}\\rfloor} \\frac{m^j}{j!}.\n"
12018     "\n"
12019     "Parameters\n"
12020     "----------\n"
12021     "k : array_like\n"
12022     "    Number of occurrences (nonnegative, real)\n"
12023     "m : array_like\n"
12024     "    Shape parameter (nonnegative, real)\n"
12025     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
12026     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
12027     "\n"
12028     "Returns\n"
12029     "-------\n"
12030     "scalar or ndarray\n"
12031     "    Values of the Poisson cumulative distribution function\n"
12032     "\n"
12033     "See Also\n"
12034     "--------\n"
12035     "pdtrc : Poisson survival function\n"
12036     "pdtrik : inverse of `pdtr` with respect to `k`\n"
12037     "pdtri : inverse of `pdtr` with respect to `m`\n"
12038     "\n"
12039     "References\n"
12040     "----------\n"
12041     ".. [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poisson_distribution\n"
12042     "\n"
12043     "Examples\n"
12044     "--------\n"
12045     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
12046     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
12047     "\n"
12048     "It is a cumulative distribution function, so it converges to 1\n"
12049     "monotonically as `k` goes to infinity.\n"
12050     "\n"
12051     ">>> sc.pdtr([1, 10, 100, np.inf], 1)\n"
12052     "array([0.73575888, 0.99999999, 1.        , 1.        ])\n"
12053     "\n"
12054     "It is discontinuous at integers and constant between integers.\n"
12055     "\n"
12056     ">>> sc.pdtr([1, 1.5, 1.9, 2], 1)\n"
12057     "array([0.73575888, 0.73575888, 0.73575888, 0.9196986 ])")
12058 ufunc_pdtr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
12059 ufunc_pdtr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
12060 ufunc_pdtr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12061 ufunc_pdtr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12062 ufunc_pdtr_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12063 ufunc_pdtr_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12064 ufunc_pdtr_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12065 ufunc_pdtr_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12066 ufunc_pdtr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_pdtr
12067 ufunc_pdtr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pdtr")
12068 ufunc_pdtr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_pdtr
12069 ufunc_pdtr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pdtr")
12070 ufunc_pdtr_data[0] = &ufunc_pdtr_ptr[2*0]
12071 ufunc_pdtr_data[1] = &ufunc_pdtr_ptr[2*1]
12072 pdtr = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_pdtr_loops, ufunc_pdtr_data, ufunc_pdtr_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "pdtr", ufunc_pdtr_doc, 0)
12073 
12074 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_pdtrc_loops[2]
12075 cdef void *ufunc_pdtrc_ptr[4]
12076 cdef void *ufunc_pdtrc_data[2]
12077 cdef char ufunc_pdtrc_types[6]
12078 cdef char *ufunc_pdtrc_doc = (
12079     "pdtrc(k, m, out=None)\n"
12080     "\n"
12081     "Poisson survival function\n"
12082     "\n"
12083     "Returns the sum of the terms from k+1 to infinity of the Poisson\n"
12084     "distribution: sum(exp(-m) * m**j / j!, j=k+1..inf) = gammainc(\n"
12085     "k+1, m). Arguments must both be non-negative doubles.\n"
12086     "\n"
12087     "Parameters\n"
12088     "----------\n"
12089     "k : array_like\n"
12090     "    Number of occurrences (nonnegative, real)\n"
12091     "m : array_like\n"
12092     "    Shape parameter (nonnegative, real)\n"
12093     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
12094     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
12095     "\n"
12096     "Returns\n"
12097     "-------\n"
12098     "scalar or ndarray\n"
12099     "    Values of the Poisson survival function\n"
12100     "\n"
12101     "See Also\n"
12102     "--------\n"
12103     "pdtr : Poisson cumulative distribution function\n"
12104     "pdtrik : inverse of `pdtr` with respect to `k`\n"
12105     "pdtri : inverse of `pdtr` with respect to `m`\n"
12106     "\n"
12107     "Examples\n"
12108     "--------\n"
12109     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
12110     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
12111     "\n"
12112     "It is a survival function, so it decreases to 0\n"
12113     "monotonically as `k` goes to infinity.\n"
12114     "\n"
12115     ">>> k = np.array([1, 10, 100, np.inf])\n"
12116     ">>> sc.pdtrc(k, 1)\n"
12117     "array([2.64241118e-001, 1.00477664e-008, 3.94147589e-161, 0.00000000e+000])\n"
12118     "\n"
12119     "It can be expressed in terms of the lower incomplete gamma\n"
12120     "function `gammainc`.\n"
12121     "\n"
12122     ">>> sc.gammainc(k + 1, 1)\n"
12123     "array([2.64241118e-001, 1.00477664e-008, 3.94147589e-161, 0.00000000e+000])")
12124 ufunc_pdtrc_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
12125 ufunc_pdtrc_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
12126 ufunc_pdtrc_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12127 ufunc_pdtrc_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12128 ufunc_pdtrc_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12129 ufunc_pdtrc_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12130 ufunc_pdtrc_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12131 ufunc_pdtrc_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12132 ufunc_pdtrc_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_xsf_pdtrc
12133 ufunc_pdtrc_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pdtrc")
12134 ufunc_pdtrc_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_xsf_pdtrc
12135 ufunc_pdtrc_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pdtrc")
12136 ufunc_pdtrc_data[0] = &ufunc_pdtrc_ptr[2*0]
12137 ufunc_pdtrc_data[1] = &ufunc_pdtrc_ptr[2*1]
12138 pdtrc = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_pdtrc_loops, ufunc_pdtrc_data, ufunc_pdtrc_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "pdtrc", ufunc_pdtrc_doc, 0)
12139 
12140 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_pdtri_loops[3]
12141 cdef void *ufunc_pdtri_ptr[6]
12142 cdef void *ufunc_pdtri_data[3]
12143 cdef char ufunc_pdtri_types[9]
12144 cdef char *ufunc_pdtri_doc = (
12145     "pdtri(k, y, out=None)\n"
12146     "\n"
12147     "Inverse to `pdtr` vs m\n"
12148     "\n"
12149     "Returns the Poisson variable `m` such that the sum from 0 to `k` of\n"
12150     "the Poisson density is equal to the given probability `y`:\n"
12151     "calculated by ``gammaincinv(k + 1, y)``. `k` must be a nonnegative\n"
12152     "integer and `y` between 0 and 1.\n"
12153     "\n"
12154     "Parameters\n"
12155     "----------\n"
12156     "k : array_like\n"
12157     "    Number of occurrences (nonnegative, real)\n"
12158     "y : array_like\n"
12159     "    Probability\n"
12160     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
12161     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
12162     "\n"
12163     "Returns\n"
12164     "-------\n"
12165     "scalar or ndarray\n"
12166     "    Values of the shape parameter `m` such that ``pdtr(k, m) = p``\n"
12167     "\n"
12168     "See Also\n"
12169     "--------\n"
12170     "pdtr : Poisson cumulative distribution function\n"
12171     "pdtrc : Poisson survival function\n"
12172     "pdtrik : inverse of `pdtr` with respect to `k`\n"
12173     "\n"
12174     "Examples\n"
12175     "--------\n"
12176     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
12177     "\n"
12178     "Compute the CDF for several values of `m`:\n"
12179     "\n"
12180     ">>> m = [0.5, 1, 1.5]\n"
12181     ">>> p = sc.pdtr(1, m)\n"
12182     ">>> p\n"
12183     "array([0.90979599, 0.73575888, 0.5578254 ])\n"
12184     "\n"
12185     "Compute the inverse. We recover the values of `m`, as expected:\n"
12186     "\n"
12187     ">>> sc.pdtri(1, p)\n"
12188     "array([0.5, 1. , 1.5])")
12189 ufunc_pdtri_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_pd__As_pd_d
12190 ufunc_pdtri_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
12191 ufunc_pdtri_loops[2] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
12192 ufunc_pdtri_types[0] = <char>NPY_INTP
12193 ufunc_pdtri_types[1] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12194 ufunc_pdtri_types[2] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12195 ufunc_pdtri_types[3] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12196 ufunc_pdtri_types[4] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12197 ufunc_pdtri_types[5] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12198 ufunc_pdtri_types[6] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12199 ufunc_pdtri_types[7] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12200 ufunc_pdtri_types[8] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12201 ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_pdtri_wrap
12202 ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pdtri")
12203 ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_pdtri_unsafe
12204 ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pdtri")
12205 ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*2] = <void*>_func_pdtri_unsafe
12206 ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*2+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pdtri")
12207 ufunc_pdtri_data[0] = &ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*0]
12208 ufunc_pdtri_data[1] = &ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*1]
12209 ufunc_pdtri_data[2] = &ufunc_pdtri_ptr[2*2]
12210 pdtri = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_pdtri_loops, ufunc_pdtri_data, ufunc_pdtri_types, 3, 2, 1, 0, "pdtri", ufunc_pdtri_doc, 0)

12271 
12272 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_poch_loops[2]
12273 cdef void *ufunc_poch_ptr[4]
12274 cdef void *ufunc_poch_data[2]
12275 cdef char ufunc_poch_types[6]
12276 cdef char *ufunc_poch_doc = (
12277     "poch(z, m, out=None)\n"
12278     "\n"
12279     "Pochhammer symbol.\n"
12280     "\n"
12281     "The Pochhammer symbol (rising factorial) is defined as\n"
12282     "\n"
12283     ".. math::\n"
12284     "\n"
12285     "    (z)_m = \\frac{\\Gamma(z + m)}{\\Gamma(z)}\n"
12286     "\n"
12287     "For positive integer `m` it reads\n"
12288     "\n"
12289     ".. math::\n"
12290     "\n"
12291     "    (z)_m = z (z + 1) ... (z + m - 1)\n"
12292     "\n"
12293     "See [dlmf]_ for more details.\n"
12294     "\n"
12295     "Parameters\n"
12296     "----------\n"
12297     "z, m : array_like\n"
12298     "    Real-valued arguments.\n"
12299     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
12300     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
12301     "\n"
12302     "Returns\n"
12303     "-------\n"
12304     "scalar or ndarray\n"
12305     "    The value of the function.\n"
12306     "\n"
12307     "References\n"
12308     "----------\n"
12309     ".. [dlmf] Nist, Digital Library of Mathematical Functions\n"
12310     "    https://dlmf.nist.gov/5.2#iii\n"
12311     "\n"
12312     "Examples\n"
12313     "--------\n"
12314     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
12315     "\n"
12316     "It is 1 when m is 0.\n"
12317     "\n"
12318     ">>> sc.poch([1, 2, 3, 4], 0)\n"
12319     "array([1., 1., 1., 1.])\n"
12320     "\n"
12321     "For z equal to 1 it reduces to the factorial function.\n"
12322     "\n"
12323     ">>> sc.poch(1, 5)\n"
12324     "120.0\n"
12325     ">>> 1 * 2 * 3 * 4 * 5\n"
12326     "120\n"
12327     "\n"
12328     "It can be expressed in terms of the gamma function.\n"
12329     "\n"
12330     ">>> z, m = 3.7, 2.1\n"
12331     ">>> sc.poch(z, m)\n"
12332     "20.529581933776953\n"
12333     ">>> sc.gamma(z + m) / sc.gamma(z)\n"
12334     "20.52958193377696")
12335 ufunc_poch_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
12336 ufunc_poch_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
12337 ufunc_poch_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12338 ufunc_poch_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12339 ufunc_poch_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12340 ufunc_poch_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12341 ufunc_poch_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12342 ufunc_poch_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12343 ufunc_poch_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_cephes_poch
12344 ufunc_poch_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"poch")
12345 ufunc_poch_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_cephes_poch
12346 ufunc_poch_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"poch")
12347 ufunc_poch_data[0] = &ufunc_poch_ptr[2*0]
12348 ufunc_poch_data[1] = &ufunc_poch_ptr[2*1]
12349 poch = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_poch_loops, ufunc_poch_data, ufunc_poch_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "poch", ufunc_poch_doc, 0)
12350 
12351 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_powm1_loops[2]
12352 cdef void *ufunc_powm1_ptr[4]
12353 cdef void *ufunc_powm1_data[2]
12354 cdef char ufunc_powm1_types[6]
12355 cdef char *ufunc_powm1_doc = (
12356     "powm1(x, y, out=None)\n"
12357     "\n"
12358     "Computes ``x**y - 1``.\n"
12359     "\n"
12360     "This function is useful when `y` is near 0, or when `x` is near 1.\n"
12361     "\n"
12362     "The function is implemented for real types only (unlike ``numpy.power``,\n"
12363     "which accepts complex inputs).\n"
12364     "\n"
12365     "Parameters\n"
12366     "----------\n"
12367     "x : array_like\n"
12368     "    The base. Must be a real type (i.e. integer or float, not complex).\n"
12369     "y : array_like\n"
12370     "    The exponent. Must be a real type (i.e. integer or float, not complex).\n"
12371     "\n"
12372     "Returns\n"
12373     "-------\n"
12374     "array_like\n"
12375     "    Result of the calculation\n"
12376     "\n"
12377     "Notes\n"
12378     "-----\n"
12379     ".. versionadded:: 1.10.0\n"
12380     "\n"
12381     "The underlying code is implemented for single precision and double\n"
12382     "precision floats only.  Unlike `numpy.power`, integer inputs to\n"
12383     "`powm1` are converted to floating point, and complex inputs are\n"
12384     "not accepted.\n"
12385     "\n"
12386     "Note the following edge cases:\n"
12387     "\n"
12388     "* ``powm1(x, 0)`` returns 0 for any ``x``, including 0, ``inf``\n"
12389     "  and ``nan``.\n"
12390     "* ``powm1(1, y)`` returns 0 for any ``y``, including ``nan``\n"
12391     "  and ``inf``.\n"
12392     "\n"
12393     "This function wraps the ``powm1`` routine from the\n"
12394     "Boost Math C++ library [1]_.\n"
12395     "\n"
12396     "References\n"
12397     "----------\n"
12398     ".. [1] The Boost Developers. \"Boost C++ Libraries\". https://www.boost.org/.\n"
12399     "\n"
12400     "Examples\n"
12401     "--------\n"
12402     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
12403     ">>> from scipy.special import powm1\n"
12404     "\n"
12405     ">>> x = np.array([1.2, 10.0, 0.9999999975])\n"
12406     ">>> y = np.array([1e-9, 1e-11, 0.1875])\n"
12407     ">>> powm1(x, y)\n"
12408     "array([ 1.82321557e-10,  2.30258509e-11, -4.68749998e-10])\n"
12409     "\n"
12410     "It can be verified that the relative errors in those results\n"
12411     "are less than 2.5e-16.\n"
12412     "\n"
12413     "Compare that to the result of ``x**y - 1``, where the\n"
12414     "relative errors are all larger than 8e-8:\n"
12415     "\n"
12416     ">>> x**y - 1\n"
12417     "array([ 1.82321491e-10,  2.30258035e-11, -4.68750039e-10])")
12418 ufunc_powm1_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_f_ff__As_ff_f
12419 ufunc_powm1_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
12420 ufunc_powm1_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12421 ufunc_powm1_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12422 ufunc_powm1_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12423 ufunc_powm1_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12424 ufunc_powm1_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12425 ufunc_powm1_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12426 ufunc_powm1_ptr[2*0] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_powm1_float
12427 ufunc_powm1_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"powm1")
12428 ufunc_powm1_ptr[2*1] = <void*>scipy.special._ufuncs_cxx._export_powm1_double
12429 ufunc_powm1_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"powm1")
12430 ufunc_powm1_data[0] = &ufunc_powm1_ptr[2*0]
12431 ufunc_powm1_data[1] = &ufunc_powm1_ptr[2*1]
12432 powm1 = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_powm1_loops, ufunc_powm1_data, ufunc_powm1_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "powm1", ufunc_powm1_doc, 0)
12433 
12434 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_pseudo_huber_loops[2]
12435 cdef void *ufunc_pseudo_huber_ptr[4]
12436 cdef void *ufunc_pseudo_huber_data[2]
12437 cdef char ufunc_pseudo_huber_types[6]
12438 cdef char *ufunc_pseudo_huber_doc = (
12439     "pseudo_huber(delta, r, out=None)\n"
12440     "\n"
12441     "Pseudo-Huber loss function.\n"
12442     "\n"
12443     ".. math:: \\mathrm{pseudo\\_huber}(\\delta, r) =\n"
12444     "          \\delta^2 \\left( \\sqrt{ 1 + \\left( \\frac{r}{\\delta} \\right)^2 } - 1 \\right)\n"
12445     "\n"
12446     "Parameters\n"
12447     "----------\n"
12448     "delta : array_like\n"
12449     "    Input array, indicating the soft quadratic vs. linear loss changepoint.\n"
12450     "r : array_like\n"
12451     "    Input array, possibly representing residuals.\n"
12452     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
12453     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
12454     "\n"
12455     "Returns\n"
12456     "-------\n"
12457     "res : scalar or ndarray\n"
12458     "    The computed Pseudo-Huber loss function values.\n"
12459     "\n"
12460     "See Also\n"
12461     "--------\n"
12462     "huber: Similar function which this function approximates\n"
12463     "\n"
12464     "Notes\n"
12465     "-----\n"
12466     "Like `huber`, `pseudo_huber` often serves as a robust loss function\n"
12467     "in statistics or machine learning to reduce the influence of outliers.\n"
12468     "Unlike `huber`, `pseudo_huber` is smooth.\n"
12469     "\n"
12470     "Typically, `r` represents residuals, the difference\n"
12471     "between a model prediction and data. Then, for :math:`|r|\\leq\\delta`,\n"
12472     "`pseudo_huber` resembles the squared error and for :math:`|r|>\\delta` the\n"
12473     "absolute error. This way, the Pseudo-Huber loss often achieves\n"
12474     "a fast convergence in model fitting for small residuals like the squared\n"
12475     "error loss function and still reduces the influence of outliers\n"
12476     "(:math:`|r|>\\delta`) like the absolute error loss. As :math:`\\delta` is\n"
12477     "the cutoff between squared and absolute error regimes, it has\n"
12478     "to be tuned carefully for each problem. `pseudo_huber` is also\n"
12479     "convex, making it suitable for gradient based optimization. [1]_ [2]_\n"
12480     "\n"
12481     ".. versionadded:: 0.15.0\n"
12482     "\n"
12483     "References\n"
12484     "----------\n"
12485     ".. [1] Hartley, Zisserman, \"Multiple View Geometry in Computer Vision\".\n"
12486     "       2003. Cambridge University Press. p. 619\n"
12487     ".. [2] Charbonnier et al. \"Deterministic edge-preserving regularization\n"
12488     "       in computed imaging\". 1997. IEEE Trans. Image Processing.\n"
12489     "       6 (2): 298 - 311.\n"
12490     "\n"
12491     "Examples\n"
12492     "--------\n"
12493     "Import all necessary modules.\n"
12494     "\n"
12495     ">>> import numpy as np\n"
12496     ">>> from scipy.special import pseudo_huber, huber\n"
12497     ">>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n"
12498     "\n"
12499     "Calculate the function for ``delta=1`` at ``r=2``.\n"
12500     "\n"
12501     ">>> pseudo_huber(1., 2.)\n"
12502     "1.2360679774997898\n"
12503     "\n"
12504     "Calculate the function at ``r=2`` for different `delta` by providing\n"
12505     "a list or NumPy array for `delta`.\n"
12506     "\n"
12507     ">>> pseudo_huber([1., 2., 4.], 3.)\n"
12508     "array([2.16227766, 3.21110255, 4.        ])\n"
12509     "\n"
12510     "Calculate the function for ``delta=1`` at several points by providing\n"
12511     "a list or NumPy array for `r`.\n"
12512     "\n"
12513     ">>> pseudo_huber(2., np.array([1., 1.5, 3., 4.]))\n"
12514     "array([0.47213595, 1.        , 3.21110255, 4.94427191])\n"
12515     "\n"
12516     "The function can be calculated for different `delta` and `r` by\n"
12517     "providing arrays for both with compatible shapes for broadcasting.\n"
12518     "\n"
12519     ">>> r = np.array([1., 2.5, 8., 10.])\n"
12520     ">>> deltas = np.array([[1.], [5.], [9.]])\n"
12521     ">>> print(r.shape, deltas.shape)\n"
12522     "(4,) (3, 1)\n"
12523     "\n"
12524     ">>> pseudo_huber(deltas, r)\n"
12525     "array([[ 0.41421356,  1.6925824 ,  7.06225775,  9.04987562],\n"
12526     "       [ 0.49509757,  2.95084972, 22.16990566, 30.90169944],\n"
12527     "       [ 0.49846624,  3.06693762, 27.37435121, 40.08261642]])\n"
12528     "\n"
12529     "Plot the function for different `delta`.\n"
12530     "\n"
12531     ">>> x = np.linspace(-4, 4, 500)\n"
12532     ">>> deltas = [1, 2, 3]\n"
12533     ">>> linestyles = [\"dashed\", \"dotted\", \"dashdot\"]\n"
12534     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n"
12535     ">>> combined_plot_parameters = list(zip(deltas, linestyles))\n"
12536     ">>> for delta, style in combined_plot_parameters:\n"
12537     "...     ax.plot(x, pseudo_huber(delta, x), label=rf\"$\\delta={delta}$\",\n"
12538     "...             ls=style)\n"
12539     ">>> ax.legend(loc=\"upper center\")\n"
12540     ">>> ax.set_xlabel(\"$x$\")\n"
12541     ">>> ax.set_title(r\"Pseudo-Huber loss function $h_{\\delta}(x)$\")\n"
12542     ">>> ax.set_xlim(-4, 4)\n"
12543     ">>> ax.set_ylim(0, 8)\n"
12544     ">>> plt.show()\n"
12545     "\n"
12546     "Finally, illustrate the difference between `huber` and `pseudo_huber` by\n"
12547     "plotting them and their gradients with respect to `r`. The plot shows\n"
12548     "that `pseudo_huber` is continuously differentiable while `huber` is not\n"
12549     "at the points :math:`\\pm\\delta`.\n"
12550     "\n"
12551     ">>> def huber_grad(delta, x):\n"
12552     "...     grad = np.copy(x)\n"
12553     "...     linear_area = np.argwhere(np.abs(x) > delta)\n"
12554     "...     grad[linear_area]=delta*np.sign(x[linear_area])\n"
12555     "...     return grad\n"
12556     ">>> def pseudo_huber_grad(delta, x):\n"
12557     "...     return x* (1+(x/delta)**2)**(-0.5)\n"
12558     ">>> x=np.linspace(-3, 3, 500)\n"
12559     ">>> delta = 1.\n"
12560     ">>> fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(7, 7))\n"
12561     ">>> ax.plot(x, huber(delta, x), label=\"Huber\", ls=\"dashed\")\n"
12562     ">>> ax.plot(x, huber_grad(delta, x), label=\"Huber Gradient\", ls=\"dashdot\")\n"
12563     ">>> ax.plot(x, pseudo_huber(delta, x), label=\"Pseudo-Huber\", ls=\"dotted\")\n"
12564     ">>> ax.plot(x, pseudo_huber_grad(delta, x), label=\"Pseudo-Huber Gradient\",\n"
12565     "...         ls=\"solid\")\n"
12566     ">>> ax.legend(loc=\"upper center\")\n"
12567     ">>> plt.show()")
12568 ufunc_pseudo_huber_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
12569 ufunc_pseudo_huber_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
12570 ufunc_pseudo_huber_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12571 ufunc_pseudo_huber_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12572 ufunc_pseudo_huber_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12573 ufunc_pseudo_huber_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12574 ufunc_pseudo_huber_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12575 ufunc_pseudo_huber_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12576 ufunc_pseudo_huber_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_pseudo_huber
12577 ufunc_pseudo_huber_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pseudo_huber")
12578 ufunc_pseudo_huber_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_pseudo_huber
12579 ufunc_pseudo_huber_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"pseudo_huber")
12580 ufunc_pseudo_huber_data[0] = &ufunc_pseudo_huber_ptr[2*0]
12581 ufunc_pseudo_huber_data[1] = &ufunc_pseudo_huber_ptr[2*1]
12582 pseudo_huber = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_pseudo_huber_loops, ufunc_pseudo_huber_data, ufunc_pseudo_huber_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "pseudo_huber", ufunc_pseudo_huber_doc, 0)
12583 
12584 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_rel_entr_loops[2]
12585 cdef void *ufunc_rel_entr_ptr[4]
12586 cdef void *ufunc_rel_entr_data[2]
12587 cdef char ufunc_rel_entr_types[6]
12588 cdef char *ufunc_rel_entr_doc = (
12589     "rel_entr(x, y, out=None)\n"
12590     "\n"
12591     "Elementwise function for computing relative entropy.\n"
12592     "\n"
12593     ".. math::\n"
12594     "\n"
12595     "    \\mathrm{rel\\_entr}(x, y) =\n"
12596     "        \\begin{cases}\n"
12597     "            x \\log(x / y) & x > 0, y > 0 \\\\\n"
12598     "            0 & x = 0, y \\ge 0 \\\\\n"
12599     "            \\infty & \\text{otherwise}\n"
12600     "        \\end{cases}\n"
12601     "\n"
12602     "Parameters\n"
12603     "----------\n"
12604     "x, y : array_like\n"
12605     "    Input arrays\n"
12606     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
12607     "    Optional output array for the function results\n"
12608     "\n"
12609     "Returns\n"
12610     "-------\n"
12611     "scalar or ndarray\n"
12612     "    Relative entropy of the inputs\n"
12613     "\n"
12614     "See Also\n"
12615     "--------\n"
12616     "entr, kl_div, scipy.stats.entropy\n"
12617     "\n"
12618     "Notes\n"
12619     "-----\n"
12620     ".. versionadded:: 0.15.0\n"
12621     "\n"
12622     "This function is jointly convex in x and y.\n"
12623     "\n"
12624     "The origin of this function is in convex programming; see\n"
12625     "[1]_. Given two discrete probability distributions :math:`p_1,\n"
12626     "\\ldots, p_n` and :math:`q_1, \\ldots, q_n`, the definition of relative\n"
12627     "entropy in the context of *information theory* is\n"
12628     "\n"
12629     ".. math::\n"
12630     "\n"
12631     "    \\sum_{i = 1}^n \\mathrm{rel\\_entr}(p_i, q_i).\n"
12632     "\n"
12633     "To compute the latter quantity, use `scipy.stats.entropy`.\n"
12634     "\n"
12635     "See [2]_ for details.\n"
12636     "\n"
12637     "References\n"
12638     "----------\n"
12639     ".. [1] Boyd, Stephen and Lieven Vandenberghe. *Convex optimization*.\n"
12640     "       Cambridge University Press, 2004.\n"
12641     "       :doi:`https://doi.org/10.1017/CBO9780511804441`\n"
12642     ".. [2] Kullback-Leibler divergence,\n"
12643     "       https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kullback%E2%80%93Leibler_divergence")
12644 ufunc_rel_entr_loops[0] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_ff_f
12645 ufunc_rel_entr_loops[1] = <np.PyUFuncGenericFunction>loop_d_dd__As_dd_d
12646 ufunc_rel_entr_types[0] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12647 ufunc_rel_entr_types[1] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12648 ufunc_rel_entr_types[2] = <char>NPY_FLOAT
12649 ufunc_rel_entr_types[3] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12650 ufunc_rel_entr_types[4] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12651 ufunc_rel_entr_types[5] = <char>NPY_DOUBLE
12652 ufunc_rel_entr_ptr[2*0] = <void*>_func_rel_entr
12653 ufunc_rel_entr_ptr[2*0+1] = <void*>(<char*>"rel_entr")
12654 ufunc_rel_entr_ptr[2*1] = <void*>_func_rel_entr
12655 ufunc_rel_entr_ptr[2*1+1] = <void*>(<char*>"rel_entr")
12656 ufunc_rel_entr_data[0] = &ufunc_rel_entr_ptr[2*0]
12657 ufunc_rel_entr_data[1] = &ufunc_rel_entr_ptr[2*1]
12658 rel_entr = np.PyUFunc_FromFuncAndData(ufunc_rel_entr_loops, ufunc_rel_entr_data, ufunc_rel_entr_types, 2, 2, 1, 0, "rel_entr", ufunc_rel_entr_doc, 0)
12659 
12660 cdef np.PyUFuncGenericFunction ufunc_round_loops[2]
12661 cdef void *ufunc_round_ptr[4]
12662 cdef void *ufunc_round_data[2]
12663 cdef char ufunc_round_types[4]
12664 cdef char *ufunc_round_doc = (
12665     "round(x, out=None)\n"
12666     "\n"
12667     "Round to the nearest integer.\n"
12668     "\n"
12669     "Returns the nearest integer to `x`.  If `x` ends in 0.5 exactly,\n"
12670     "the nearest even integer is chosen.\n"
12671     "\n"
12672     "Parameters\n"
12673     "----------\n"
12674     "x : array_like\n"
12675     "    Real valued input.\n"
12676     "out : ndarray, optional\n"
12677     "    Optional output array for the function results.\n"
12678     "\n"
12679     "Returns\n"
12680     "-------\n"
12681     "scalar or ndarray\n"
12682     "    The nearest integers to the elements of `x`. The result is of\n"
12683     "    floating type, not integer type.\n"
12684     "\n"
12685     "Examples\n"
12686     "--------\n"
12687     ">>> import scipy.special as sc\n"
12688     "\n"
12689     "It rounds to even.\n"
12690     "\n"
12691     ">>> sc.round([0.5, 1.5])\n"
12692     "array([0., 2.])")
